Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description:Leidos Defense and Intelligence division is looking for a Business Process Analyst to support out NPC ITSS program in Millington, TN.Primary Responsibilities:-Support systems and business processes that facilitate Personnel Information Management, to include the Official Military Personnel File, Fitness and Evaluation Reports, Navy Selection Boards and any other business pertaining to Navy Personnel Command;-Evaluate and document current business processes and supporting business rules; recommend improvements;-Enalyze the systems and applications that support the business, and suggest enhancements within existing technical environments; capture and leverage efficiencies;-Facilitate documentation of detailed requirements for efforts to make system improvements;-Create and execute test plans; provide results of testing and remediation efforts;-Manage project meetings; provide agendas, action items and meeting minutes;-Provide periodic progress reports of projects in work, to include status and timelines;-Maintain a library of Standard Operating Procedures for all Leidos business processes that support Personnel Information Management;-Archive all documents in the official Personnel Information Management repository. Basic Qualifications:-Requires a BA degree and 4 - 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 - 6 years of prior relevant experience (additional experience, education and training may be considered in lieu of degree).-Knowledge of SDLC; experience with Agile project management principles.-Proficiency with MS products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio.Desired Qualifications:-Experience working with Navy personnel processes, systems and applications.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: mobi provides telematics, software-as-a-service solutions to companies that appreciate the need to optimize their fleet operations. We provide an end-to-end solution that helps companies plan work, optimize routes, visualize GPS data and analyze the results. We work with a wide range of customers, from Fortune 100 companies to small, regional businesses.  We save our customers millions of dollars in operating costs every month. The less they drive, the more they save. Our customers range from Fortune 100 companies to small, regional businesses. We partner with major network providers and channel specialists who represent all the key players in the fleet management space. We are a small, Austin-based company that has a global impact.  We are currently searching for a Business Analyst who is ready to jump right into our ‘work hard, play hard’ culture and thrive. TheBusiness Analyst job responsibilities include:Accurately translating Business Requirements into system functionality requirements.Working closely with client team on-site in a consultative role and translate requirements and defects to remote teamsInvolvement with all phases of development (analysis, design, coding, testing, deployment)Systems analysis on development of new and replacement application projectsGathering and developing detailed functional requirements for Object oriented multi-tier applicationsDesigning and facilitating user focus sessionsProviding technical assistance through UI Troubleshooting and DB troubleshooting using SQLRequired Qualifications:Capability to travel of up to 80% of available time in the USA and CanadaLocated within / near-abouts Austin, TX areaExperience with leading process improvement effortsExperience with iterative development methodologies, preferably AgileExcellent grasp of SDLC principles, preferably in an Agile environmentLarge scale deployment of custom integration across a large enterpriseExcellent documentation skills with attention to detail.Excellent problem solving and communication skills.Proficiency in SQLComfortable working within a consultancy environmentKnowledge of a testing methodology and/or experience in testing (System, Unit, Integration, Interface)Understanding of data modeling, object modeling and OO design principlesBachelor’s degree or higher in computer science or related fieldStrong understanding of capabilities and limitations of programming languages, middleware solutions, application servers and presentation layer tools is a plus, but not requiredExperience in Broadband/Telco and/or experience with real-time optimization is a plusTesting the software and performing QA on data integration projects when needed, or acting as the technical liaison to the Client’s development and QA teamWhy work for us? mobi is not only headquartered in the fastest growing technology center in the United States, but also literally at the center of it all in Austin, Texas at 7th and Congress. We offer the opportunity to work with other cutting-edge innovators in a fun and engaging environment.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: System Analyst needed for corporate office based in Memphis, TN. The System Analyst is essential to helping the Accounting department communicate operational performance to the executives. This job role will report directly to the Chief Financial Officer and while participating in data analysis tasks such as interviewing subject matter experts, documenting requirements, creating queries, building business intelligence reports and many other areas of ERP management and support.  This job role requires high caliber analytical thinking, technical and non-technical resourcefulness, and a timely response and resolution to issues and projects in a complex work environment. A self-starter is highly desired. To be successful in this role, the candidate should exhibit good troubleshooting skills, organization, and the ability to adapt to changes in pace of workload. The candidate should also be willing to learn and absorb new knowledge, maintain a good work ethic, and be willing to train other employees.  Candidates with this experience should email their resume to Edgin.Levy@roberthalf.com.

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: Application  The application opened in a new tab.  By using this feature you agree to our Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy.  Details Posted: November 20, 2018 Location: Memphis,  Show Map Salary: Open JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to provide analytical support through research, data collection and data management of information for the organization. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for data collection, data input and/or aggregation and data auditing to support accurate key metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization.  Reviews accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors.  Assists in generating Business As Usual (BAU) reports. Supports ad-hoc presentation/analysis development and responds to information requests from management.  This will be a help desk hybrid role. The individual will be analyzing data, and then making reports based on the data. They will be dispatching the tickets for the entire Americas area. This person will need to think independently, be able to identify trends, etc. They need to be customer service focused because they are interacting with clients. They will need to have the ability to manage a fast-paced environment. They will be working with Facilities Management, Property Management, and Critical Systems. They will be at a desk for the most part doing this job.  Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university. Master's degree preferred. 0-2 years of related experience.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None. COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Experience in the use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor. Name: Business Analyst 2-Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. Relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 2 plus years relevant work experience. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.*Operations BusinessAnalyst (46020.Business Analyst 2-Ops)* The Operations Business Analyst will be part of the Product Operations Group within the Communications Global Business Unit (CGBU). The analyst will specifically report to the financial team managed by Kim Wilson-Rivers. As such, the person will: Provideinformation to management by assembling and summarizing data; preparingreports; making presentations of findings, analyzes, and recommendations.  Reviewquarterly expenses to ensure that expenses are booked correctly and work withthe finance team to make any necessary reclassification  Assistin consolidating financials, headcount reporting, annual and quarterly reporting/forecasting  Increaseproductivity by developing automated reporting/forecasting tools  Buildfinancial models and performing a valuation analysis  Largescale data mining and business intelligence management  Workon ad-hoc projects/analyzes as needed *Skills & Qualifications:* Must havestrong analytical (quantitative as well as qualitative) skills includingbuilding models, prior data mining experience a plus  Attention todetail is critical.  Self-starterwith the ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and grow  Strongfinancial analysis foundation creating forecasts and models  Ability tocollect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Moderate to advancedproficiency with Microsoft Excel is required (Vlookups, formulas, pivot tablesetc.)  Familiaritywith data query/data management tools extremely helpful (Access, SQL, OracleBusiness Intelligence)  Must possessexcellent communication and presentation skills, and be comfortable interactingwith management  Follow-throughskills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and havedata errors/omissions corrected.  Ability tobuild and maintain relationships with counterparts in other functionalorganizations (Finance, Development, Legal, and Purchasing)  Goodorganizational & planning skills  Self-sufficient& task oriented  Proactiveattitude and capable of taking ownership over the processes  Bachelor sDegree in Business/Accounting/Finance/Economics  2 plus yearsrelevant work experience  U.S. orCanada based; Bedford, MA/Morrisville, NC/Frisco, TX preferred. Name: Advisor - Business Continuity
Description: Job DescriptionUnder the direction of the VP Administrative Operations and Information Security, provides leadership of ALSAC’s Business Continuity Management Program. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, long-term and short-term strategic planning for ALSAC’s business continuity program; creation and maintenance of enterprise level business continuity and emergency response plans; providing leadership and direction for division business continuity coordinators in the development and maintenance of division level business continuity plans; establishing enterprise-wide awareness programs, developing and leading disaster exercises for the organization; budgeting for enterprise and division level business continuity program. Name: FastPay Analyst
Description: Job SummaryHilton's Commercial Services organization is comprised of over 5,000 team members driving our sales, revenue management, call center, and analytics functions. These functions are the core of Hilton's commercial engine and are key to Hilton's ability to drive profitable growth. What will I be doing?The Distribution Services (DS) team plays a critical role in supporting the Global Sales Organization. We create automated solutions that aid in the execution of the retail compensation component of Hilton's partner agreements with Online Travel Agencies (OTAs), Travel Management Companies (TMCs), Meeting Planner Companies (MPCs), and key accounts globally. The Group Commissions and Customer Service team within Distribution Services supports the meeting planner compensation needs of over 4,000+ hotels in the US, Canada, and Mexico. As the FastPay Analyst, you will be responsible for the timely and accurate payment of FastPay Meetings. You will have established production goals to maintain with a key objective of the role being to ensure that the commission related needs of our hotels and our meeting planner companies are met/exceeded in a timely manner. More specifically, you will:Research information and analyze data to arrive at objective conclusions, recommendations, and plans of actions within the FastPay program.Recommend enhancements as it relates to FastPay.Facilitate the commission payment process cycle through research, special projects, and internal control procedures.Facilitate the commission payment to Meeting Planner Companies (MPCs) participating in the Distribution Services FastPay program.Perform reconciliations of hotel supporting documentation to MPC invoices. This includes researching, resolving and reporting any variances.Support all US, Canada and Mexico Hilton branded properties participating in the program. This involves providing guidance on required approvals, information input and meeting pickup for processing commission payments. In addition, you will assist with any adjustments, as applicable.Provide customer service support to MPCs.Perform functions related to special projects and ad hoc requests.What are we looking for?We are seeking problem solvers, who are passionate about growing within a dynamic industry and who love to combine their analytical skills with business insight. The success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:Self-starters, who take initiative in implementing goals, utilize analytical skills and possess flexibility to changeAccountable individuals, who make great use of their time management skills to exceed in meeting deadlines, communicating results and recommending improvementsStrong communicators, influencers and solution-seekers, who effectively communicate at all levels of the organizationOrganizers, who have superb attention to detail and possess a high level of positive energy and driveTo fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience:High School Diploma/GEDProfessional experience in Finance, Accounting or Customer ServiceKnowledgeable of all Travel Agency Commission (TAC)-processing systems for research and special projectsIt would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:AA/AS Associate's DegreeThree (3) years of Finance, Accounting or Customer Service experienceKnowledge of all FastPay processesKnowledge of TAC's policies and procedures for all brandsWhat will it be like to work for Hilton?Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Name: Credit Analyst - Commercial Banking
Description: Requisition Number 18-2167 Post Date 11/30/2018 Title Credit Analyst - Commercial Banking Part Time? No City Memphis State TN Description First Tennessee is looking for an individual with strong interpersonal skills as well as a solid background in finance and/or accounting. This position is for a Credit Analyst in the MidSouth Commercial Banking Group located in East Memphis. The Commercial  Banking Group is responsible for managing and underwriting banking relationships (comprised of loans, deposits and other products) of locally owned businesses.  The Credit Analyst (CA) is an entry level position into the Mid-South Commercial Banking Group of First Tennessee Bank. The CA will work directly with the deal team in analyzing, underwriting and monitoring all credit facilities within their portfolio. As a  CA, the individual will learn the basics of deal making and loan structures while being exposed to other departments within the Bank. The CA is an excellent first position in banking that paves the way to numerous other positions within First Tennessee including  sales, credit, relationship management, loan review or other similar positions. Duties and Responsibilities: Work with the Portfolio Manager (PM) and Relationship Manager (RM) in completing the credit analysis. The credit analysis is Commercial Banking's primary document for analyzing and underwriting all new and outstanding loans. The credit analysis performs an  in depth analysis on the borrower's ability to repay focusing on the company and owner's background, recent and historical financial performance, guarantor's (if applicable) financial condition, and several other factors related to First Tennessee's underwriting  policies and guidelines.  Support the PM and RM team in managing the client relationship as needed. The Credit Analyst will sit in on credit meetings as needed and join the RM on client calls on occasion. Requirements Bachelors degree required, Finance or Accounting major preferred. At a minimum, the candidate should have exposure to finance and accounting through completed college courses or relevant work experience. M - F 8AM - 5PM #LI-PF1All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender stereo typing, and age. First Tennessee is an EO employer – M/F/Vets/Disabled.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here.

Name: Global Talent- Business Analyst
Description: Location: Memphis, TN Job DescriptionRole Overview:  We have a unique opportunity for a highly analytical and detailed individual who loves data analytics. This individual will work on an interactive team and will support all of the core Global Talent Acquisition (TA) initiatives. This critical role will focus on data mining and extraction, reporting, metrics and trend identification. This person will also play a key role in vendor selection & proactive management, as well as provide resolution of issues escalated by internal customers in our high-touch environment.  Responsibilities:  Analytics & Reporting  Develops Global TA analytics to identify trends, create projections, and provide relevant reports to support TA programs.  Serves as dedicated S&N Workday-Recruitment SME to track, report and support future TA activities and initiatives using organizational metrics. Regularly provides reports to TA Leadership and ensures recruitment team uses data and results to monitor and improve outcomes.  Partners with HR leaders to help solve market-based issues impacting workforce availability, retention, and offer acceptance.  Supports Global TA initiatives to drive standardized processes, tools, and systems across our organization.  Market Research  Researches new recruiting technologies & strategies, and makes recommendations for improvement to Director of Global TA Process Excellence.  Works closely with vendors in evaluating their tools/services and compares offerings. Provides summary of findings to Global TA Leadership.  Provides project management and training support in the implementation of new Global TA initiatives.  Location: Memphis TN  Education:  Bachelor's degree in business, finance, or other related majors  Must be in excellent academic standing, with a 3.0 GPA or above preferred  Experience:  Previous applicable internship, co-op, part-time or apprenticeship experience is preferred.  Competences:  Demonstrated leadership experience preferred; a proven and effective project leader preferred.  Strong communication skills including technical writing, listening and speaking; ability to influence others  High learning agility with the ability to analyze and synthesize data and then present it to senior leaders  Must be able to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams and drive project completion  Independent thinking and the ability to work within a team is required  Ability to assess technical issues and develop solutions utilizing an analytical approach to problem solving  Requires the ability to manage tight deadlines, multiple tasks, assignment changes, periodic heavy workload, rapidly changing technology, and dynamic business growth; time management and organization skills are a must  Must be proficient with both Excel and PowerPoint, and experience with Workday a plus (but not required).  Physical Demands  Travel Requirements:

Name: Global Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Job Title:Global Supply Chain Analyst - Memphis TNJob Description: We are hiring for 3 positions  The Supply Chain Analyst will utilize analytical and quantitative methods to understand, predict, and enhance supply chain processes. This position will be responsible for driving key performance metrics to world class levels. Responsible for assembling data, analyzing performance, identifying problems, and developing recommendations which support Wright Supply Chain planning and operations. Essential Job Functions:Gathers and interprets relevant inventory data (costs, productivity, demand patterns, etc.)Identifies and prevents problems in the supply chain that can result in lost sales, reduced customer loyalty and decreased profits through investigation, finding root causes, developing and recommending solutions related to Planning and operations.Identify gaps in efficiency and other areas needing improvement.Maintain databases, prepare reports, track product flow, and develop solutions to supply chain problems and inefficiencies to help the organization increase cash flows, inventory turns and our customers’ satisfaction.Use models to develop cost efficiencies and improve the flow of goods from raw materials through production and deliveryDevelops periodic supply chain performance reports, metrics decks and distributes them to stakeholders.Coordinates delivery schedules and other supply chain activities Provides analytical support for supply chain projects, new business opportunities, and proposals.Skills:Strong attention to detailStrong quantitative and analytical skillsAbility to plan and analyze complex processesData mining and extrapolation skillsProactive approach to problem solving.Familiarity with logistics and production planning concepts (e.g., materials requirement planning);Proficiency in computer software programs and databases—database, spreadsheet, SQL, Access, statistics applications, and logistics software packages)Self-directedAbility to communicate findings, make recommendations, and facilitate changeEffective interpersonal skills when dealing with employees at all levels.Education and Experience Requirements:Master’s Degree in Supply Chain or Logistics required.2 or more years of years’ experience in Supply Chain or LogisticsAPIC’s certification or training preferredLean Six 6 sigma certification or training preferred

resources on large initiatives1-2 years of Manhattan Associates systems experience, or 2-3 years experience of using other systems.Knowledge of solution development life cycle methodology and appropriate techniques, including waterfall, agile, prototyping, and package enable configurationsExperience working on projects and meeting project compliance requirementsAbility to analyze complex multi-divisional requirements, seeking to optimize unique vs. shared solutions appropriatelyAbility to define and drive requirements, testing, end user satisfaction and acceptanceStrong organizational, presentation, and business partnering skills Ability to communicate and negotiate with senior and line level business clients regarding project scope, status, options and change managementProven knowledge and experience with leading packaged supply chain solutions, specifically warehouse management, labor management, and transportation management solutionsStrong understanding of IT regulations including SOX, PCI and privacy laws, security methodologies, controls and access.Waterfall and Agile project planning experienceWhat's In It For You? Name: Junior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description Serco, Inc. is looking to fill a Junior Business Systems Analyst position for our Millington, TN location. The roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following.Military Veterans and Spouses are encouraged to apply!Applicants may be required to complete an Excel/Access skills sheet, and answer a Navy and Excel questionnaire to determine experience level.Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs.Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complicated tasks. May lead and direct the work of others. May report directly to a project lead or manager. Required Skills May require a Bachelor's Degree in a related area and two to four years of experience in the field or in a related area. This position supports a U.S. Government contract whose terms require Serco to staff it only with U.S. Citizens. The position you are being considered for in on a U.S. Government contract which will require that you are able to obtain/maintain eligibility for a Secret Clearance. Secret Eligibility – a favorable suitability determination required. Minimum of two years professional MPTE and an in-depth, working knowledge of existing and evolving tools, and decision support systems, as well as an understanding of the principles and functions of planning, community management, recruiting, training management and distribution. Technical knowledge may encompass all components of the enlisted personnel, billet files, and decision support tools. Must possess intermediate to advance level skills in Microsoft Office to include Excel. Must have extensive advanced excel skills. Interview may include a test for building macros from scratch, pivot tables, and etc. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Travel may be required. PREFERRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE Secret Clearance preferred. Five years relevant work experience preferred. Prefer personnel with knowledge of Navy MPTE metrics and the ability to determine new Supply Chain related corporate metrics. Employment Type Full time Career Level Mid Career Job ID 52470478 Company Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc, one of the world’s leading and most admired service companies. Serco serves Federal, state and local governments, along with the Canadian government and commercial customers. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently, while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Reston, VA, Serco has approximately 10,000 employees with an annual revenue of $1 billion and is part of a $6 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. Serco recognizes that our employees are our most valuable asset. Our successes directly relate to our employees. At Serco, we listen, respect and support our employees and through continuous training, development and information-sharing, we advance talent internally, enhancing career growth and progression which enables not only our employees to excel but enables our customers to excel as well. Our employees personally can make a difference. It is not just a job at Serco; at Serco, we offer career opportunities. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco's people share a passion for delivering ethical service, innovation, and a commitment to results. Our focus on Bringing Service to Life is more than a tagline, it’s the way we get things done, the way we talk with each other, and the way we interact and respect each other. We succeed by encouraging and generating new ideas. We trust our people to deliver. We are passionate about building innovative and successful Serco businesses. Our most powerful tool in improving performance is to instill a stimulating culture where people feel they can personally make a difference. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets). Functional AreaStrategy & Transformation DepartmentOur services in the Defense business unit support all branches of the U.S. military and the intelligence community. Our teams provide a variety of support services related to the maintenance and life cycle sustainment of US Navy, US Coast Guard and Customs and Border Patrol fielded C5I systems. We are focused on the design, systems engineering, project management, procurement, installation, training, testing, and field maintenance of these systems. We also provide personnel services to military personnel, military families, and civilians working for the military. Our capabilities address a wide range of managed services, as well as the complete military lifecycle which includes recruitment, to active duty through retirement. And for the Intel community we have over 300 cleared professionals who serve a variety of Intelligence Community and Department of Defense customers who stand on the front lines of defense for our nation. The unit employee’s specialists focused on acquisition and program management, systems engineering, cyber security, signals and intelligence analysis, financial management, human capital, and information technology.

See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities.  30 Percent or More Disabled Veterans  Current Department of Army Civilian Employees  Current Permanent Department of Defense (DOD) Civilian Employee (non-Army)  Executive Order (E.O.) 12721  Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan  Military Spouses, under Executive Order (E.O.) 13473  Non-Appropriated Fund Instrumentality (NAFI)  Non-Department of Defense (DoD) Transfer  Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Interchange Agreement Eligible  People with Disabilities, Schedule A  Postal Service/Peace Corps and Other Unique Authorities  Priority Placement Program (PPP), Program S (Military Spouse) registrant  Reinstatement  Veterans Recruitment Appointment (VRA)  In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.  Specialized Experience For GS-09: One year of specialized experience which includes generating output from a variety of administrative and/or technical program application; monitoring project schedules; and assisting in the budget evaluation process by performing duties such as, tracking obligations and expenditures, preparing budget submissions, coordinating cost estimates, or allocating project resources. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-07). OR Education: Master's or equivalent graduate degree or 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree or LL.B. or J.D. in a field which demonstrates the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position. OR Combination of Education and Experience: A combination of education and experience may be used to qualify for this position as long as the computed percentage of the requirements is at least 100%. To compute the percentage of the requirements, divide your total months of experience by 12. Then divide the total number of completed graduate semester hours (or equivalent) beyond the first year (total graduate semester hours minus 18) by 18. Add the two percentages.  You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas:  Budget Administration  Control of Funds  Organizational Development  Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-07). Education FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. Name: Seed Order Analyst
Description: Indigo is a company dedicated to harnessing nature to help farmers sustainably feed the planet. With a vision of creating a world where farming is an economically desirable and accessible profession, Indigo works alongside its growers to apply natural approaches, conserve resources for future generations, and grow healthy food for all. Utilizing beneficial plant microbes to improve crop health and productivity, Indigo's portfolio is focused on cotton, wheat, barley, corn, soybeans, and rice. The company, founded by Flagship Pioneering, is headquartered in Boston, MA, with additional offices in Memphis, TN, Research Triangle Park, NC, Sydney, Australia, Buenos Aires, Argentina, and São Paulo, Brazil. www.indigoag.comThe role of Seed Order Analyst will be the expert for Indigo's sales data analysis and reporting. The Seed Order Analyst will review and analyze data, build reports, and offer solutions to sales and cross functions for transparency into Indigo Sales performance. This role is based in Memphis, TN. Reporting to the Sales Operations Coordinator, this position will be the liaison between Commercial in Memphis and I.T. in Boston to structure Salesforce and other systems and processes for successful utilization by management and the sales team. This role is based in Memphis, TN.Outcomes & Responsibilities:Showcase the adaptability across multi-functional software platforms, with creative approach to breach connectivity gaps as they are showcased with ability to reconcile different platform information to True Up gapsSuccessfully identify any discrepancies between orders and product selection as well as identifying the changes from contracts/seed order connectionsRespond to ad-hoc or "one off" issues effectively. Ability to propose resolution to lower the amount of "one offs" along with the ability to reconcile the "one off" situationsSeamlessly process all needed materials effectively with creative changes to help streamline the functionalityManage continuous improvement updates and evolution of SalesForce based on company needs and shifting prioritiesWork closely with Supply Chain and Account Managers to perform and build analysis that is additive to performance and timeliness of Seed OrdersServe as a liaison with all key stakeholders to communicate effectively change and resolution to issues as they ariseEffectively identify reporting gaps and expedite resolutions that are effective for Sales, Sales Operations, and Supply ChainCompetencies:Analytical mindsetCan visualize data and put numbers to graphs/chartsUnderstand business admin work flowsComfortable with ambiguity and changeDetail orientedHighly organizedCustomer service orientedExcellent cross-functional communicator, able to work with a diverse set of internal stakeholdersPassion for Indigo and our core valuesQualifications:Bachelor's degree2-4 years in Agriculture, specifically row crops2+ years of SalesForce experienceMS Power Point experience requiredOracle experience is a plusUploading / integration knowledge is a plusIntermediate MS Excel user, ability to create Pivot tables and utilize validation formulas, ie: sumifs, if statements, and produce reconciliation set up/reporting

Name: Business Analyst-Contingent
Description: Job DescriptionJoin the TECHSOFT team in providing the Navys Manpower Personnel Training and Education (MPT&E) enterprise with strategic planning and business change management support, business process re-engineering, functional business process and data mapping, business architecture documentation, project management, and analysis for out-year and year of execution programs and projects in support modernization of the Navys total Human Resource (HR) services environment.  The work involves aiding with transition/transformation of current functions/processes/activities, which includes Decomposition of As-Is Processes, Formation of To-Be Processes, Functional Requirements Generation, Data Management, Cost Analysis, Functional Testing, and Strategic Development. This task will specifically target MPT&E related Navy processes. Main functional objectives are to support requirements gathering, documentation, and traceability verification of functional business and data requirements needed for a business system to deliver a desired capability. These priorities are aligned with DoD Defense Change Management Organizational guidance to use End-to-End business models and ontology defined in the current version of the Business Enterprise Architecture (BEA). Responsibilities:Gather information requirements for reporting and analysis in order to deliver consistent integrated data for all Business Intelligence (BI) activity across the domain.Establish meaningful performance measures to assess the impacts of change (both quantitative and qualitative), monitor the effectiveness of Navys MPT&E Modernization efforts, and capture the return on investment.Assist in identifying and developing measurable baseline Key Performance Parameters (KPP) for program and projects assessment and evaluation during the testing phases.Identify and develop performance attributes for MPT&E Modernization systems. These attributes can be operational or support related. Each attribute will have a measurable value associated with cost and schedule.Assist in the development of performance metrics. These metrics shall include cost metrics and schedule metrics to include variance and identified thresholds.Provide evaluation of Navy MPT&E functional requirements to ensure alignment with Navy objectives and future Navy MPT&E CONOPS, as well as advisement support to identify opportunities for innovation, enhancement of organizational agility, applicability of available technologies and their use to enhance solution designProvide Governance and Stakeholder Management support to enable effective governance, informed decision-making, stakeholder management, and executive level change management. This support must bridge traditional organizational silos, support the creation and sustainment of organizational alignment throughout the lifecycle of the Navys MPT&E Modernization efforts, and be formalized to ensure effective decision making, risk management, and performance management.Design, develop, and implement a management structure designed to clearly define the decision-making process to include criteria for strategy alignment, performance evaluation, financial reporting, and risk management. This support must ensure transparency across the entire organization, to include informing both members of the workforce and constituents.Minimum education:Bachelors degree in information technology, computer science, mathematics, statistics, business, engineering or physical science.Experience:10 years of experience in complex problem solving, software, systems, business processes, cyber security, network, hardware installation, network management, enterprise communications, information assurance, system administrator, and data standardization.Additional Requirements:Must be a U.S. CitizenMay require a DoD Secret clearanceTravel Required:None expected Company DescriptionTECHSOFT is an established small business that provides high-quality, repeatable IT, security, training, and process improvement products and services to both commercial and Government clients. Our company services both the public and private sectors, offering a full range of CMMI® consulting services including: conducting gap analysis studies, mentoring and coaching, training, preparing documentation, and preparing for and conducting appraisals. TECHSOFT offers a full benefits package with several options that can be tailored to your needs; has an active social committee that plans year-round family-oriented activities outside of work; and encourages employees to participate in local charities. See https://www.facebook.com/techsoft for our latest events.  TECHSOFT provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or genetics. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard for their protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. TECHSOFT complies with all applicable federal requirements, and state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  TECHSOFT will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with TECHSOFT's legal duty to furnish information. E-Verify Statement: As a federal contractor, TECHSOFT is required to participate in the federal government's E-Verify program. With E-Verify we are able to confirm the employment authorization of all newly hired employees through an electronic database maintained by the Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration. The E-Verify process is completed in conjunction with a new hire's completion of the Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification upon commencement of employment. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates. For up-to-date information on E-Verify, go to www.uscis.gov and click on 'E-Verify' logo.

Name: Desktop Support Analyst
Description: Do you have a flair for clearly breaking down and explaining convoluted technical information in a way that is easily understood by non-technical users? You might be interested in Robert Half Technology's new Field Service Technician role. To succeed in this position, you will need to be a self-starter, with strong problem-solving skills and have a passion for working in a fast moving environment. This role is a long term temporary opportunity based in Memphis. How you will make an impact - Interface regularly and effectively with ticket submitters - Organize hardware repairs with the appropriate vendors - Resolve computer problems, and give guidance on appropriate action/solutions - Administer computer desktop support in accordance with established policies and procedures - Retain, investigate, and restore computer systems, hardware, printers, and computer peripherals - Administer support on a variety of computer hardware and software issues by identifying, researching, and resolving technical problems - Create records of daily data communication transactions, issues and remedial actions taken or installation activities *Technology doesn't change the world. People do.** As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person. *Leader among IT staffing agencies** The intersection of technology and people ? it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.  We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.  Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888.674.2094 to learn more about this position.  All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.  ? 2018 Robert Half Technology. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans.  By clicking 'Apply Now' you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use. Name: Business Systems Analyst II
Description: Apply Now  Business Systems Analyst II Memphis, TN 38133, USA  Req #142 Monday, November 12, 2018POSITION PURPOSE  The Business Systems Analyst II works with the Technology Strategies department to discover and scope projects related to Orion Federal Credit Union’s digital transformation, and act as an internal consultant and evaluator of business processes throughout the credit union. Projects range from new online and mobile banking features to existing or new software and processes for internal efficiencies. All projects will focus on financial institution enterprise technology and digital banking applications. This person will work closely with various development teams to deliver valuable product enhancements and integrations. This job will understand, analyze, document, refine and communicate business needs, so that all teams can build effective solutions. The goal of this role is ultimately to craft a company culture of efficiency and excellent member services through impactful and thoughtful solutions. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIESWork with vendors or internal teams to create solutions for small development projects or deliverables of larger projects.Work with department leads to scope and define business needs. Evaluate existing technology or new to design resources to improve enterprise processes.Perform analysis for internal business process improvement. Evaluate end to end processes throughout credit union; use Visual Studios to create process maps or flowcharts, and analyze these to make process improvement recommendations. Discover key components of the membership journey for Orion members and translate these findings into tangible tasks and projects. End products should reduce time spent in applications/ processes, and minimize “pain points” in daily tasks.Conduct market research and review company strategy to develop member facing products in online and mobile banking that meet those needs. Research new technology, acting as a consultant on optimal solutions and vendors based on data, reference recommendations, pricing, innovative techniques, integrations, and customer service.Work with Technical Projects Coordinator and business owners to verify user acceptance testing meets business goals.Input project data into project management system. Notate changes in the project timelines and create task lists. Track and report to Technology Strategies Manager. Create internal communications as needed for internal project information. Determine solutions to meet deadlines and accomplish goals.Create presentations of findings for upper management. Use creative communications to explain business needs. Run demos for new resources. Create videos and other media to communicate process improvement recommendations.All other tasks as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS    EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience required. Coursework in project management, and/or SCRUM/ Agile training preferred.  KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED: Basic understanding of Company operations. Ability to use Microsoft Office applications. Software development project management/ project coordination skills. Understanding of software development processes. Familiarity with database management.  EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Minimum 1-3 years prior experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, Project Analyst or similar role requiring needs analysis for business owners. Minimum 1-3 years in financial industry preferred.  SKILLS/ABILITIES:  Ability to operate a variety of computer applications.  Ability to perform extensive research and report findings.  Define and clearly articulate requirements (User Stories) and acceptance criteria (Use Cases). Work with multiple departments and people at different technical levels to accomplish goals and complete projects.  Manage requirements with Product Backlogs. Identify ROI, alignment with company strategy, and resource capacity of vendors and internal departments.  Ability to work independently and identify tasks that need completion.  Strong technical writing experience and skills.  Strong data analysis capability.  Excellent organizational skills.  Professional appearance, dress, and attitude.  WORKING CONDITIONS: Typical office environment, some travel requiredOrion FCU is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or any other federal or state protected class. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Name: Business Systems Analyst III
Description: Job Description Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and  user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business  strategies. Writes detailed description of user needs, program  functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.  Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs.  Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.  Demonstrates expertise in a variety of the field's concepts,  practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment  to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May provide  consultation on complex projects and is considered to be the top level  contributor/specialist. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is  expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.  Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough  understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and  translate them into operational requirements Support will encompass  all components of the enlisted personnel, billet files, and decision  support tools. The contractor shall provide personnel with extensive  knowledge of Navy MPTE metrics and the ability to determine new Supply  Chain related corporate metrics.  Required Skills Education: A bachelor s degree from an accredited  academic institution is required; a Master s degree is preferred.  Position requires a minimum of three years of professional MPTE Supply  Chain experience in Navy Community Management, Distribution, or  Training and demonstrated familiarity with the following systems: Navy  Standard Integrated Personnel System (NSIPS), Navy Retention  Monitoring System (NRMS), Navy Manpower, Programming and Budget System  (NMPBS), Career Waypoints (C-WAY), Navy Training Management Planning  System (NTMPS), Total Force Manpower Management System (TFMMS) and  TFMMS Micro Manpower Change Application (TMMCA), Corporate Enterprise  Training Activity Resource System (CeTARS), Cognos, and a strong  proven record using Excel and PowerPoint. Must (REQUIRED) possess  intermediate to advance level skills in Microsoft Office to include  Excel and/or ACCESS. Will be required to fill out an Excel/Access  skills sheet. Must have extensive advanced excel skills. Interview may  include a test for building macros from scratch, pivot tables, and  etc. Please do not apply if you are missing advanced Excel skills.  Requires you to have a clearance or the rating of eligible for  Secret . At this time we will not be able to take anyone without one  or higher. Secret Clearance preferred. Position Located Millington, TN  (onsite).  Employment Type Full time  Career Level  Job ID ********  Company Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc.  Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. federal  civilian agencies, the intelligence community, the Government of  Canada, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help  our clients deliver vital services more efficiently, while increasing  the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon,  Virginia, Serco has approximately 6,000 employees with an annual  revenue of $1 billion and is part of a $4 billion global business that  helps transform government and public services around the world. At  Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset, and our success  directly relates to our employees. At Serco, we listen, respect and  support our employees and through continuous training, development and  information-sharing, we advance talent internally, enhancing career  growth and progression which enables not only our employees to excel  but enables our customers to excel as well. It is not just a job at  Serco; at Serco, we offer career opportunities. We invite you to  become part of our dynamic team. Serco's people share a passion for  delivering ethical service, innovation, and a commitment to results.  We trust our people to deliver. Serco is an equal opportunity employer  committed to diversifying its workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual  Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/  Vets).  Functional AreaStrategy & Transformation  DepartmentSerco s Federal Services business unit provides services in the  areas of business processing, case management, intelligence,  logistics, personnel readiness, acquisition and program management,  modelling, and simulation and training to Defense and Federal Civilian  agencies. We understand the often complex regulatory and security  requirements of executing government programs and we stand up programs  quickly, assembling and training highly qualified teams, and  delivering to well-defined service level metrics.

Name: Credit Analyst - Commercial Banking
Description: Requisition Number 18-2167 Post Date 11/30/2018 Title Credit Analyst - Commercial Banking Part Time? No City Memphis State TN Description First Tennessee is looking for an individual with strong interpersonal skills as well as a solid background in finance and/or accounting. This position is for a Credit Analyst in the MidSouth Commercial Banking Group located in East Memphis. The Commercial  Banking Group is responsible for managing and underwriting banking relationships (comprised of loans, deposits and other products) of locally owned businesses.  The Credit Analyst (CA) is an entry level position into the Mid-South Commercial Banking Group of First Tennessee Bank. The CA will work directly with the deal team in analyzing, underwriting and monitoring all credit facilities within their portfolio. As a  CA, the individual will learn the basics of deal making and loan structures while being exposed to other departments within the Bank. The CA is an excellent first position in banking that paves the way to numerous other positions within First Tennessee including  sales, credit, relationship management, loan review or other similar positions. Duties and Responsibilities: Work with the Portfolio Manager (PM) and Relationship Manager (RM) in completing the credit analysis. The credit analysis is Commercial Banking's primary document for analyzing and underwriting all new and outstanding loans. The credit analysis performs an  in depth analysis on the borrower's ability to repay focusing on the company and owner's background, recent and historical financial performance, guarantor's (if applicable) financial condition, and several other factors related to First Tennessee's underwriting  policies and guidelines.  Support the PM and RM team in managing the client relationship as needed. The Credit Analyst will sit in on credit meetings as needed and join the RM on client calls on occasion. Requirements Bachelors degree required, Finance or Accounting major preferred. At a minimum, the candidate should have exposure to finance and accounting through completed college courses or relevant work experience. M - F 8AM - 5PM #LI-PF1All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender stereo typing, and age. First Tennessee is an EO employer – M/F/Vets/Disabled.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here. Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 915955  Apex Systems. the 2nd largest IT staffing firm, has an HRIS Analyst opening with one of the largest and fastest growing hospitality companies in the world, This position will be located in Memphis, TN and will assist a HRIS team in supporting over 300,000 employees worldwide on the functions listed below. If you find this position to be a good fit and are interested, send over an up to date resume to Apex Systems recruiter Andrew, at amueller@apexsystems.com Overview: Industry: Hospitality Location: Memphis, TN Rate: Negotiable based on experience Length: 1+ year contract. HRIS Analyst Position Summary: Cross-train and develop skills of staff, to include succession planning, setting challenging performance goals, coaching and managing performance and holding employees accountable.  Drives the end to end implementation planning and configuration delivery including project management, support and issue management for all HR systems. Provides a vision of how technology is applied to the HR Business Processes. Develops and sets strategic direction for the HRIS group.  Researches and recommends the purchase of software and training to support HRIS operations. Chair, organize and lead the HRIS committee meetings.  Defines, documents and maintains policies and procedures for the HRIS problem resolution, development, support, maintenance and optimization of key functional areas including performance testing, release and configuration management.  Facilitates and supervises effective working relationships with customers, other departments, groups, peers and vendors. Effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, clearly articulate risks, issues, and project status.  Manage budget and operating expenses for the HRIS group. Vendor management, to include negotiating contracts and agreements to ensure value for dollars invested.  Position is a hands-on management position which includes some HRIS Administrator responsibilities.  Perform additional duties as assigned.  HRIS Analyst Qualifications: Oracle HCM Cloud Knowledge or knowledge of cloud based HRIS solutions.  Area Functional Knowledge as described in the Position Summary above.  Ability to work effectively with teams in a collaborative way  Proven success in contributing to a large team; strong experience working in a team-oriented environment  Superior communication skills (written and oral) and good interpersonal skills  Ability to readily elicit functional requirements from end-user, SMEs and stakeholders  Rapid response to client requests for information, analysis or support  Ability to work independently on tasks until completion with minimal guidance. Name: Senior Database Analyst
Description: OverviewEmployer: St. Jude Children’s Research HospitalThis notice is being posted in connection with an application concerning the employment of one or more alien workers for the above-referenced permanent position that will be filed with the Department of Labor in compliance with 20 CFR § 656.10(d). Any person may provide documentary evidence bearing on the application to the Certifying Officer of the U.S. Department of Labor at the following address: U.S. Department of Labor, Employment and Training Administration, 233 Peachtree Street, Suite 410, Atlanta, Georgia 30303. Phone: (404) 893-0101, Fax: (404) 893-4642. ResponsibilitiesServe as primary resource to collect, integrate, analyze and manage data from multiple areas and disparate systems to support divisional processes and decision-making for the division, including data integration, performing complex queries over large collections of clinical research data, and developing and maintaining key performance metrics for the division; Analyzes, develops, designs, implements and maintains new and existing divisional databases, including assessing requirements, reviewing database design, data modeling, technical documentation, and ensuring database security and consistency of standards, procedures and content to coordinate protocol research information management of assigned tasks within the Division of Cancer Predisposition with independent decision-making authority as defined by the Principle Investigators and the Division Director; Design and manage division’s data collection and sharing resources, to assemble, manipulate, analyze, and disseminates data; Provides divisional clinical and research reporting and analysis, including relevant data queries, acquisition and analysis; Advise, train and assist department personnel in the use of databases and other software, including developing training materials and leading formal and informal training sessions; Provides support for division’s hardware and software requests; Examine, diagnose, correct, and troubleshoot hardware and software issues. Work Location: Memphis, Tennessee. Work Schedule: 40 hours per week. Minimum EducationRequires either a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Business or Health Administration, Management Information Systems, or related field. Minimum ExperienceWith Bachelor’s degree: Requires five (5) years of related progressive professional experienceWith Master’s degree: Requires three (3) years of related progressive professional experienceThis position also requires experience or education in each of the following:• Use of relational database management tools and query language, such Hyperion, Oracle, SQL programming (e.g. - SQL*Plus), Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access, and other data mining, query and analysis tools;• Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and statistical software skills;• Skills in one or more traditional database and object-oriented programming languages (e.g. – FORTRAN, Basic, PL/SQL, Visual Basic, C++);• Knowledge of client/server design principles;• Knowledge of network and/or distributed computing environments;• Knowledge of object-oriented analysis and software design;• Ability to extract and analyze various types of data;• Knowledge of supporting and troubleshooting of hardware and software systems.Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience. EEO StatementSt. Jude is an Equal Opportunity EmployerNo Search Firms:St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. Please do not call or email. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee or other representative at St. Jude via email, the internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place and approved by HR will result in no fee being paid in the event the candidate is hired by St. Jude.

Name: Senior Compensation Analyst
Description: The Senior Compensation Analyst is both a strategic and tactical role that is responsible for analyzing compensation and job data for staff to ensure that St. Jude attracts, retains, and motivates top talent. This position presents analyses to leadership, makes recommendations relevant to salary structure, merit pool, and variable pay to ensure market competitiveness and internal equity, and supports the development and modification of compensation programs and policies.  The successful candidate will provide internal compensation consulting and analysis services to the organization including the development and implementation of St. Jude compensation programs, reward strategies, competitive market analysis, equity programs, and related HR programs and projects. Performs detailed, complex data analyses. Provides leadership in the development, implementation, and management of proposed or existing compensation programs. Provides leadership within the HR department ensuring all processes are efficient, highly automated, and proactive. Leads and develops less-experienced staff. Bachelor's degree in business administration, human resources, or related field requiredFour years of professional-level experience in a Compensation function or four years of human resources experience at St. Jude. Strong analytical and PC skills are required. Must have demonstrated ability to plan and coordinate multiple projects/work initiatives and strong analytical skills. Experience with Lawson ERP preferredNonePHR/SPHR designation or CCP certification preferred St. Jude is an Equal Opportunity EmployerNo Search Firms:St. Jude Children's Research Hospital does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. Please do not call or email. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee or other representative at St. Jude via email, the internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place and approved by HR will result in no fee being paid in the event the candidate is hired by St. Jude.

Name: IT SAP Business Analyst II - MFG Processes
Description: IT SAP Business Analyst II - MFG Processes –Perm Position – Memphis, TN(Must be US Citizen or GC)Our International Fortune 500 Client is seeking a SAP Business Analyst with ECC, Master Data, MM, and PP. This position offers an excellent compensation and benefits package. Please review the position below and if you are interested, please contact us.Purpose:  • ITSS Application Services organization is responsible for designing, building, implementing and sustaining an Enterprise Supply Chain solution based on an SAP technology platform. The objective of the solution is to support and enable changing business processes to improve customer satisfaction and reduce supply chain costs. The application processes include Planning & Scheduling, Source, Order Management, Manufacturing Processes, Cost & Profitability and Deliver. The supporting technology areas include SAP development, Business Warehouse, Manufacturing Execution System (MES), middleware (webMethods) and Data Management • The Manufacturing Processes IT Business Analyst II will work in a team environment to recommend and deliver technology enabling business processes in the areas of production planning, production execution, materials management, inventory management and quality management in SAP and our Manufacturing Execution Systems • The applications in scope include SAP ECC, APO, BW, MES plus any additional Global Supply Chain approved operating model applications • The candidate should have an understanding of Supply Chain processes and knowledge of SAP configuration and custom development processes to enable business requirements in SAPKey Accountabilities: • Drives, participates and organizes estimates for integrated and complex development of application solutions/projects • Able to break-down work, explain tasks and understands interdependencies • Facilitate/lead design meetings as well as creating/updating design documents • Participate and lead process improvement, functional design and realization for the manufacturing processes functional area • Analyze complex user information flows and business requirements • Create and maintain functional specification documents based on business requirements • Solves difficult problems with effective solutions • Perform SAP configuration Perform acceptance testing of configuration changes and development changes in a highly integrated environment following established methodologies and tools for providing regular reporting on results • Provide support of existing processes in the project and production environments • Meet project deliverable deadlines • Evaluate and/or determine alternative procedural and/or systematic solutions to meet business requirements • Work cohesively with other Information Technology, business and contract resources/groups • Participate in project and team meetings • Participate as needed with go-live and after hours IT project support • Provide knowledge transfer to other team members • Responsible for maintaining support documentation including design documents and functional documentation • Subject matter expert in business applications / systems / specific technology • Takes on medium to large functional/technical • Responsible for leading and participating in process assessments, documenting the solution analysis following the PDP methodology • Organizes IT cross functional teams for highly complex and integrated scope during the realization phase proving continuity between design and realization • Surfaces and escalates issues and risk, providing recommendations and facilitating resolution to issues • Seeks out value added opportunities to improve IT solutions and service capabilitiesKnowledge and Experience: • 7-10 year’s business and IT experience with increasing responsibilities • Hands on experience with setting up product master data (matierals, BOMs, routing, work centers) • Hands on work experience performing SAP configuration in the SAP ECC modules and PP and MM (3+ years preferred) • Hands on work experience with monitoring and supporting interfaces between systems • SAP ECC experience with discrete and repetitive manufacturing processes/configuration • Strong interpersonal and communication skills • Knowledge of SAP integration between SAP ECC and APO as well as BW • Experience with SAP batch management processes • Experience with project management tools • Work experience in taking business requirements and processes and determining how to enable those requirements and processes through technology specifically SAP • BS degree preferred (major in Computer Science, Engineering or Business Administration preferred) • Background in Supply Chain process areas Background in manufacturing and delivery systems • Background in managing through complex methodologies  • Knowledge and experience in an integrated SAP and MES environment  • SAP ABAP development experience preferred for tracing and debugging issues as well as helping identify customizations needed to SAP Please send resumes to: Lisa Barton, lbarton@summerfield.net

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
