Name: ERP Business Application Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSummary: TopRx (Memphis area firm) is looking for an energetic up-and-coming IT professional to join our growing technology team. This is a unique opportunity for an assertive and self-motivated individual with interest in an IT software analyst role with broader responsibilities including application support, automation workflow design, change management, and project management. Individuals accepting this role will be asked to be the primary subject matter expert and product owner for our core ERP system (IPTOR ASW).  Core responsibility will be the support and ongoing advancement of the core business applications at TopRx (a pharmaceutical distributor) which is currently an ERP system provided by IPTOR called ASW (aka DC1). Associates in this role will provide assistance, advice, problem solving, and technical information regarding the use of the core ERP software application. The position will be key in working between end-users, business leadership, software developers, and application vendors to maintain and advance automation related to this ERP system. The position reports to the VP of IT. Essential Responsibilities: • Primary Subject Matter Expert and product owner/sponsor for core ERP system (IPTOR ASW)  • Develop methodology documents based on self-initiated interviews, diagrams, surveys, and workflow analysis  • Research and analyze all aspects of existing business processes and help draft, refine, and promote proposed solutions for advancing automation  • Research, identify, track, and communicate incidents and problems with core business applications within purview  • Communicate and coordinate with department leadership about common frustrations, hindrances, and other issues that interrupt workflow  • Actively participates in the testing and implementation of new software applications as well as test current application functionality when updates are performed  • Create/Assist in developing training material to train end-users in the use of software applications  • Organize and prioritize assigned tasks to meet established schedules, timeliness, and/or deadlines  • Work independently with minimal supervision  • Assists with project management discipline  • Assists with change management discipline Requirements: • College or advanced degree  • Experience and knowledge of IPTOR ASW/DC1 ERP system  • IBM iSeries/AS400 experience and proficiency  • Proficient in English (read, write, and verbal communication)  • Proven experience within an IT role providing application support and/or systems analyst  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a significant plus  • ITIL certification is a plus  • Experience with Smartsheet, MS Project, Sharepoint, and other collaborative tools used in project/product management is a significant plusCompany DescriptionWe are a generic pharmaceutical distributor that has been in business for over 30 years. We have excellent benefits, training program and with career advancement opportunities!

Name: Data Analyst I
Description: Pay  Grade: 38  Hiring  Range: $17.43- $20.92/Hourly THIS IS A GRANT FUNDED  POSITIONJOB SUMMARY/ESSENTIAL JOB  FUNCTIONS: The Data Analyst I prepares and  performs data analysis for the Center for Health Equity in the UTHSC-West  Cancer Center within the Departments of Radiation Oncology and Preventive  Medicine. This position performs duties that includes data development and collection  needs of assigned clinical service, functional, or operational departments;  collection of clinical, operational and financial data elements from multiple  sources; ensuring the accuracy and completeness of data; analyzing information  to identify trends and present recommendations for improvements. This position  is also responsible for developing and maintaining databases; preparation of  recurring and special reports for management reflecting clinical and financial  metrics for dashboards and activities, such as statistical reports for  operational and performance improvement; developing electronic alternatives for  system reports, queries, and downloads to evaluate data; and preparing data  visualization and on-going reports for program management. DUTIES AND  RESPONSIBILITIES: Identifies problems with the data and data collection  procedures, determining in-range and out of range or erroneous data  values.Decides which routine is most appropriate for  addressing the problem data, and determines the investigation process of  data.Performs data organization and management procedures  for large, and multiple sources datasets.Prepares and analyzes data using database, graphics,  and statistical software on personal computer; prepares results for  presentation.Programs in SAS to create statistical routines for data  analysis.Provides oversight of database content and integrity.Manages large data sets produced by external contracted  sources and fit to study needs.Performs data cleaning routines to ensure quality data.Prepares statistical results and utilizing results to  create reports, presentations, and publications.Trains research staff on proper data collection,  database usage procedures, database management, and analysis methods.Performs data entry and verification into statistical  software, as needed.Performs other duties as assigned.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:EDUCATION: Bachelor’s  Degree in Public Health, Business Administration, Computer Science, Health  Information (TRANSCRIPT REQUIRED)EXPERIENCE: One (1)  year of experience with statistical analysis, managing and cleaning datasets,  and using SAS for data analysis. OR Master’s Degree will be accepted in lieu of  experience. SAS programming skills is required. Knowledge of statistical analyses.  Data management skills. MS products application skills. Written and verbal  communication skills. Knowledge of relational database methods preferred. WORK SCHEDULE: This position may occasionally work evenings.

Name: Financial Planning Analyst
Description: Role Summary: Provide financial planning, analysis and reporting support to management during OP plan, SII, SRO, quarter close. Provide recommendations and drive operational ownership across teams to ensure consistency and compliance. Assist in identifying process improvements and acts as financial resource for team. Essential Responsibilities: Support preparation for monthly and quarterly financial forecasts. Identify and articulate risks and opportunities relevant to the forecast period. Prepare financial projections for key planning sessions and operating plans. Prepare critical analyses of business results (Trend Analysis, Productivity Metrics, etc.). Help drive expense analytics. Participate on cross-functional process improvement teams to promote operational efficiencies. Help implement financial modeling improvements in planning and forecasting to enhance process efficiency, support new initiatives, and to accurately capture the changing business economics and structure. Qualifications/Requirements: Bachelor's Degree. Minimum 2 years of finance experience. Financial modeling skills. Experience in accounting or financial analysis. Demonstrated oral and written communication skills and ability to work cross functionally. Proficient use of financial systems and analysis tools including Microsoft Office (e.g.. Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Desired Characteristics: Bachelors Degree in Finance or Accounting. Master's degree, Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or equivalent certification. Financial Management Program (FMP) grad or Corporate Audit Staff (CAS) grad. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities. Financial services industry experience. Ability to analyze complex issues, develop appropriate action plans and delivers the results timely. Ability to lead projects and assignments. About Us: GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GEs mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law. Locations: United States; Tennessee; MemphisGE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.

This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-07).OR Education: Master's or equivalent graduate degree or 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree or LL.B. or J.D. in a field which demonstrates the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position.OR Combination of Education and Experience: A combination of education and experience may be used to qualify for this position as long as the computed percentage of the requirements is at least 100%. Name: Database Developer/Analyst
Description: Principal Accountabilities (Major end results the job is expected to achieve): Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies and patterns in Academic and Operations data.Develop process and tools to collect, analyze, visualize data, and present insights to executive management.Create user-friendly dashboards and analysis to present insights to the executives.Use advanced visualization techniques such as diagrams and charts, to convey the insights.Develop and publish reports, automate reports and their delivery; use advanced reporting tools like Tableau to create robust reports with dynamic prompts and filters.Drive standardization of key metrics across various business stakeholders to improve data governance; Develop dashboards to monitor the key performance indicators (KPI); responsible for improving data governance and standardizing data definitions.Conduct competitive research, market analysis, and clinical literature analysis, involving performing market analysis by building regression models & Pareto charts.Work with business stakeholders to gather, analyze, and translate requirements in the BI reporting area, either by recommending an existing solution, developing a solution, or synthesizing requirements in support of a new project initiative; use analytical skills to understand business problems and translate them to requirements. Qualifications A baccalaureate degree in an appropriate field and four or more years of relevant professional experience or education equivalent to an Associate Degree in IS/Computer Science3-6 years of experience with Oracle and SQL of experience in software development.Solid understanding of Relational ModelUnderstand how to develop and enforce coding standards and source code development standardsUnderstand table indexing and query strategies, database objects maintenance and performance issuesAdvanced data modeling concepts and design techniques; establishing and maintaining database definitions; testing and debugging databases; maintenance of the integrity of database structuresAdvanced development or scripting language(s), operating systems, reporting tools, relational database design and maintenance, remote processing and virtual systemsVery complex development concepts; hardware architecture and its capabilities; principles and techniques of studying business processes for new or modified applications; principles of systems design; technical report writing; and application of algorithms and mathematical modeling and record selectionAdvanced computer system analysis, design, testing, debugging and maintenance techniques and practicesDevelop very complex databases and detailed, complex database specificationsAnalyze very complex data and situations, reason logically and creatively identify problems, draw valid conclusions, and develop effective, complex solutionsPrepare and interpret complex structured and/or computerized diagramming techniquesAbility to support and understand multiple existing applications and schemasAbility to multi-task, prioritize and manage work loadMust be self-directed and able to function both independently and as part of a teamDemonstrate advanced critical thinking and trouble-shooting capabilities to assess, prioritize, plan, and implement tasks and solutions effectively Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $65,000.00 to $72,000.00 /year  Experience: Oracle: 1 year (Preferred)Database Development: 1 year (Preferred)Tableau: 1 year (Preferred)SQL: 1 year (Preferred)

Name: Corporate Development Analyst
Description: Position OverviewUnder general direction, identifies potential business development opportunities and implements feasibility studies to assess their viability. Participates in identifying, evaluating, and negotiating acquisitions, partnerships, alliances, joint ventures, and start-ups in current and new business. Assesses and values new business opportunities.Job ResponsibilitiesPerforms analyses of acquisition target companies, including original data collection from sellers, preliminary analysis, and gathering of data from internal and external sources.Coordinates due diligence by scheduling, arranging audit teams, and managing the full process through to the completion stage.Reviews acquisition models provided by the corporate M&A team to ensure all details of the transaction are considered and initiates steps to resolve open items.Manages post-closing acquisition-related matters on current year deals, to include managing the transition of acquired customers into the business unit operational software system, tracking of customer retention and reimbursement of monies due from sellers.Develops communications and resolves all post-closing issues for closed acquisitions per the terms of Asset Purchase Agreements (e.g., inquiries from field operations, legal, other internal departments, sellers).Job RequirementsBachelor's degree and 5 years of experience in a related field required.Graduate degree in a related field preferred.One to two years of supervisory experience preferred.Written and verbal communication skillsOrganizational and project management skillsAbility to multi-task within and between concurrent projectsSkills in planning and analysis of various types of operations and dataAbility to manage confidential data and projectsSkill with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)Ability to learn new business unit software programs as neededPhysical Demands and Working ConditionsThe physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential function to this job. Name: Junior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Junior Business Systems Analyst - Millington, TN Millington, TN, US *Job Description** Serco, Inc. is looking to fill a Junior Business Systems Analyst position for our Millington, TN location. The roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following. Military Veterans and Spouses are encouraged to apply!  Applicants may be required to complete an Excel/Access skills sheet, and answer a Navy and Excel questionnaire to determine experience level.  Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs.  Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Name: WORKDAY ANALYST

Name: Process Analyst - Performance and Execution Management
Description: Requisition Number 18-2161 Post Date 11/29/2018 Title Process Analyst - Performance and Execution Management Part Time? No City Memphis State TN Description At First Tennessee Bank Operations, we are on a mission to deliver a seamless customer experience. We are passionate about doing things right and doing the right things. We collaborate with each other and with our internal business partners to delight  our customers. We believe in creating an environment where everyone’s ideas are valued so that the team operates at its best. Our team members serve with humility and a deep commitment to their responsibility to be the best at serving their customers one opportunity  at a time.  The Process Analyst supports multiple business lines by providing a comprehensive assessment of Operations processes in an effort to identify gaps and potential risks; focusing on performance improvement and incident prevention. The ideal candidate is very  detail oriented and views their work as their self-portrait. The Process Analyst possesses impeccable customer service skills, excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to maintain poise under pressure.  We are seeking dedicated, disciplined individuals who excel in a team environment, who take ownership and who are enthusiastic about a job well done. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Exercises a wide range of decision making control when presented with multi-faceted factors; ability to identify, resolve and escalate problems in collaboration with stakeholdersAssists in the design of new and/or expanded reviews; conduct research as needed and perform testing of proposed procedures for Operations to include but not limited to: o New hire on-boarding  o Validation of new and/or modified procedures are working as designed post implementation  o Business Systems  o Third Party Vendors  o Merger and Acquisition activity Documents testing performed and results achievedDrafts reports to communicate potential issues/gaps in processes. Discuss findings with business line management; to include developing an action plan that will satisfactorily address any issues noted.Communicates and collaborates with Operations partners to ensure necessary processes and/or procedures are documented to support action plans developed. o Business Line Management  o Process Designers  o Procedure Developers  o Third Party Vendors Monitors and assists in the resolution of issuesCoordinates/assists Operations business lines with exam coordination (Internal/External)Professional, respectful and timely communications within working team, business line partners and cross functional departments.Maintains a commitment to continuous learning, developing knowledge, and skills to competently and efficiently complete assignmentsAssists the Performance and Execution Manager in maintaining an effective testing program: o Identifies and reports testing that needs to be expanded to support business line updates  o Escalates gaps in processes as identified  o Recommendations to improve documented Policy and Procedures  o Recommendations of alternative approaches in testing that would promote “preventative” vs. “detective”. Ensures timely completion of testing while producing quality work; performs complex reviews with no/minimal guidanceParticipates in special projects as assigned o Communicates progress and impact to future testing to team; ensuring planning for validation is included. Abilities:Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary serviceAbility to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given.Skills:Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with internal customersExcellent computer proficiency (MS Office – Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook)Excellent organizational and customer service skills Requirements Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:Experience/working knowledge of multiple business lines supported; familiarity with deposit/treasury management products preferredExperience in reporting/data analysis a plusHigh School diploma required; degree preferred or equivalent experience/working knowledge of multiple business lines supportedPhysical Requirements:Basic keyboarding or other repetitive motionsLifting/pushing objectsMust be able to talk, listen and speak clearly on telephoneAbility to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standardsAbility to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with or without the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standard, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards. Work Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pmAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender stereo typing, and age. First Tennessee is an EO employer – M/F/Vets/Disabled.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here.

Name: Business/Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWhat Youll Get to Do: Conducts analysis on work procedures and recommends changes to improve the effectiveness of the organization's processes/procedures. Able to perform studies on ways to increase efficiency. Collects and analyzes quantitative and qualitative data including financial and cost data, builds process models, develops solutions or alternative practices, collects and organizes information from a variety of sources, and recommends process, procedures, or organizational changes. Acts as liaison between end-user communities, stakeholders, and service providers within an enterpriseInterviews personnel from functional user area under study to learn general purpose of systems and information requirements of positions involved in the data flowAnalyzes business and user needs, documents requirements, and revises existing system logic difficulties as necessary.More About the Role:Assesses information and sources to ensure data collected is relevant to the core issue.Identifies issues or gaps and devises appropriate next steps.Practical understanding of statistics.Familiarity with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures.Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.Prepares reports and/or presentations.A high degree of creativity and latitude is expected.Youll Bring These Qualifications: - Typically has a University Degree or equivalent experience and minimum 3 years of related work experience.  - Requires active SECRET Clearance These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have: - Knowledge of Navy Personnel data and business rules.  - Ability to work as a team member in a diverse group; ability to deal effectively with both Government and contracted workforce members. What We Can Offer You:We've been named The Top Place to Work by the Commercial Appeal.Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.For over 55 years, the principles of CACIs unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success. Job Location US-Millington-TN-MEMPHIS  CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Apply Now  Systems Analyst Memphis, TN 38133, USA  Req #127 Thursday, October 11, 2018POSITION PURPOSE  The Systems Analyst provides technology support for the organization’s various software applications. This position works independently, performs research on any reported problems, plans and proposes solutions. Identifies internal customer organization's strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement. Reviews and edits requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions, develops functional specifications and system design specifications for internal customers. Maintains automation software and manages daily posting jobs.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES  Provide technical support for changes to Core Banking software using Java and JavaScript to enhance business practices.  Performs testing and live installation of core vendor supplied software releases up to (3) times a year.  Develop ad-hoc SQL queries and ETL jobs based on report requests from end users.  Provide timely, accurate, and complete processing of all member transactions on a daily basis.  Performs month-end processing functions on core system in an independent manner.  Performs annual tax reporting functions on the core banking system.  Responsible for back office system paging and performance of the CPU and attached devices..  Responsible for ensuring daily backups are performed  Responsible for the physical security of the tape library, computer room, the integrity of the data base structure and performing daily backups.  Performs detailed data analysis using data warehouse, evaluates business processes to define data needs.  Ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.  Works independently with departments on change management requirements.  Suggests areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions.  Participates in projects and meets project deadlines and schedules, could include leading projects.  Assists in the facilitation of team and internal customer meetings.  Provides first line support for help desk related telephone calls.  Manages third party data extracts and coordinates requested changes  Responds to needs and questions of users concerning their access of network resources.  Establishes network users, user environments, directories, and security for networks being installed.  Installs and tests necessary software and hardware.  Responsible for assisting the IT Manager with all aspects of disaster recovery for the core system. This includes maintenance of the copy log at the co-location facility and assisting in the coordination of the annual disaster recovery test.  Other duties as assigned.  QUALIFICATIONS  EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Bachelor’s degree in Management of Information Systems or equivalent qualifications.  EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Minimum three or more years experience with software applications, Financial Institution experience a plus. Minimum three years experience in UNIX/AIX. Experience in Java, JavaScript, and SQL programming. SKILLS/ABILITIES: Strong verbal and written communication abilities.  Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suites a plus  Strong organization skills, ability to manage multiple projects on time.  Understands the components of running a fiscally successful project.  Ability to adapt to changing business needs and desire to learn  Ability to be a team player and perform duties in a professional manner  WORKING CONDITIONS: Typical office environmentOrion FCU is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or any other federal or state protected class. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting
Description: IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & AccountingThe IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting is a key role for the Finance and Accoutning functions. The primary mission of the position is to drive functional business objectives and technical development and support with information technology, digital, data, analytics, strategy, solutions and services, provoke strategic directions through internal/external perspective and proactively seek out and manage value opportunities for IT solutions and services.Key Responsibilities:Function as a partner and trusted advisor to functional leadership and serve as a contributor to the deployment and realization of the functional and business objectives.Assure secure compliant stable operations in technologies enabling HR/Finance functional unitsIn partnership with HR/Finance leadership, define strategy, roadmap for technology, information, data and digital technologies.Drive innovative solutions to support the growth, efficiency, agility of the commercial businessServe in a critical role within Design Group-Americas IT as an influential player in the IT TeamContext and Scope:Information and Digital Technologies Strategic LeadershipIT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting is responsible for establishing trusted relationships with key stakeholders and leaders in the function, being a connected, influential player in the business. They will understand and contribute to business strategic directions and goals, define an IT strategic plan aligned/embedded with business strategy. They will ensure governance and alignment of business demand with supply. They will communicate plan effectively and gain support from key stakeholders, including functional leaders.Service DeliveryIT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting develops a depth of understanding in Finance & Accounting operational capabilities. They will provide visibility to stakeholders with ongoing communication and reporting and ensure compliance to IT security and controls framework.Business Change InitiativesIT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting will develop and agree an on-going project portfolio to achieve the HR/Finance IT strategy, taking into account goals, corporate priorities, technology /data opportunities, and cost pressures. They will lead, jointly with peers in business functions, the delivery of business change initiatives, ensuring the timely and on budget delivery of IT components. They will provide prioritization guidelines and lead a focused agenda. With adept understanding of business value, they will drive clear prioritization of value driving initiatives of business impact.Finance and Value ManagementThe IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting will define a portfolio of investment initiatives inclusive of value proposition and prioritized investment portfolio. Name: IT Business Analyst II - MFG Processes - RT
Description: IT Business Analyst II - MFG Processes - RT  Memphis, Tennessee 37544 Purpose: ITSS Application Services organization is responsible for designing, building, implementing and sustaining an Enterprise Supply Chain solution based on an SAP technology platform. The objective of the solution is to support and enable changing business processes to improve customer satisfaction and reduce supply chain costs. The application processes include Planning & Scheduling, Source, Order Management, Manufacturing Processes, Cost & Profitability and Deliver. The supporting technology areas include SAP development, Business Warehouse, Manufacturing Execution System (MES), middleware (webMethods) and Data Management  The Manufacturing Processes IT Business Analyst II will work in a team environment to recommend and deliver technology enabling business processes in the areas of production planning, production execution, materials management, inventory management and quality management in SAP and our Manufacturing Execution Systems  The applications in scope include SAP ECC, APO, BW, MES plus any additional Global Supply Chain approved operating model applications  The candidate should have an understanding of Supply Chain processes and knowledge of SAP configuration and custom development processes to enable business requirements in SAP Key Accountabilities: Drives, participates and organizes estimates for integrated and complex development of application solutions/projects  Able to break-down work, explain tasks and understands interdependencies  Facilitate/lead design meetings as well as creating/updating design documents  Participate and lead process improvement, functional design and realization for the manufacturing processes functional area  Analyze complex user information flows and business requirements  Create and maintain functional specification documents based on business requirements  Solves difficult and/or determine alternative procedural and/or systematic solutions to meet business requirements  Work cohesively with other Information Technology, business and contract resources/groups issues  Seeks out value added opportunities to improve IT solutions and service capabilities People: Leverages IT professionals with strong production planning, paper manufacturing, SAP functional Name: Commercial Credit Analyst III
Description: Apply Now  Commercial Credit Analyst III Memphis, TN 38133, USA  Req #36 Wednesday, November 22, 2017POSITION PURPOSE  Responsible for analysis and underwriting of a variety of commercial real estate loan applications. Prepare, analyze, process, and document all required forms and related documentation for commercial loan products. Provide information on credit union products and services to current and potential members according to all credit union policies and procedures and Federal and State rules and regulations. Promote credit union products and services. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIESReview loan packages submitted by the Loan Originator and retail staff for completion and accuracy.Spread business financial statements and tax returns via the commercial platform CASH or Mortgagebot as applicable. Analyze three year trends and ratios and submit recommendation to Portfolio Manager for approval/decline.Work with the Loan Originator to enter applicable loans in Mortgagebot for recommendation and approval/decline.Identify and participate in cross-sell initiatives with the Loan Originator and/or retail division to expand product offerings to current and prospective members.Work with the Commercial Processor as needed with stacking loan files, processing documents and gathering annual financials as needed.Correspond with the Loan Originator and Portfolio Manager to resolve questions regarding application information, financial documents and any other applicable information.Be familiar with developing commercial real estate laws and regulations as they apply.Review, test and cross train on internal systems and software and assist with questions and issues.Maintain and recommend changes to department procedures and system training materials.Handle loans of highest complexity, value, and risk while maintaining confidentiality.Monitor loans daily for required information, pending information and other applicable documentation required for the loan file.Assist with development of new product offerings as necessary.Participate on joint calls with the Loan Originator and Portfolio Manager as necessary.Verify accuracy of reporting.All other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience and training  EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Minimum 4 - 6 years experience in commercial lending SKILLS/ABILITIES:Broad exposure across financial services products, commercial segments and delivery channelsKnowledge of commercial banking products and services (both credit and non-credit), competitor product lines and commercial compliance regulationsKnowledge of financial analysis, underwriting methods, risk evaluation, loan documentation and commercial loan collection activitiesStrong decision making skills and ability to work independentlyProven ability in complex account analysis, prioritization, organization and detail orientationExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProficient with Microsoft Word and Excel WORKING CONDITIONS: Typical Office Environment.Orion FCU is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or any other federal or state protected class. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order Management
Description: IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order ManagementThe CompanyIG Design Group PLC is a leading global manufacturer and distributor of celebrations, stationery and gifting products.Position SummaryThe IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order Management is a key role for the Sales/Commercial function. The primary mission of the position is to drive functional business objectives and technical development and support with information technology, digital, data, analytics, strategy, solutions and services, provoke strategic directions through internal/external perspective and proactively seek out and manage value opportunities for IT solutions and services.Key Responsibilities:Function as a partner and trusted advisor to Sales and Commercial leadership and serve as a contributor to the deployment and realization of the functional and business objectives.Assure secure compliant stable operations in technologies enabling Sales/Commercial businesses.In partnership with commercial/sales leadership, define strategy, roadmap for technology, information, data and digital technologies.Drive innovative solutions to support the growth, efficiency, agility of the commercial businessServe in a critical role within Design Group-Americas IT as an influential player in the IT TeamContext and Scope:Information and Digital Technologies Strategic LeadershipThe IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order Management is responsible for establishing trusted relationships with key stakeholders and leaders in the function, being a connected, influential player in the Commercial business. They will ensure governance and alignment of business demand with supply. They will communicate plan effectively and gain support from key stakeholders, including commercial leaders.Service Delivery:The IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order Management develops a depth of understanding in Order-to-Cash operational capabilities. They will provide visibility to stakeholders with ongoing communication and reporting and ensure compliance to IT security and controls framework.Business Change Initiatives:The IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order Management will develop and agree an on-going project portfolio to achieve the Sales/Commerical IT strategy, taking into account goals, corporate priorities, technology /data opportunities, and cost pressures. They will lead, jointly with peers in business functions, the delivery of business change initiatives, ensuring the timely and on budget delivery of IT components. They will provide prioritization guidelines and lead a focused agenda. With adept understanding of business value, they will drive clear prioritization of value driving initiatives of business impact.Finance and Value Management:The IT Business Systems Analyst Sales & Order Management will define a portfolio of investment initiatives inclusive of value proposition and prioritized investment portfolio. Name: Business Analyst-Contingent
Description: Job DescriptionJoin the TECHSOFT team in providing the Navys Manpower Personnel Training and Education (MPT&E) enterprise with strategic planning and business change management support, business process re-engineering, functional business process and data mapping, business architecture documentation, project management, and analysis for out-year and year of execution programs and projects in support modernization of the Navys total Human Resource (HR) services environment.  The work involves aiding with transition/transformation of current functions/processes/activities, which includes Decomposition of As-Is Processes, Formation of To-Be Processes, Functional Requirements Generation, Data Management, Cost Analysis, Functional Testing, and Strategic Development. This task will specifically target MPT&E related Navy processes. Main functional objectives are to support requirements gathering, documentation, and traceability verification of functional business and data requirements needed for a business system to deliver a desired capability. These priorities are aligned with DoD Defense Change Management Organizational guidance to use End-to-End business models and ontology defined in the current version of the Business Enterprise Architecture (BEA). Responsibilities:Gather information requirements for reporting and analysis in order to deliver consistent integrated data for all Business Intelligence (BI) activity across the domain.Establish meaningful performance measures to assess the impacts of change (both quantitative and qualitative), monitor the effectiveness of Navys MPT&E Modernization efforts, and capture the return on investment.Assist in identifying and developing measurable baseline Key Performance Parameters (KPP) for program and projects assessment and evaluation during the testing phases.Identify and develop performance attributes for MPT&E Modernization systems. These attributes can be operational or support related. Each attribute will have a measurable value associated with cost and schedule.Assist in the development of performance metrics. These metrics shall include cost metrics and schedule metrics to include variance and identified thresholds.Provide evaluation of Navy MPT&E functional requirements to ensure alignment with Navy objectives and future Navy MPT&E CONOPS, as well as advisement support to identify opportunities for innovation, enhancement of organizational agility, applicability of available technologies and their use to enhance solution designProvide Governance and Stakeholder Management support to enable effective governance, informed decision-making, stakeholder management, and executive level change management. This support must bridge traditional organizational silos, support the creation and sustainment of organizational alignment throughout the lifecycle of the Navys MPT&E Modernization efforts, and be formalized to ensure effective decision making, risk management, and performance management.Design, develop, and implement a management structure designed to clearly define the decision-making process to include criteria for strategy alignment, performance evaluation, financial reporting, and risk management. This support must ensure transparency across the entire organization, to include informing both members of the workforce and constituents.Minimum education:Bachelors degree in information technology, computer science, mathematics, statistics, business, engineering or physical science.Experience:10 years of experience in complex problem solving, software, systems, business processes, cyber security, network, hardware installation, network management, enterprise communications, information assurance, system administrator, and data standardization.Additional Requirements:Must be a U.S. CitizenMay require a DoD Secret clearanceTravel Required:None expected Company DescriptionTECHSOFT is an established small business that provides high-quality, repeatable IT, security, training, and process improvement products and services to both commercial and Government clients. Our company services both the public and private sectors, offering a full range of CMMI® consulting services including: conducting gap analysis studies, mentoring and coaching, training, preparing documentation, and preparing for and conducting appraisals. TECHSOFT offers a full benefits package with several options that can be tailored to your needs; has an active social committee that plans year-round family-oriented activities outside of work; and encourages employees to participate in local charities. See https://www.facebook.com/techsoft for our latest events.  TECHSOFT provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or genetics. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard for their protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. TECHSOFT complies with all applicable federal requirements, and state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  TECHSOFT will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with TECHSOFT's legal duty to furnish information. E-Verify Statement: As a federal contractor, TECHSOFT is required to participate in the federal government's E-Verify program. With E-Verify we are able to confirm the employment authorization of all newly hired employees through an electronic database maintained by the Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration. The E-Verify process is completed in conjunction with a new hire's completion of the Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification upon commencement of employment. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates. For up-to-date information on E-Verify, go to www.uscis.gov and click on 'E-Verify' logo.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: One of our growing Memphis-based clients has a need for a Financial Analyst. The Financial Analyst will be responsible for working with various business unit leaders to provide analysis on their operations versus the business plan. This role will extract data from different systems, analyze it, and provide results to executive leadership. The Financial Analyst will also participate in the formal budget and forecast process. Candidates for the Financial Analyst role should have 3-4 years of applicable experience. Public accounting background along with a CPA is preferred. Strong systems skills are must for this role. For immediate consideration, please email your resume to Robert.beck@roberthalf.com.

Name: Desktop Support Analyst

People do.** As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person. *Leader among IT staffing agencies** The intersection of technology and people ? it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.  We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.  Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888.674.2094 to learn more about this position. Name: Process Analyst - Performance and Execution Management
Description: Requisition Number 18-2161 Post Date 11/29/2018 Title Process Analyst - Performance and Execution Management Part Time? No City Memphis State TN Description At First Tennessee Bank Operations, we are on a mission to deliver a seamless customer experience. We are passionate about doing things right and doing the right things. We collaborate with each other and with our internal business partners to delight  our customers. We believe in creating an environment where everyone’s ideas are valued so that the team operates at its best. Our team members serve with humility and a deep commitment to their responsibility to be the best at serving their customers one opportunity  at a time.  The Process Analyst supports multiple business lines by providing a comprehensive assessment of Operations processes in an effort to identify gaps and potential risks; focusing on performance improvement and incident prevention. The ideal candidate is very  detail oriented and views their work as their self-portrait. The Process Analyst possesses impeccable customer service skills, excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to maintain poise under pressure.  We are seeking dedicated, disciplined individuals who excel in a team environment, who take ownership and who are enthusiastic about a job well done. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Exercises a wide range of decision making control when presented with multi-faceted factors; ability to identify, resolve and escalate problems in collaboration with stakeholdersAssists in the design of new and/or expanded reviews; conduct research as needed and perform testing of proposed procedures for Operations to include but not limited to: o New hire on-boarding  o Validation of new and/or modified procedures are working as designed post implementation  o Business Systems  o Third Party Vendors  o Merger and Acquisition activity Documents testing performed and results achievedDrafts reports to communicate potential issues/gaps in processes. Discuss findings with business line management; to include developing an action plan that will satisfactorily address any issues noted.Communicates and collaborates with Operations partners to ensure necessary processes and/or procedures are documented to support action plans developed. o Business Line Management  o Process Designers  o Procedure Developers  o Third Party Vendors Monitors and assists in the resolution of issuesCoordinates/assists Operations business lines with exam coordination (Internal/External)Professional, respectful and timely communications within working team, business line partners and cross functional departments.Maintains a commitment to continuous learning, developing knowledge, and skills to competently and efficiently complete assignmentsAssists the Performance and Execution Manager in maintaining an effective testing program: o Identifies and reports testing that needs to be expanded to support business line updates  o Escalates gaps in processes as identified  o Recommendations to improve documented Policy and Procedures  o Recommendations of alternative approaches in testing that would promote “preventative” vs. “detective”. Ensures timely completion of testing while producing quality work; performs complex reviews with no/minimal guidanceParticipates in special projects as assigned o Communicates progress and impact to future testing to team; ensuring planning for validation is included. Abilities:Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary serviceAbility to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given.Skills:Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with internal customersExcellent computer proficiency (MS Office – Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook)Excellent organizational and customer service skills Requirements Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:Experience/working knowledge of multiple business lines supported; familiarity with deposit/treasury management products preferredExperience in reporting/data analysis a plusHigh School diploma required; degree preferred or equivalent experience/working knowledge of multiple business lines supportedPhysical Requirements:Basic keyboarding or other repetitive motionsLifting/pushing objectsMust be able to talk, listen and speak clearly on telephoneAbility to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standardsAbility to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with or without the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standard, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards. Name: Systems Analyst I - Storage Disk
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. PURPOSE: This position exists to support the disk storage needs and the management of the growth and performance for the external storage needs for all platforms at International Paper. Storage Management provides key disk storage allocations for the Unix, Windows and VMWare operating systems environments. This position will provide configuration and planning support for the existing SAN (Storage Area Network) environment that supports the open systems environments. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: + Maintaining high availability of the storage environment  + Planning, configuration, data migration and implementation for new storage acquisitions.  + Monitoring for performance of the storage subsystems.  + Capacity planning and storage allocation forecasting.  + SAN connectivity.  + Data security and retention policy KEY CHALLENGES: The external environment, including technology, competition, markets:  + Learning and adapting new storage technology into the International Paper storage environment.  + Working with storage vendors on storage related projects.  + Working with business customers on storage related issues and projects  The internal environment, including interaction with others, (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices:  + Working with internal customers on storage related issues.  + Managing growth in the range of 20% annually.  + Implementing new storage strategies to address the growth and performance of the storage environment.  The work itself, e.g., problems, opportunities, change:  + Managing growth and the demands of the environment.  + Creating a more cost effective storage allocation model. SCOPE: Day to day support and maintenance of corporate storage spread over multiple storage arrays between the Memphis TN. production datacenter, the Loveland OH. disaster recovery datacenter and the Mill production sites worldwide. This encompasses all of the corporate data enabling the enterprise and business specific applications as well as user specific and site data.  Assist both internal and business customers with current and future storage technologies to ensure the prudent and judicious use of corporate resources. Provide storage configuration and planning for the existing SAN environments. And provide on call support for the storage environment that requires support on a 24X7 basis. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE: + This position requires 3 - 5 years of storage management experience working with open systems disk storage (EMC & NetApp) and similar experience with Storage Area Networks (Brocade),EMC?s SRDF and NetApp?s SNAP Mirror technology.  + Experience with NetApp (OnCommand) and EMC Unisphere are also preferred.  + This environment requires 24X7 support that is shared with the other members of this group on a rotation basis. COMMENTS: Experience with Unix, Windows and VMWare operating systems is a plus.  International Paper is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans. Name: Business Systems Analyst II
Description: Apply Now  Business Systems Analyst II Memphis, TN 38133, USA  Req #142 Monday, November 12, 2018POSITION PURPOSE  The Business Systems Analyst II works with the Technology Strategies department to discover and scope projects related to Orion Federal Credit Union’s digital transformation, and act as an internal consultant and evaluator of business processes throughout the credit union. Projects range from new online and mobile banking features to existing or new software and processes for internal efficiencies. All projects will focus on financial institution enterprise technology and digital banking applications. This person will work closely with various development teams to deliver valuable product enhancements and integrations. This job will understand, analyze, document, refine and communicate business needs, so that all teams can build effective solutions. The goal of this role is ultimately to craft a company culture of efficiency and excellent member services through impactful and thoughtful solutions. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIESWork with vendors or internal teams to create solutions for small development projects or deliverables of larger projects.Work with department leads to scope and define business needs. Evaluate existing technology or new to design resources to improve enterprise processes.Perform analysis for internal business process improvement. Evaluate end to end processes throughout credit union; use Visual Studios to create process maps or flowcharts, and analyze these to make process improvement recommendations. Discover key components of the membership journey for Orion members and translate these findings into tangible tasks and projects. End products should reduce time spent in applications/ processes, and minimize “pain points” in daily tasks.Conduct market research and review company strategy to develop member facing products in online and mobile banking that meet those needs. Research new technology, acting as a consultant on optimal solutions and vendors based on data, reference recommendations, pricing, innovative techniques, integrations, and customer service.Work with Technical Projects Coordinator and business owners to verify user acceptance testing meets business goals.Input project data into project management system. Notate changes in the project timelines and create task lists. Track and report to Technology Strategies Manager. Create internal communications as needed for internal project information. Determine solutions to meet deadlines and accomplish goals.Create presentations of findings for upper management. Use creative communications to explain business needs. Run demos for new resources. Create videos and other media to communicate process improvement recommendations.All other tasks as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS    EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience required. Coursework in project management, and/or SCRUM/ Agile training preferred.  KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED: Basic understanding of Company operations. Ability to use Microsoft Office applications. Software development project management/ project coordination skills. Understanding of software development processes. Familiarity with database management.  EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Minimum 1-3 years prior experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, Project Analyst or similar role requiring needs analysis for business owners. Minimum 1-3 years in financial industry preferred.  SKILLS/ABILITIES:  Ability to operate a variety of computer applications.  Ability to perform extensive research and report findings.  Define and clearly articulate requirements (User Stories) and acceptance criteria (Use Cases). Work with multiple departments and people at different technical levels to accomplish goals and complete projects.  Manage requirements with Product Backlogs. Identify ROI, alignment with company strategy, and resource capacity of vendors and internal departments.  Ability to work independently and identify tasks that need completion.  Strong technical writing experience and skills.  Strong data analysis capability.  Excellent organizational skills.  Professional appearance, dress, and attitude.  WORKING CONDITIONS: Typical office environment, some travel requiredOrion FCU is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or any other federal or state protected class. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Name: Data Analyst I- Preventive Medicine
Description: PayGrade: 38  HiringRange: $17.43- $20.92/Hourly THIS IS A GRANT FUNDEDPOSITIONJOB SUMMARY/ESSENTIAL JOBFUNCTIONS: The Data Analyst I prepares andperforms data analysis for the Center for Health Equity in the UTHSC-WestCancer Center within the Departments of Radiation Oncology and PreventiveMedicine. This position performs duties that includes data development and collectionneeds of assigned clinical service, functional, or operational departments;collection of clinical, operational and financial data elements from multiplesources; ensuring the accuracy and completeness of data; analyzing informationto identify trends and present recommendations for improvements. This positionis also responsible for developing and maintaining databases; preparation ofrecurring and special reports for management reflecting clinical and financialmetrics for dashboards and activities, such as statistical reports foroperational and performance improvement; developing electronic alternatives forsystem reports, queries, and downloads to evaluate data; and preparing datavisualization and on-going reports for program management. DUTIES ANDRESPONSIBILITIES:Identifies problems with the data and data collection procedures, determining in-range and out of range or erroneous data values.Decides which routine is most appropriate for addressing the problem data, and determines the investigation process of data.Performs data organization and management procedures for large, and multiple sources datasets.Prepares and analyzes data using database, graphics, and statistical software on personal computer; prepares results for presentation.Programs in SAS to create statistical routines for data analysis.Provides oversight of database content and integrity.Manages large data sets produced by external contracted sources and fit to study needs.Performs data cleaning routines to ensure quality data.Prepares statistical results and utilizing results to create reports, presentations, and publications.Trains research staff on proper data collection, database usage procedures, database management, and analysis methods.Performs data entry and verification into statistical software, as needed.Performs other duties as assigned.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: EDUCATION: Bachelor'sDegree in Public Health, Business Administration, Computer Science, HealthInformation (TRANSCRIPT REQUIRED)  EXPERIENCE: One (1)year of experience with statistical analysis, managing and cleaning datasets,and using SAS for data analysis. OR Master's Degree will be accepted in lieu ofexperience. SAS programming skills is required. Knowledge of statistical analyses.Data management skills. MS products application skills. Written and verbalcommunication skills. Knowledge of relational database methods preferred.  WORK SCHEDULE: This position may occasionally work evenings.  No Travel is requiredSDL2017

Name: Supv Management and Program Analyst
Description: Videos Duties Help  Help  Duties  Summary This position is assigned to the Business Management and Administration Section; Family Readiness Division; Commander, Navy Installations Command (CNIC). Fleet and Family Readiness (FFR) is the Navy’s Quality of Life (QOL) program providing essential products and services to promote and improve the retention, capabilities, quality, productivity, reputation and morale of all Navy Personnel and their families.Learn more about this agencyResponsibilities In order to qualify for this position, resumes must provide sufficient experience and/or education, knowledge, skills, and ability to perform the duties of the position. Applicant resumes are the key means for evaluating skills, knowledge, and abilities as they relate to this position therefore, applicants are encouraged to be clear and specific when describing experience.  Serves as senior analyst and program manager for the FFSP Certification Program and performs development, management and implementation of Navy FFSP Certification standards and review processes used by Installations, Regions and Certification Team to evaluate program compliance and quality of service provided in Navy Fleet and Family Service Centers (FFSCs). Ensures Navy FFSP Certification is aligned to Department of Defense (DoD) FR certification requirements, as well as DoD Family Advocacy Program (FAP) compliance reporting processes. Ensures standards used during FFSP Certification accurately reflect family readiness policies, mission and goals of the Department of the Navy (DON) and DoD.  Conducts detailed analysis of complex functions and work processes of programs and makes recommendations for improvement in the effectiveness and efficiency of the FFSP and work operations. Develops new methods, organizational structures, and management processes. Counsels and advises program analysts on methods and procedures, management surveys, management reports, and control techniques.  Establishes procedures for scheduling Certification Visits and for the composition of both off-site and on-site Certification Teams. Provides management and oversight of all FFSP Certification Review processes including Installation Self-Assessment, coordination of findings between off-site and on-site reviewers, communication of certification findings, analysis and determining sufficiency of additional evidence of compliance, conferral of FFSP Certification and Maintenance of Compliance reporting and processes. Manages the FFSP Certification Schedule to ensure requirements are met and lapses in FFSP Certification are minimized. Oversees and directs the DoD Family Readiness Certification and FAP Compliance reporting processes. Ensures Team Members, headquarters, regional and installation managers are trained and aware of Navy FFSP Certification standards and processes. Develops and implements initial and refresher training for Team Reviewers.Provides guidance to Certification Team reviewers and FFSP managers during site visits, both when serving as Certification Team Lead and when an alternate Team Lead is on site. Follows up on findings, recommendations, and deficiencies as identified.  Evaluates the performance of Alternate Team Leads and Team Reviewers, addressing any performance issues identified by Team Reviewer or Installation Staff surveys in a timely manner.  Provides review and analysis and makes recommendations to senior Family Readiness managers when a region or installation submits a request for review of an FFSP Certification finding.  Evaluates the content of new or modified legislation relating to family readiness programs to determine the programmatic impact within the CNIC Area of Responsibility. Makes changes to Certification standards based on policy changes and translates approved legislative changes into CNIC program guidelines and Navy FFSP Certification standards.  Provides annual analysis and program updates to the Certification Advisory Council comprised of Regional Family Readiness Program Directors.  Prepares supporting documentation in the form of spreadsheets, Power Point presentations, databases, word documents for presentations and proposals by higher-level management.  Recommends and approves performance awards and salary/bonus distribution for subordinates. Participates in interview panels, recommends, and approves hiring, promotions and reassignments.  Manages the FFSP Management Assist Team (MAT), ensuring regional or installation requests for Site Augmentation are coordinated and filled in a timely manner and performance of the MAT staff is evaluated by the Regional/Site POC at the conclusion of the assignment. Ensures the currency of MAT staff training for assuming Headquarters, Regional and Installation level assignments with very short advanced notice.  Directs work to be accomplished by staff. Assigns work based on priorities, difficulty and requirements of assignments, and staff capabilities. Conducts annual performance reviews of staff. Participates in section staffing decisions. Ensures staff receives proper training to fulfill requirements of their positions. Addresses potential disciplinary and/or performance issues timely and takes appropriate, corrective action(s) as necessary.  Directly supervises and provides technical oversight for up to two (2) full time subordinates (GS-12E); and up to 20 flex employees. Travel Required50% or less - may be required. Supervisory statusNo Promotion Potential05 Job family (Series)0343 Management And Program Analysis Similar jobs  Analysts, Management Analysts, Program Distribution Managers Management Analysts Managers, Distribution Program Analysts Requirements Help  Help  Requirements  Conditions of Employment Must successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. Any discrepancies must be resolved as a condition of employment. QualificationsResumes must include information which demonstrates experience and knowledge, skills, and ability (KSAs) as they relate to this position. Applicants are encouraged to be clear and specific when describing their experience level and KSAs.  A bachelor's degree in education and/or social science or a related field is preferred.  Knowledge of social/human services delivery systems and concepts, principles and theories relating to one or more of the social or behavioral science fields.  Knowledge of advanced concepts of program management, requirements determination, policy development, evaluative and analytical processes, and program implementation.  Knowledge and understanding of requirements and operations of the DoD and the DON programs that support military members and families.  Knowledge of the Navy operational/organizational structure, chain of command, protocol and funding, agency programs and activities; agency mission, policies, and objectives; management principles and processes; and analytical and evaluative methods as it relates to the Navy wide FFSP.  Knowledge of development, procurement, award, and administration of military support/human services contracts.  Knowledge of the concepts of program management, requirement determination, policy development, evaluative and analytical processes, and programs implementation. Ability to apply these concepts in order to design and conduct a comprehensive, quality assurance program.  Knowledge of family readiness functions, organizations, policies, resources and analytical and evaluative processes.  Knowledge of qualitative and/or quantitative methods for the assessment and improvement of program effectiveness and/or identification of improvement areas.  Knowledge of research methodology, information retrieval and data organization for analysis, decision making, and formulation of recommendations.  Knowledge of techniques and formats required for effective communication with Political Appointees (PA), Members of Congress, Senior Executive Service (SES), and flag level officials as well as in drafting policies/programs.  Knowledge of CNIC‘s EEO policy and procedures.  Skill in developing, organizing, and conducting executive studies through team efforts.  Ability to analyze and prepare clear, concise, and technically sound reports related to work within the Branch.  Ability to develop and effectively deliver presentations and/or training.  Ability to perform the full range of supervisory duties.  Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. EducationIf you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:  Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S.  Department of Education: http://www.ed.gov/admins/finaid/accred/  Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

Name: Business Systems Analyst III
Description: Job Description Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and  user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business  strategies. Writes detailed description of user needs, program  functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.  Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs.  Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.  Demonstrates expertise in a variety of the field's concepts,  practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment  to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May provide  consultation on complex projects and is considered to be the top level  contributor/specialist. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is  expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.  Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough  understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and  translate them into operational requirements Support will encompass  all components of the enlisted personnel, billet files, and decision  support tools. The contractor shall provide personnel with extensive  knowledge of Navy MPTE metrics and the ability to determine new Supply  Chain related corporate metrics.  Required Skills Education: A bachelor s degree from an accredited  academic institution is required; a Master s degree is preferred.  Position requires a minimum of three years of professional MPTE Supply  Chain experience in Navy Community Management, Distribution, or  Training and demonstrated familiarity with the following systems: Navy  Standard Integrated Personnel System (NSIPS), Navy Retention  Monitoring System (NRMS), Navy Manpower, Programming and Budget System  (NMPBS), Career Waypoints (C-WAY), Navy Training Management Planning  System (NTMPS), Total Force Manpower Management System (TFMMS) and  TFMMS Micro Manpower Change Application (TMMCA), Corporate Enterprise  Training Activity Resource System (CeTARS), Cognos, and a strong  proven record using Excel and PowerPoint. Must (REQUIRED) possess  intermediate to advance level skills in Microsoft Office to include  Excel and/or ACCESS. Will be required to fill out an Excel/Access  skills sheet. Must have extensive advanced excel skills. Interview may  include a test for building macros from scratch, pivot tables, and  etc. Please do not apply if you are missing advanced Excel skills.  Requires you to have a clearance or the rating of eligible for  Secret . At this time we will not be able to take anyone without one  or higher. Secret Clearance preferred. Position Located Millington, TN  (onsite).  Employment Type Full time  Career Level  Job ID ********  Company Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc.  Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. federal  civilian agencies, the intelligence community, the Government of  Canada, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help  our clients deliver vital services more efficiently, while increasing  the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon,  Virginia, Serco has approximately 6,000 employees with an annual  revenue of $1 billion and is part of a $4 billion global business that  helps transform government and public services around the world. At  Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset, and our success  directly relates to our employees. At Serco, we listen, respect and  support our employees and through continuous training, development and  information-sharing, we advance talent internally, enhancing career  growth and progression which enables not only our employees to excel  but enables our customers to excel as well. It is not just a job at  Serco; at Serco, we offer career opportunities. We invite you to  become part of our dynamic team. Serco's people share a passion for  delivering ethical service, innovation, and a commitment to results.  We trust our people to deliver. Serco is an equal opportunity employer  committed to diversifying its workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual  Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/  Vets).  Functional AreaStrategy & Transformation  DepartmentSerco s Federal Services business unit provides services in the  areas of business processing, case management, intelligence,  logistics, personnel readiness, acquisition and program management,  modelling, and simulation and training to Defense and Federal Civilian  agencies. We understand the often complex regulatory and security  requirements of executing government programs and we stand up programs  quickly, assembling and training highly qualified teams, and  delivering to well-defined service level metrics.
