Name: Senior Analyst
Description: Senior Analyst - Grains and Oilseeds Memphis, TennesseeJob Reference: MTX-ANA-04283 Location: Memphis, Tennessee Closing Date: 25/12/2018 Department: Analyst Division: Business IntelligenceSenior Analyst, Grains and Oilseeds Informa | Memphis, TN Agribusiness Intelligence is seeking an experienced commodities analyst to join the crops analytical team. The role involves comprehensive supply and demand analysis for US and global markets, including price forecasts and enhancement and development of price risk management strategies for clients across the global agriculture spectrum. The analyst will be responsible for maintaining and providing fundamental supply and demand analysis for the assigned commodity, provide ongoing research developments and commentary to clients, and to work with other areas in the Agribusiness Intelligence company. The analyst is expected to be a team player, contribute to ongoing conversations, and be willing to take on extra duties when other team members are absent. Commodities covered in the crops team include feed grains (corn, sorghum, barley, oats), food grains (wheat, rice), and the oilseed complex.  Analysts convey research results through a variety of channels including internal meetings, written reports (daily, weekly), in-person presentations, and client calls.  Informa Agribusiness Intelligence assists organizations across the global agribusiness value chain in making strategic and transactional decisions with news, pricing and forecast data, analysis and consulting from the seed and crop protection sector, fertilizers, animal pharmaceuticals, commodities trading, food processing and manufacturing and international regulation. Required ExperienceExperience conducting economic and market researchKnowledge of futures and cash marketsBS Agricultural Economics, Economics, or related field, MS a plusFive+ years of industry experienceA passion for commodity markets and how they operateSuperior written and oral communications skillsDesire to learnCommitment to team workExcellent MS Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint skillsWho We AreAgribusiness Intelligencehttps://informa.com/divisions/business-intelligence/agribusiness-intelligence/Our customers rely on us as the go-to provider of news, data, analysis and forecasts across the agricultural and commodities value chain. Delivering a critical information advantage in a fast paced and volatile industry, we help the world’s largest and most influential agribusiness organisations work faster and smarter. Through a combination of highly respected insight and data, forecasting and analysis, focused one-off reports, events and bespoke consultancy, we help our customers understand the global agribusiness supply chain. We also provide the timely, actionable intelligence they need to make business-critical decisions with confidence, whether to mitigate risk or identify new opportunities.Back  Apply for job

Name: IT Security Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionIT Security Analyst  We are looking for an IT Security Analyst with at least 4 years experience to fill a Permanent position immediately. It is a requirement that potential candidates have a strong understanding of a Security Framework such as COBIT, ITIL, COSO, ISO 27002 or others. This person will be tasked to evaluate and audit infrastructure components such as servers, computers anti-virus software, email filters, web content filters, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, patch management and other technologies used to protect business systems and information. Audit systems and activity logs to measure compliance with security policies and procedures. Draft and disseminate policies, procedures, and guidelines to raise awareness of information protection and security best practices. The IT Security Analyst will keep current on the ever changing field of information security and report their findings to management for further review. This person should also be familiar with conducting network and system vulnerability and penetration tests. This position will be responsible for working close with other Administrators (Network, Windows, Unix and PC) to assure the integrity of security configurations, policies and best practices. The ability to travel when required will be expected.  In addition to the above an IT Security Analyst should possess the following skills:  Develop and implement enterprise level security initiatives.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Solid knowledge of Windows and network system vulnerabilities and exploits  Be well versed in firewall, network, proxy and intrusion detection and prevention systems.  Experience in network security (Cisco ASA, IPS, VPN, RSA SecurID, PKI, cryptography), security controls for LAN/WANs, client server, and web-based systems  Plan and implement security measures to protect computer systems, networks and data.  Stay up-to-date on the latest intelligence, including hackers methodologies, in order to anticipate security breaches.  Prevent data loss and service interruptions by researching new technologies that will effectively protect a network.  Assess the effectiveness of Information Security policies and pointing out vulnerabilities or lack of controls to mitigate a given risk.  Work with departments in the company to make recommendations for improvements and craft detailed design documents for them to implement.  Knowledge of communications protocols, network routing, packet, and content filtering  Knowledge on how to penetrate systems, networks, and applications in order to detect their vulnerabilities so that companies can correct flaws and improve their security  Performing risk assessments and testing of data processing systems  Recommending security enhancements and purchases  Training staff on network and information security procedures  Company DescriptionMillennium Search is a premier staffing and employment solutions provider. Name: Credit Analyst - Commercial Banking
Description: Requisition Number 18-2167 Post Date 11/30/2018 Title Credit Analyst - Commercial Banking Part Time? No City Memphis State TN Description First Tennessee is looking for an individual with strong interpersonal skills as well as a solid background in finance and/or accounting. This position is for a Credit Analyst in the MidSouth Commercial Banking Group located in East Memphis. The Commercial  Banking Group is responsible for managing and underwriting banking relationships (comprised of loans, deposits and other products) of locally owned businesses.  The Credit Analyst (CA) is an entry level position into the Mid-South Commercial Banking Group of First Tennessee Bank. The CA will work directly with the deal team in analyzing, underwriting and monitoring all credit facilities within their portfolio. As a  CA, the individual will learn the basics of deal making and loan structures while being exposed to other departments within the Bank. The CA is an excellent first position in banking that paves the way to numerous other positions within First Tennessee including  sales, credit, relationship management, loan review or other similar positions. Duties and Responsibilities: Work with the Portfolio Manager (PM) and Relationship Manager (RM) in completing the credit analysis. The credit analysis is Commercial Banking's primary document for analyzing and underwriting all new and outstanding loans. The credit analysis performs an  in depth analysis on the borrower's ability to repay focusing on the company and owner's background, recent and historical financial performance, guarantor's (if applicable) financial condition, and several other factors related to First Tennessee's underwriting  policies and guidelines.  Support the PM and RM team in managing the client relationship as needed. The Credit Analyst will sit in on credit meetings as needed and join the RM on client calls on occasion. Requirements Bachelors degree required, Finance or Accounting major preferred. At a minimum, the candidate should have exposure to finance and accounting through completed college courses or relevant work experience. M - F 8AM - 5PM #LI-PF1All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender stereo typing, and age. First Tennessee is an EO employer – M/F/Vets/Disabled.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here. Name: Portfolio Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY Provides extensive support to Portfolio Managers in the servicing of portfolios of commercial real estate loans. Duties include but are not limited to loan and real estate analysis, client interface, and general administrative duties.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Assists Portfolio Managers by performing tasks involved in monitoring the performance of assigned commercial real estate loan portfolios. Provides general customer service to lenders and borrowers. Performs research involving loan documents and servicing agreements. Assists in the preparation of recommendations for lender consent items such as leasing transactions, property management changes, reserve draws, collateral releases, and numerous other real estate related borrower requests. Reviews loan covenants by analyzing the requirements and working with the borrower until resolution. Collect and analyze property financial statements and rent rolls. Schedule, prepare and deliver extensive client reports Special projects as required.  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES None  QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Basic understanding of the mortgage banking industry, with an ability to gain an understanding of the responsibilities of each department in a mortgage banking and loan servicing organization. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and simultaneously manage and effectively prioritize numerous complicated issues. Excellent organizational skills.  EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university and one-to-three years related experience.  COMMUNICATION SKILLS Ability to read, analyze and interpret loan documents and industry reports. Ability to clearly write  reports and business correspondence. Ability to effectively present information to both external clients and internal management.  MATHEMATICAL SKILLS General understanding of real estate financial principles. Ability to perform basic financial calculations.  CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS None  COMPUTER SKILLS Proficient in common Microsoft applications including Excel and Word. CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2017 revenues of $14.2 billion and more than 80,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #214 in 2017. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 17 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for six years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE.”  CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. Name: Systems Analyst I
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. Purpose: This position is for a Systems Analyst I on the Remote Windows Enterprise Support team. This role will be responsible for the consultation, installation, maintenance, uptime, availability and operational health on the Windows Server platforms. This includes engineering new solutions, as well as maintaining the existing install base and consulting with customers to provide integration solutions to their computing needs. Primary duties will include troubleshooting and resolving issues with Microsoft Windows servers distributed across the company?s 600+ locations in North America.  The key customers for this position are other internal support teams. Applications support teams are the group?s primary customers. This role will work with internal teams and vendors to develop and implement solutions on the Windows platforms.  The team?s key performance indicators include server availability, server health, customer satisfaction ratings and server to admin ratios.  Due to the 24/7 support requirements of the position, the individual must be available for frequent on-call duty after hours, on weekends, and on holidays.  Key Accountabilities  Administration of up to 2000+ Windows servers located in offices, plants and mills in North America  + Second and third level troubleshooting for all Intel/AMD based servers ? last line of support for the Windows platform  + Second level troubleshooting for Active Directory  + Implementation and support for Microsoft DHCP in North American locations  + All aspects of support for the Citrix platform including engineering new technologies  + Automation and scripting to streamline support of the platforms  + Maintaining revision levels for all hardware/software, virus definitions  + Providing innovative solutions to challenging technical issues  + Managing the overall platform availability to meet customer SLA?s  + Must work seamlessly coordinating projects and support work with team members located in other countries and other time zones  + Serve as product owners for select tool sets on the platform with responsibilities including evaluating technologies directly with vendors, choosing solutions, engineering the rollouts and maintaining all ongoing support  + Perform change management for the platforms  Provide technical expertise  + Acting as a subject matter expert and knowledge resources to other team members and other support teams and vendors  + Consulting on complex projects  + Engineering new solutions involving servers and storage on Windows platforms  + Providing consultation to customers requesting information about application and/or data hosting  + Training of other support teams on their particular applications, specialized configurations on the platform as well as standard software to maintain the environment  + Providing feedback relating to operational issues  + Ensuring that improvements in and/or changes to operations are implemented and monitored to increase efficiency  + Providing documentation on advanced technical issues  + Keeping abreast of technological advances within the industry  + Project management for areas affecting the server platforms such as rollouts of new technology, hardware/software refreshes, changes to security models and others as needed  + Advanced VMWare Knowledge. Provide Technical guidance on VMWare Platform Archiecture.  + PowerShell scripting ability for task automotation is a plus but not required  + Knowledge of SAN and Network technologies within mill environments  Increasing the level of customer service that WES provides  + Meeting or exceeding SLO/SLA expectations  + Identifying, testing and implementing changes to customer specific software and configurations to support overall application availability  + Designing, initiating, implementing and monitoring changes to operations and processes  + Creating new processes and operational procedures  + Striving to properly communicate with customers in the event of a server outage or other catastrophic event  + Providing availability and other reporting to customers upon request  Key Challenges  The internal environment, including interaction with others (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices:  This position will meet challenges with an ever changing work load. There are always acquisitions, divestitures, and other large scale projects that involve this team. This work is very dynamic, fast paced and very demanding at times. Multi-tasking in a fast paced environment is a requirement of this role.  This individual should be comfortable with change. Due to acquisitions and other projects individuals may be required to take on the engineering, support and maintenance of new equipment and new technologies with little or no training and without disruption to the business. Acquisitions introduce opportunities to learn and grow in new areas.  This position will work closely with hardware and software vendors and other internal teams in order to implement solutions maintain best practices and obtain warranty service.  The external environment, including technology, competition, markets:  This position will meet challenges due to the ever changing nature of the technology. New hardware, operating systems and supporting software must be maintained at a supported level at all times. This team serves as the product owner for several technologies and in that role must maintain all aspects of that software and its compatibility in the environment. Constant hardware and software upgrade projects are a challenge.  This position is always challenged to work in the most efficient manner. The team must always be the lowest cost provider when compared to other sources. To this end it is a high performance environment where high expectations are the norm and efficiency and constant process improvement is extremely important.  This position may meet challenges due to the remote nature of the work and the hectic pace. The work itself, problems, opportunities, change: This position will have to keep current with the business requirements, business applications, and current technology offerings. Opportunities involve the potential to enable IP?s IT division to streamline business and positively affect the bottom line. It will be necessary to anticipate and predict the needs of the business in an effort to offer the shortest time to deliver possible.  Scope  This position will have the potential to positively affect the business by providing quick, reliable technology solutions and service offerings relating to the Windows server platform. This position is part of a team that is responsible for up to 2000+ distributed servers. Hardware and Operating system support and solutions are the core offerings of the team. To those ends the team is end to end responsible for server availability, server monitoring, vulnerability management as well as solutions engineering and ongoing support. In addition the team is responsible end to end for the support of the Citrix platform and Microsoft DHCP. The team is responsible for all aspects of the North American mill VMware deployments.  The candidate should be able to work with minimum supervision, conferring with a superior on unusual matters, and may be assisted by entry/junior or intermediate level personnel, both here and in Krakow, Poland. He/she will interact directly with vendors, internal support teams, application developers/owners, and end users for the purpose of supporting the Intel server environment.  Most assignments are broad, usually requiring originality and ingenuity. The person must possess the ability to run and manage projects on their own. Typically, this person will have 8-10 years minimum of professional technical experience in the areas specified and appreciable latitude for unreviewed action or decision.  Teamwork is critical to this team?s success. Individuals placed into this team should be highly motivated, energetic, and results oriented. High expectations are the norm.  This person may be responsible for training and mentoring junior level team members.  Knowledge and experience  Expert knowledge with Microsoft Windows Server platforms  Expert knowledge and support experience with VMware (certification preferred)  Expert knowledge of common enterprise services such as AD, WINS, DNS, and DHCP  Expert knowledge of Intel/AMD server hardware platforms  In depth knowledge of various types of enterprise storage devices  Powershell Scripting a plus  Windows MCSE or MCITP strongly preferred  Enterprise server administration experience required  Citrix support knowledge is strongly preferred (certification preferred)  Network experience for troubleshooting purposes  Project management skills a plus  Bachelor?s degree preferred but not required  Action Oriented  Dealing with Ambiguity  Customer Focus  Directing Others  Drive for Results  Timely Decision Making and Decision Quality  Functional / Technical Skills  Composure  Learning on the Fly  Listening  Project Management  Perseverance  Priority Setting  Problem Solving  Patience  Time management  Written and Oral Communications  International Paper is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans.

Name: Quality System Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionABOUT USSmith & Nephew supports healthcare professionals in more than 100 countries in their daily efforts to improve the lives of their patients. We do this by taking a pioneering approach to the design of our advanced medical products and services, by securing wider access to our diverse technologies for more customers globally, and by enabling better outcomes for patients and healthcare systems.We have leadership positions in:Orthopaedics Reconstruction - joint replacement systems for knees, hips and shouldersAdvanced Wound Management - wound care treatment and prevention products used to treat hard-to-heal woundsSports Medicine - minimally invasive surgery of the jointTrauma & Extremities - products that help repair broken bonesWe have around 16,000 employees around the world. Annual sales in 2016 were more than $4.6 billion. We are a constituent of the UK's FTSE100 and our shares are traded on the London Stock Exchange and through American Depository Receipts on the New York Stock Exchange (LSE: SN, NYSE: SNN)SUMMARYWe are hiring a Quality System Data Analyst to join our Global Quality Systems Team. Your main tasks will include collecting and performing detailed data analysis, and documenting QMS processes. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and the aptitude for continuous improvement. You should also embody the ability to manage competing and shifting priorities. This is a high visibility role; therefore, you will need to be both professional and self-assured.RESPONSIBILITIESFacilitating ongoing reviews of QMS processes and developing optimization strategies.Developing QMS KPI metricsConducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.Performing field action analysis, process, and pre-closure audits.Supporting Clinical Quality organization as needed.Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.Serving as a backup for the NtM and Health Hazard Evaluation processesEffectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members, management and executive leaders.Gathering critical information for monthly and quarterly meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports and presentations.Working closely with sites, legal manufactures, and managerial staff to ensure consistent and timely data collection.Supporting projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.Prioritizing initiatives based on QMS needs and requirements.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects/tasks.Evaluating QMS processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, developing and implementing solutions.REQUIREMENTSA bachelor’s degree in business or related fieldA minimum of 2 to 4 years of experience in Medical Device Quality Systems or a related field.The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Excellent communication and documentation skills.Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access.A track record of following through on commitments.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.Smith and Nephew is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Sr Planning Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Nike, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accountants, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide - making the impossible happen every single day.  Description  As a Planning Business Analyst, you will have an exceptional opportunity to work closely with the North America Supply Chain senior leadership team, program leaders and functional leaders in DC Operations, planning, customer service, transportation and retail. You will: Drive analytics and performance measurement within the distribution center and provide recommendations for process improvementPartner across various levels of the organization to develop and support complex data visualization toolsCollaborate with our extended supply chain teams to define, prioritize and sequence near-term and long-range initiativesManage a wide range of inputs and simplify to establish clear goals while communicating to all stakeholders You will use your analytical and communication skills and ability to influence and build consensus across multiple stakeholders to create a collaborative, innovative, and high-performing strategy network. High tolerance for ambiguity is a must. Overview: To drive development and implementation of logistics and distribution models, strategies and/or processes. To measure operational performance and use the information to enhance business results. Focusing on creating and maintaining effective and efficient distribution tools to support business results. Requires knowledge and experience in Supply Chain analytics. You will work with DC operations management and the cross-functional supply chain partners to ensure the most cost efficient plan is executed that drive KPI's to ensure customer order delivery in full and on time.  Core Accountabilities  To build knowledge of the company, processes and customers. To understand the key business drivers; using this knowledge in analysis. Solves a range of problems, analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. To develop, document, and execute on strategic plans which will drive optimal customer service and profitability.  Develop and maintain business KPI's and analyze data; present findings and recommendations to drive key business decisions. Support the business using statistical methods for process and performance assessment.  Problem solving and solution creation. Respond to requests from internal/external customers. Investigate these requests and partner on a solution enabling the effective and efficient distribution of products and services. Providing solutions to achieve the targeted sales goals while aggressively pursuing customer service standards.  Collaborate to drive operational excellence and best practices across the network by providing analytical information to enhance results. QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain, Engineering, Finance or related fieldMBA or advanced degree is preferred; 2 years additional experience in lieu of an advanced degree5+ years of experience with supply chain, merchandising, finance, sales or customer service3+ years of experience in business/strategic planning, or management consultingStrong project management, problem structuring, and strategic problem solving skillsDemonstrated ability to complete quantitative and qualitative analysisProficiency in Supply Chain Analytics tools like Tableau, Alteryx, VB, and SQLExperience managing complex cross-functional stakeholder engagements, including facilitating workshops, is preferredExceptional interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal), and the ability to work cross-functionallyGreat listening skills and openness for different viewpointsStrong presentation and influencing skills and the ability to interact with senior leadershipSelf-starter, eager to learn, result-oriented and creative strategic thinkerAdvanced skills in MS Excel & Access and experience in SAPProficiency in Manhattan WMS preferredShift Flexibility will be required. Candidate may be required to work the day shift and night shift, depending on the needs of the business

Name: Business Systems Analyst III (Metrics)
Description: Job Description Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Demonstrates expertise in a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May provide consultation on complex projects and is considered to be the top level contributor/specialist. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department. Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into operational requirements Support will encompass all components of the enlisted personnel, billet files, and decision support tools. The contractor shall provide personnel with extensive knowledge of Navy MPTE metrics and the ability to determine new Supply Chain related corporate metrics.Required Skills Education: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited academic institution is required; a Master’s degree is preferred.  Position requires a minimum of three years of professional MPTE Supply Chain experience in Navy Community Management, Distribution, or Training and demonstrated familiarity with the following systems: Navy Standard Integrated Personnel System (NSIPS), Navy Retention Monitoring System (NRMS), Navy Manpower, Programming and Budget System (NMPBS), Career Waypoints (C-WAY), Navy Training Management Planning System (NTMPS), Total Force Manpower Management System (TFMMS) and TFMMS Micro Manpower Change Application (TMMCA), Corporate Enterprise Training Activity Resource System (CeTARS), Cognos, and a strong proven record using Excel and PowerPoint.  Must (REQUIRED) possess intermediate to advance level skills in Microsoft Office to include Excel and/or ACCESS.  Will be required to fill out an Excel/Access skills sheet. Must have extensive advanced excel skills. Interview may include a test for building macros from scratch, pivot tables, and etc. Please do not apply if you are missing advanced Excel skills.  Requires you to have a clearance or the rating of ‘eligible for Secret’. At this time we will not be able to take anyone without one or higher. Secret Clearance preferred.  Position Located Millington, TN (onsite).Employment Type Full timeCareer LevelJob ID 52580467Company Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. federal civilian agencies, the intelligence community, the Government of Canada, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently, while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco has approximately 6,000 employees with an annual revenue of $1 billion and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset, and our success directly relates to our employees. At Serco, we listen, respect and support our employees and through continuous training, development and information-sharing, we advance talent internally, enhancing career growth and progression which enables not only our employees to excel but enables our customers to excel as well. It is not just a job at Serco; at Serco, we offer career opportunities. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco's people share a passion for delivering ethical service, innovation, and a commitment to results. We trust our people to deliver. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).Functional AreaStrategy & TransformationDepartmentSerco’s Federal Services business unit provides services in the areas of business processing, case management, intelligence, logistics, personnel readiness, acquisition and program management, modelling, and simulation and training to Defense and Federal Civilian agencies. We understand the often complex regulatory and security requirements of executing government programs and we stand up programs quickly, assembling and training highly qualified teams, and delivering to well-defined service level metrics.

Name: Configuration Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionABOUT US Smith & Nephew supports healthcare professionals in more than 100 countries in their daily efforts to improve the lives of their patients. We do this by taking a pioneering approach to the design of our advanced medical products and services, by securing wider access to our diverse technologies for more customers globally, and by enabling better outcomes for patients and healthcare systems.  We have leadership positions in: Orthopaedics Reconstruction - joint replacement systems for knees, hips and shouldersAdvanced Wound Management - wound care treatment and prevention products used to treat hard-to-heal woundsSports Medicine - minimally invasive surgery of the jointTrauma & Extremities - products that help repair broken bones We have around 16,000 employees around the world. Annual sales in 2016 were more than $4.6 billion. We are a constituent of the UK's FTSE100 and our shares are traded on the London Stock Exchange and through American Depository Receipts on the New York Stock Exchange (LSE: SN, NYSE: SNN) SUMMARY Responsible for ensuring that product definition information and changes to that information are identified, approved, verified, and recorded in enough detail to produce and support the product throughout its lifecycle. Works cross-functionally to facilitate the change management process according to established procedures and Configuration Management principles. Provides Matrix user support and guidance, with regard to the change process. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSFacilitates the change process. Reviews product structure and information for accuracy. Reviews engineering change requests to ensure documentation is clear and valid, with enough detail to effectively initiate and drive the change. Ensures that requests conform to CM principles and department procedures / requirements. Analyzes the impact of changes to products and their associated documentation and components. Reviews changes to determine interchangeability, and actions appropriately.Facilitates process and PLM system training classes for all users of the change process. Maintains training material to ensure that material reflects current processes.Maintains the change process documentation to ensure that documentation reflects current policies, procedures, and business practices. Responsible for describing the change process to satisfy internal and external audits.REQUIREMENTSTravel: None Education: Associate or Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Engineering, or IT Licenses/Certifications: CMII, CMPIC, or other CM certification preferred Experience: Candidates must have 1+ years experience working in a manufacturing environment with a background in Quality, Regulatory, Engineering, or IT related field. Must have prior experience reviewing engineering changes (drawings, procedures, product structure) with an aptitude for detail. Candidate must be able to work cross-functionally, and possess the ability to negotiate with, or persuade / influence others. Must be able to work independently, and drive teams toward completing a common goal. Other: In addition the candidate must have the following: Knowledge of Configuration Management principles and toolsPrior experience using a PLM system; Matrix preferredPrior experience using an ERP system; SAP preferredSmith and Nephew is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

Name: Senior Analyst, OTC Hotel Accounting
Description: Job SummaryHilton's Finance team is responsible for managing all global activities related to financial performance, accounting, tax, forecasting, risk management, and asset management. Within Finance, Hilton Accounting and Finance Services (HAFS) manages the finance and accounting functions, both on property and at Corporate, allowing us to develop scalable, global financial processes. Our finance Centers of Excellence provides Hilton Team Members the chance for challenging career growth across a wide spectrum of critical financial functions.What will I be doing?As the Senior Analyst, OTC Hotel Accounting, you will work with the Team Lead to resolve accounts receivable and guest (transient) disputes. You will identify and process advanced deposits received from Group Catering and Event Sales clients. You will also perform continuous monitoring and tracking of outstanding payments from group master and convention related billings.  More specifically, you will:Handle guest inquires and provide appropriate resolution.Engage hotel teams to assist with identifying issues, resolving disputes and obtaining client information as needed.Engage your Team Lead to figure out if adjustments are required.Maintain dispute resolution documentation in accordance with Hilton standards. This includes updating call logs and maintaining collections files.Perform follow-up based on establishing a collections schedule of outstanding payments.Review booking deposit reports to identify groups with advanced deposit requirements. This includes reviewing banking statements to identify and confirm receipt of advanced deposits.Prepare deposit postings and confirm deposits were posted successfully.Support special initiatives as directed by leadership.Report results to others, effectively explaining and deciphering findings.Develop cooperative and positive relationships with other finance and corporate departments.Contribute to the establishment of specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish project and department goals.Attend staff meetings pertinent to work assignments.Research and respond to information requests from internal departments and management.Maintain an upbeat, positive and motivated demeanor especially when interacting with Hilton guests, coworkers, and managers.Ensure the privacy and security of confidential information about guests.What are we looking for?We are looking for dynamic teammates, who are passionate about using their analytical skills to solve hard problems. We believe that business insight combined with a love for building positive partnerships is the best way to bring projects to completion. Success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills: Critical thinkers, who use both quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, including the use of logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problemsDecision makers, who exercise sound judgment, consider the relative costs and benefits of potential actions, and who provide recommendations for optimal solutionsInterpersonal communicators, who will positively influence Hilton's partners with excellent comprehension skillsSelf-starters, who take initiative in implementing goals, are comfortable operating with a cool-head under time constraints, effectively handle concurrent demands, and prioritize responsibilitiesAccountable individuals who effectively exceed in meeting deadlines, communicating results, and recommending improvementsAbility to quickly learn new programs when required To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience: BA/BS Bachelor's Degree or High School Diploma/GED with a minimum of two (2) years of related experience in a professional Accounting settingFive (5) years of professional experienceTwo (2) years of work experience at the Analyst levelProficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: One (1) year of experience working with credit cards in an accounting environmentWhat will it be like to work for Hilton?Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionRole Overview The Senior Financial Analyst is responsible for providing financial analysis and support to the Orthopaedic Franchise Finance Business Partners as well as the US FP&A team. This is an exciting opportunity to be exposed to a leading franchise and work cross functionally with business leaders and other teams within Smith & Nephew. ResponsibilitiesOrthopaedic franchise cost center management - Perform analysis of monthly actual to budget comparisons and working with management to understand variances. Assist Orthopaedic sales management team with cost center queries or issues. Prepare monthly close journal entries and balance sheet reconciliations as requiredBudgets and Forecasts –Working with Finance Business Partners, load Recon/Trauma revenue budgets and forecasts into TM1 and expense budgets and forecasts into SFIN ensuring accuracy and adherence to guidelines.Projects / Analysis – Assist Orthopaedic Franchise Finance Business Partners with projects and / or analysis as required.US Region Results –Assist in preparation of monthly and quarterly US Franchise revenue reporting.PCA / Franchise P&Ls –Publish PCA Reports (Profit Contribution Attainment) and other Franchise P&Ls used for measurement of sales management performance attainment and overall business performanceSystems Expertise –Gain expertise in key financial systems (TM1, HFM, SONAR, SFIN) and assist in issue resolution involving these systemsLocation Cordova, TN Education This position requires a BA or BS in Finance or Accounting. MBA preferable. Licenses/Certifications CPA Preferred ExperienceMinimum of 3 years related experience is requiredCompetenciesStrong proficiency with spreadsheet and accounting applications (MS Excel, MS Word required)Experience with SAP G/L and Hyperion Financial Systems (experience with SFIN, TM1 and HFM would be a plus).Able to dissect, analyze and synthesize large amounts of data using advanced financial automated systems.Ability to communicate effectively with financial personnel as well as non-financial personnel up to executive level.Ability to produce high quality, accurate work with minimal supervision.Travel

Name: Communications Analyst, CE&I - Team
Description: Job SummaryThe Hilton portfolio of hotels is comprised of 14 industry leading and world-class brands. A dedicated team of industry experts in the domains of hospitality, brand management, innovation, food and beverage, wellness, owner relations, and more, lead our Brands organization with the steadfast goal of strengthening and growing the Hilton portfolio. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, Conrad, Canopy, DoubleTree, Curio Collection, Tapestry Collection, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton, Tru, Embassy Suites, Homewood Suites, Home2 Suites, and Hilton Grand Vacations.What will I be doing?The Customer Experience and Innovation (CE&I) Team is responsible for the entirety of the on-property Guest experience. The team drives the delivery of a steady flow of pragmatic innovation both big and small to six global brands falling under the All Suites and Focused Service brand category. Regularly inspect/analyze the customer on-property experience.Develop innovative products to address the needs of our customers.Deliver important, differentiated, branded, on-property customer experiences through physical, digital and human-centered design.Continuously optimize physical products and operating models.Integrate above-property innovations with on-property experiences. As the Communications Analyst, Team Central role you will be responsible for internal messaging delivery of this category. You will handle deployment of communications to internal audiences including: General Managers, Sales Managers and Hotel Team Members, as well as Brand Team Members and other Hilton Corporate Team Members. You will help handle third-party graphic designers, writers and technology partners who help create, design and facilitate the distribution of internal messages. This includes daily oversight of the series of weekly NOW newsletters delivered to hotel teams, corporate/brand teams and franchisees for these brands. In addition, you will measure the impact/engagement of the strategic messaging plan and seek feedback from brand teams. You will be responsible for the distribution of other targeted messaging content and for helping handle the brand's internal community sites (sourcing both copy and images). Key responsibilities include:Help create and protect each brand's unique narrative to ensure consistent execution of identity both internally and with our partners.Develop CE&I communications and launch strategies that support the Suites and Focused Service deployment of product and service solutions, tools and resources to hotels.Collect, curate and maintain brand hospitality images, assets and content that illustrate each brand's unique personality.Organize and distribute the bi-weekly category report to selected recipients across the customer organization. You will establish and maintain strong reciprocal partnerships with key agency partners and the CE&I full team, as well as across the rest of the Customer organization. More specifically, you will:Be responsible for the brand's storytelling strategy – sourcing, maintaining and socializing content.Set the internal communication direction for the brands to ensure the success of campaign launches and culture momentum with input from Senior Manager, Team Central and larger CE&I team.Handle numerous work streams and timelines, and provide recommendations and regular updates to the Senior Manager, Team Central.What are we looking for? We are looking for visionaries who are passionate about hospitality and who love to have the chance to create customer experience improvements. We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills: Strong communication skills, including presentation in front of other internal partners, and ability to create and execute communication and project plans.Leadership and influencing skills that lend to leading teams, building positive relationships, and collaborating with internal and external partners.A track record of being a strong collaborator, solution-minded, early adopter, agile mindset, positive attitude.Self-starter who takes initiative in implementing goals.Problem solver who is flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically PPT and Excel. To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience:BA/BS Bachelor's DegreeTwo (2) year of professional work experienceExperience in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations or similar fieldTravel up to 10% It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: MA/MS Master's DegreeTwo (2) years of communications experienceProject Management experienceExperience in Customer-Facing industries such as Hospitality, Food and Beverage, Travel, etc.Experience working for or with a Marketing AgencyWhat will it be like to work for Hilton?Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Name: Senior Analyst
Description: Senior Analyst - Grains and Oilseeds Memphis, TennesseeJob Reference: MTX-ANA-04283 Location: Memphis, Tennessee Closing Date: 25/12/2018 Department: Analyst Division: Business IntelligenceSenior Analyst, Grains and Oilseeds Informa | Memphis, TN Agribusiness Intelligence is seeking an experienced commodities analyst to join the crops analytical team. The role involves comprehensive supply and demand analysis for US and global markets, including price forecasts and enhancement and development of price risk management strategies for clients across the global agriculture spectrum. The analyst will be responsible for maintaining and providing fundamental supply and demand analysis for the assigned commodity, provide ongoing research developments and commentary to clients, and to work with other areas in the Agribusiness Intelligence company. The analyst is expected to be a team player, contribute to ongoing conversations, and be willing to take on extra duties when other team members are absent. Commodities covered in the crops team include feed grains (corn, sorghum, barley, oats), food grains (wheat, rice), and the oilseed complex.  Analysts convey research results through a variety of channels including internal meetings, written reports (daily, weekly), in-person presentations, and client calls.  Informa Agribusiness Intelligence assists organizations across the global agribusiness value chain in making strategic and transactional decisions with news, pricing and forecast data, analysis and consulting from the seed and crop protection sector, fertilizers, animal pharmaceuticals, commodities trading, food processing and manufacturing and international regulation. Required ExperienceExperience conducting economic and market researchKnowledge of futures and cash marketsBS Agricultural Economics, Economics, or related field, MS a plusFive+ years of industry experienceA passion for commodity markets and how they operateSuperior written and oral communications skillsDesire to learnCommitment to team workExcellent MS Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint skillsWho We AreAgribusiness Intelligencehttps://informa.com/divisions/business-intelligence/agribusiness-intelligence/Our customers rely on us as the go-to provider of news, data, analysis and forecasts across the agricultural and commodities value chain. Delivering a critical information advantage in a fast paced and volatile industry, we help the world’s largest and most influential agribusiness organisations work faster and smarter. Through a combination of highly respected insight and data, forecasting and analysis, focused one-off reports, events and bespoke consultancy, we help our customers understand the global agribusiness supply chain. We also provide the timely, actionable intelligence they need to make business-critical decisions with confidence, whether to mitigate risk or identify new opportunities.Back  Apply for job

Name: IT Systems Analyst Specialist
Description: Client: Sedgwick Claims Management Services, Inc. Title: IT Systems Analyst Specialist Req #: 8232137 Location: 1100 Ridgeway Loop Road, Suite 200, Memphis, TN 38120 Duration: 5 Months contract Shift Hours: 8 hrs per day, 5 days/week ******************JOB DUTY EXPLANATION******************** PLEASE REVIEW: This person will play multiple roles on the team. This is not a true SA role, but we would like them to have several qualities of a SA. This person will work across all the IT teams to make sure they are following the same operating procedures related to request intake, project creation/closure, etc. ***This person will need to assist with the following - Daily support of our project management application - Daily support of our agile project management application - Oversee the request intake process - Host a weekly review meeting related to the request intake process - Evaluate the IT project portfolio PRIMARY PURPOSE: To lead the business analysis efforts for implementations and large, multi-line projects; to review, analyze and document internal and client user needs; and to provide mentorship and leadership within the business analysis team. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and RESPONSIBILITIES: · Leads the requirements management efforts for large projects to include new client implementations and large strategic projects; devises and executes a requirements management plan for assigned projects; and takes ownership of the business analysis role throughout the project. · Identifies and understands stakeholders; initiates and facilitates meetings and discussions with stakeholders as appropriate. · Works with project managers, project requestors, operations, business representatives, IT representatives and clients to ensure complete understanding of software requirements; provides business related IT knowledge to clients and business representatives during the requirements management process. · Produces project requirements documentation, including written documents, process diagrams, report mock-ups, wire frames and other documentation as required, using standard templates. · Meets deadlines and manages work to timelines. · Mentors team members. ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: · Performs other duties as assigned. · Supports the organization's quality program(s). · Travels as required. QUALIFICATIONS: Education & Licensing: · Bachelor's degree required; major in computer science field preferred. Experience: · Six (6) years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience required. · Experience in multi-line claims management processes and system requirements strongly preferred. Skills & Knowledge: · Strong knowledge of third party administration/claims management business and technology · PC literate, including Microsoft Office products · Analytical and interpretive skills · Strong organizational skills · Excellent interpersonal skills · Excellent negotiation skills · Self motivated · Ability to work in a team environment · Ability and willingness to take initiative · Ability to meet or exceed Performance Competencies WORK ENVIRONMENT: When applicable and appropriate, consideration will be given to reasonable accommodations. Mental: Clear and conceptual thinking ability; excellent judgment, troubleshooting, problem solving, analysis, and discretion; ability to handle work related stress; ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously; and ability to meet deadlines Physical: Computer keyboarding, travel as required Auditory/Visual: Hearing, vision and talking NOTE: Credit security clearance, confirmed via a background credit check, is required for this position. The statements contained in this document are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by a colleague assigned to this description. They are not intended to constitute a comprehensive list of functions, duties, or local variances. Management retains the discretion to add or to change the duties of the position at any time.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Financial Consulting Group (FCG) of CBRE is seeking a financial analyst in Atlanta, GA. This position will play an integral role in assignments ranging from one-off asset sales to the sale of large portfolios, as well as assisting occupier clients make informed decisions for their real estate needs. The chosen candidate will have a strong foundational knowledge of financial/valuation concepts, demonstrate a passion for real estate, work well in a dynamic team environment and demonstrate a strong work ethic. FCG provides sophisticated financial underwriting and analytical services for the clients of the world's largest commercial real estate services company. This is a unique opportunity for the right individual to be a part of this team and to work with, and learn from, the best in the industry. If this describes you then we want to hear from you! Responsibilities: Underwrite assets for sale using Argus and Excel. Analyze, review, and interpret real estate source documents, including operating statements, rent rolls, leases, and other due diligence material. Research market conditions in support of financial underwriting assumptions. Compile and present the results of analyses and effectively address questions. Identify critical property level financial issues and make recommendations. Developing disposition strategies in conjunction with team members and clients. Communicate directly with capital markets professionals, asset managers, leasing brokers, property managers and clients. Coordinate collection of due diligence material and assist with the closing process. Prepare various corporate service analyses relating to both landlord and tenant representation, including corporate occupancy strategy, lease vs. own, lease renegotiation, etc. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree with high academic achievement in Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, or Economics. Strong understanding of financial concepts (i.e, Discounted Cash Flow, IRR, NPV, etc.) Ability to review, analyze and interpret source documents, including leases, operating statements, budgets, etc. Intermediate-level Excel skills. Must demonstrate an aptitude for building and understanding financial models. Experience in the valuation of income-producing properties is a plus, but not mandatory. Intellectual curiosity with a demonstrated enthusiasm for the commercial real estate industry. Excellent quantitative and analytical skills in combination with outstanding communication skills (both oral and written). Self-starter with sharp focus on details with an awareness of the bigger picture. Ability to manage time effectively and work under the pressure of multiple deadlines. A sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results in a challenging, fast-paced, environment. Ability to work effectively within a team and with all levels of personnel. Professional demeanor and positive attitude. Internal Number: 18026866 Create a Job Alert for Similar JobsAbout CBREWith broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world.  CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2017 revenues of $14.2 billion and more than 80,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #214 in 2017. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 17 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for six years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE.”  CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. Name: Enhanced Due Diligence Analyst
Description: Position Overview  Identify customers which may pose a higher risk to the bank and make the determination as to whether or not it is an acceptable risk in order to retain the customer.  Duties and Responsibilities Performs various duties associated with BSA Compliance specifically relating to the identification of money laundering & terrorist financing risks. Daily duties include identifying risk using risk scoring processes and collecting information in order to analyze the risk associated with a specific customer.Follow the documented management escalation procedures when risks identified may pose issues/concerns for the bank.Perform BSA compliance research as necessary to support business line management.Assist in other activities and duties as required to develop, implement, monitor, and control aspects of BSA compliance at the company. RequirementsEducation and/or Work Experience Requirements High school diploma or GEDOne (1) year experience in branch management, platform, BSA/AML, fraud, loss prevention, or corporate security + Bachelor's degree may substitute experienceExperience with case management systems, databases and similar automation Preferable Education and/or Work Experience Requirements Bachelor's degree (strongly preferred)Previous BSA/AML experience, preferably in EDD or KYC/CDD Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Training/Systems Basic understanding of the Bank Secrecy Act and the functions and procedures involved for compliance with the Regulation.Excellent research, written and oral communication skills and the ability to analyze information.Ability to read and interpret legal documents and government regulations and work well under pressure and meet regulatory reporting deadlines.Ability to work independently and with minimal direct supervision.Good organizational and customer service skills.Proficient with applicable computer software.Work experience in banking and/or Compliance preferred.#LI-DH1All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender stereo typing, and age. Name: Business Systems Analyst II
Description: Our client is a is a premier global provider of responsive management consulting, logistics solutions, and professional services, delivering quantifiable cost savings and improvement in mission readiness to our customers.  They are currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst II in Millington, TN. JOB DESCRIPTION This position requires a preferred minimum of two years professional MPTE and an in-depth, working knowledge of existing and evolving tools, and decision support systems, as well as an understanding of the principles and functions of planning, community management, recruiting, training management and distribution. Technical knowledge may encompass all components of the enlisted personnel, billet files, and decision support tools. Prefer personnel with knowledge of Navy MPTE metrics and the ability to determine new Supply Chain related corporate metrics.  Must possess intermediate to advance level skills in Microsoft Office to include Excel. Will be required to fill out an Excel/Access skills sheet. Must have extensive advanced excel skills.  Interview may include a test for building macros from scratch, pivot tables, and etc. Please do not apply if you are missing advanced Excel skills. REQUIRED EDUCATION Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. REQUIRED SECURITY CLEARANCE Must possess an active DoD secret security clearance. EOE M/F/Disability/VetOur Client will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Senior Lease Admin Analyst
Description: Application  The application opened in a new tab.  By using this feature you agree to our Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy.  Details Posted: November 20, 2018 Location: Memphis,  Show Map Salary: Open JOB SUMMARY Under limited supervision, upholds the integrity of real estate portfolio data for large, complex portfolio of clients. Inputs, maintains, organizes and reports on information regarding lease dates, dollar values and financial accounting transactions into a lease management software database. Prepares, processes and reconciles AR & AP transactions to ensure accurate and current lease information is maintained. Acts as lead for lease administration team. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Resolves critical issues for clients by researching and gathering information about payment transactions, lease terms and other relevant items. Establishes and maintains working relationship with clients and/or landlords.  Acts as a team lead including providing work flow direction to co-workers and providing account supervision. Ensures data integrity and accuracy by performing quality control review of work completed by team members.  Prepares lease abstracts and edits them for accuracy. Writes narratives for monthly variance reports, providing analysis and interpretation of lease information to clients.  Tracks payables and receivables associated with the leases in portfolio. Processes client rent rolls utilizing the database. Prepares export files and sends to accounting for payables processing.  Prepares invoices for subtenants, reconciles subtenant accounts, reviews incoming invoices for errors/accuracy with lease document and ensures correct coding. Reviews profit center reports for accuracy.  Prepares and distributes periodic and ad hoc reports in a timely, accurate manner. Designs reports utilizing various report writers, Excel, Word, and/or Access. Reviews standard reports prepared by team members for accuracy.  Prepares and distributes critical date reports; maintains tickler system for tracking important dates and tasks.  Performs annual operating expense reconciliations, monitors audit windows and audit requirements contained in the lease documents.  Creates and maintains client lease files ensuring they contain current, accurate information.  Serves as a member of a transition team, if needed, to get a new account set up and operating quickly and efficiently.  Cross-checks and reviews work of peers to ensure quality and accuracy of data.  May provide and/or assist with budgeting and forecasting activities.  May conduct financial analysis/accounting as appropriate, including AR/AP, rent rolls, and budgets in accordance with required accounting principles (GAAP, Tax, Cash, etc.).  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. Coordinates and assigns tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  High school degree or general education degree required plus a minimum of four years related work experience, preferably including property management or accounting. Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university with Accounting, Finance or Real Estate preferred.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires in-depth knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate complex figures and conduct financial/business analysis including the preparation of reports. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Intermediate knowledge of computer software and hardware (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite Products). Ability to work well under pressure. Advanced organizational skills. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with thorough knowledge of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers, supervisor and clients. Name: Fusion Engineer - Technical Analyst
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) proven professional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle) Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
