Name: EDI Analyst (BIM Specialist)
Description: This position is focused primarily on the support of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) for external customers across the Organization. The BIM Specialist works closely with Domestic, Trades, and Export teams, COE / SAP Global Supply Chain teams, Customer Service, Sales & Marketing, and other IT Professionals. Key Accountabilities:Act as a liaison to the Specialty businesses, COE / SAP Global Supply Chain teams, and other IT groups to coordinate the delivery of information technology solutions to the business. Focus on the implementation of standard EDI interfaces for the HRMS applications with national accounts and large volume local customers. Coordinate any new business requirements or projects for EDI.Must understand the nature of the proposed business/IT changes and will compose functional and technical specifications outlining the necessary changes to the business operation/process, organizational, and/or applications.Completes functional process analysis, design, and testing of new and existing business processes.Ensure needs are being met and that assignments are delivered on time by participating in project/planning meetings and communicating regularly with the team and appropriate managers.Develop training materials and conduct training on EDI functionality for HRMS end users.Interact with internal and external customers to better understand capabilities to exchange valued information and act accordingly.Begins to plan small to medium sized IT projects and enhancement requests.Understands and participates in the phases of ITs project delivery process (PDP) Challenges:The internal and external environment, including technology, competition, markets:Direct interaction with external customers to implement electronic data interchange.Ability to work through external vendors liaisons to complete customer requested implementations.The internal environment, including interaction with others, (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices:Direct interaction with many employees across the corporation, from line level to directors.Build good working relationships with business colleagues to facilitate business change.The work itself, e.g., problems, opportunities, change:Enabling EDI transactions by configuring the HRMS Order Management systems and associated connectivity systems.Training end users on EDI functionality.Monitoring EDI flows and resolving any production related issues. Scope: The BIM Specialist is an individual contributor with responsibilities primarily focused on support, with limited project management requirements. Competencies:Skills:Ability to analyze business processes and resolve problemsAbility to gather business requirementsEffective written and verbal communicationsAn understanding of PDP and PPM processes and toolsTechnical Learning; Skilled in EDI integrations Education:Bachelors degree in MIS, Computer Science or other related discipline or related experience.Organizational Relationship: BIM Specialist Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $30.00 to $35.00 /hour  Experience: BIM: 4 years (Required)EDI: 4 years (Required) Location: Memphis, TN (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Systems Analyst II-DCO-Windows Enterprise Support
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. PURPOSE: This position is for a Systems Analyst II on the Windows Enterprise Support team. This role will be responsible for the consultation, installation, maintenance, uptime, availability and operational health on the Windows Server platforms. This includes engineering new solutions, as well as maintaining the existing install base and consulting with business partners to provide solutions to their computing needs. Primary duties include troubleshooting and resolving issues with Microsoft Windows servers located in the company’s primary data center as well as throughout 600+ field locations in North America.  Our Windows Servers are 90 percent virtualized on VMWare ESXi hypervisor clusters which must also be installed, maintained and monitored for operational health.  Applications support teams are the primary customers for this position. This role will work with internal teams and vendors to develop and implement solutions on the Windows platforms.  Key performance indicators for this position include server availability, server hardware/operating system health, customer satisfaction ratings and server to admin ratios.  Due to the 24/7 support requirements of the position, the individual must be available for on-call duty after hours, on weekends, and on holidays. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:Administration of up to 1700+ Windows and VMWare servers in the Southwind Data Center Second and third level troubleshooting for all Intel/AMD based servers – last line of support for the Windows and VMware server platforms (Cisco UCS and HPE ProLiant hardware platforms)Second level troubleshooting for Active DirectoryImplementation and support for Microsoft DHCP in North American locationsAll aspects of support for the Citrix platform including engineering new technologiesAutomation and scripting to streamline support of the server platformsMaintaining revision levels for all hardware/software, virus definitionsProviding innovative solutions to challenging technical issuesManaging the overall Windows and VMWare server availability to meet customer SLA’sMust coordinate projects and support work with team members located in other countries and other time zonesServe as product owners for select tool sets on the platform with responsibilities including evaluating technologies directly with vendors, choosing solutions, engineering the rollouts and maintaining all ongoing supportPerform change management for the Windows and VMWare server platformsProvide technical expertise Act as a subject matter expert to other team members and other support teams and vendorsConsult on complex projectsEngineer new solutions involving servers and storage on Windows platformsAdvanced VMWare Knowledge - Provide Technical guidance on VMWare Platform ArchitectureProvide consultation to customers requesting information about application and/or data hostingTrain other support teams on their particular applications, specialized configurations on the platform as well as standard software to maintain the environmentProvide feedback relating to operational issuesEnsure that improvements in and/or changes to operations are implemented and monitored to increase efficiencyProvide documentation on advanced technical issuesKeep abreast of technological advances within the industryPowerShell scripting for task automationKnowledgeable on SAN and Network within Southwind Data CenterMaintain strong customer relationships and meet service level expectations for supported services: Meet or exceed SLO/SLA expectationsIdentify, test and implement changes to customer specific software and configurations to support overall application availabilityDesign, implement and monitor changes to operations and processesCommunicate with customers in the event of a server outage or other catastrophic eventKEY CHALLENGES:The internal environment, including interaction with others (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices: This position will meet challenges with an ever-changing workload. There are always acquisitions, divestitures, and other large-scale projects that involve this team. This work is very dynamic, fast paced and very demanding at times. Multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment is a requirement of this role.This individual should be comfortable with change. Due to acquisitions and other projects, individuals may be required to take on the engineering, support and maintenance of new equipment and new technologies with little or no training and without disruption to the business. Acquisitions introduce opportunities to learn and grow in new areas.This position will work closely with hardware and software vendors and other internal teams in order to implement solutions, and maintain best practices.The external environment, including technology, competition, markets: This position will meet challenges due to the ever-changing nature of the technology. New hardware, operating systems and supporting software must be maintained at all times. Constant hardware and software upgrade projects are a challenge.This position is always challenged to work in the most efficient manner. The team must always be the lowest cost provider when compared to other sources. This position may meet challenges due to the remote nature of the work and the fast pace.The work itself, e.g., problems, opportunities, change: Deliver technology to our customers fast enough to capitalize on any perceived competitive advantageMaintain a focus on technologies that are consistent with IP’s long-term strategies Develop and use consistent processes and standards related to technology implementation, deployment, operation, and supportSCOPE: This position will have the potential to positively affect the business by providing quick, reliable technology solutions and service offerings relating to the Windows server platform. This position is part of a team that is responsible for up to 1700+ data center servers. Hardware and Operating system support and solutions are the core offerings of the team. To those ends, the team is end to end responsible for server availability, server monitoring, vulnerability management as well as solutions engineering and ongoing support. In addition, the team is responsible end to end for the support of the Citrix, Cisco UCS, and VMware ESXi environments.  The candidate should be able to work with minimum supervision. He/she will interact directly with vendors, internal support teams, application developers/owners, and end users for the purpose of supporting the Windows server environment.  Most assignments are broad, usually requiring originality and ingenuity. The person must possess the ability to run and manage projects on his or her own. Typically, this person will have 8-10 years minimum of professional technical experience in the areas specified.  Teamwork is critical to this team’s success. Individuals placed into this team should be highly motivated, energetic, and results oriented. High expectations are the norm.  This person may be responsible for training and mentoring junior level team members. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:The suitable candidate for this role should possess: Expert knowledge with Microsoft Windows Server platforms Expert knowledge and support experience with VMware (certification preferred)Expert knowledge of server hardware (Compute, Memory, Storage, etc.)Expert knowledge of common enterprise services such as AD, WINS, DNS, and DHCPExperience with Cisco UCS computing preferredIn depth knowledge of various types of enterprise storage devicesPowerShell ScriptingWindows MCSE or MCITP strongly preferredEnterprise server administration experience requiredCitrix support knowledge is strongly preferred (certification preferred)Network experience for troubleshooting purposesExcellent people and communication skills, dealing with all levels of management and personnelStrength in the following competencies: Action Oriented, Dealing with Ambiguity, Customer Focus, Directing Others, Drive for Results, Timely Decision Making and Decision Quality, Functional / Technical Skills, Composure, Learning on the Fly, Listening, Project Management, Perseverance, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Patience, Time management, Written and Oral CommunicationsBachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Business Management, or related field preferredMinimum of 10+ years’ overall IT experience in progressively challenging rolesCOMMENTS: This position requires a senior level individual with at least 7 years of technical knowledge in Windows Server operating systems, Active Directory, and VMware products.  International Paper is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans.  Memphis TN 38197

Name: IT Analyst II Asset Management
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. Purpose: Selected candidate will be responsible for coordination and active participation in the overall operation of best practices surrounding global hardware and software procurement, installation, maintenance/support, inventory, contract, and financial management. Will keep abreast of technological developments to ensure best of breed technology inventory practices are followed, industry trends are understood, and solid IT asset management strategies are in place. Will support any new initiatives to further the advancements of a centralized IT service offering. This practice will ease the aggregating of asset information allowing pro-active informed decision-making processes to take place.  Selected candidate will also lead the continuous effort of identification and implementation of ITAM process improvements and would support ITAM Manager in team coordination efforts. Our charter is to provide worldwide support and leadership for Service Management delivery including all application data administration, end user support, requests for new services and strategic direction. Key Accountabilities: + Analyze proper hardware & software asset life cycle management practices for various platforms supported within the infrastructure.  + Proactively provides innovative solutions for improvements and/or changes to everyday operations and leads the implementation to increase efficiency.  + Ensure products have documented roadmap plans by working with the owners across the various businesses.  + Interacts directly with vendors, internal support teams, application developers/owners, and end users for the purpose of supporting the environment.  + Coordinates team efforts related to process changes and business projects.  + Ensuring software licensing models are understood and in place, that acquisition method and deployment strategy is understood and communicated by the appropriate areas or teams within IT.  + Facilitates support team?s responsibilities when products change.  + Acts as a source for direction, training, and guidance for less experienced departmental personnel. Key Challenges: To make the processes seamless and user friendly while capturing all necessary information. Scope: + This role oversees the lifecycle management of more than 100,000 technology assets worldwide valued at $40MM with ongoing spend of more than $11MM annually.  + The services managed by this position support all users of IT services (50,000+) from all businesses and locations worldwide.  + This function enables the way IT pro-actively plans technology lifecycle management from procurement to the multiple business critical integration points to chargeback and recovery services and final technology disposition.  + Provide expert knowledge to develop and support measurable key metrics for the team. Knowledge and Experience: + Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline preferred.  + 8+ years of professional experience in IT Asset Management is a must.  + Comprehensive knowledge of computer concepts, systems management tools in use and the supported environment.  + Comprehensive knowledge of computing resource dependency and impact to business continuity for the installed base managed.  + Understanding the issues while possessing the ability to break each down analytically and then build it back presenting solid business cases.  + Demonstrated project management and organizational skills.  + High Motivation and proactiveness. Key Competencies: + Action oriented  + Dealing with ambiguity  + Learning on the fly  + Problem solving  + Customer focus  + Drive for results  + Timely decision making  + Priority setting  + Peer relationships  + Process management  + Listening  + Functional/technical skills  + Directing others  + Interpersonal savvy  + Communication skills  + Presentation skills. Comments: Very close interactions with the user community, management and suppliers. Customer focus, service, and strong communication skills are a must in this position. Name: Systems Analyst I - Storage Disk
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. PURPOSE: This position exists to support the disk storage needs and the management of the growth and performance for the external storage needs for all platforms at International Paper. Storage Management provides key disk storage allocations for the Unix, Windows and VMWare operating systems environments. This position will provide configuration and planning support for the existing SAN (Storage Area Network) environment that supports the open systems environments. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: + Maintaining high availability of the storage environment  + Planning, configuration, data migration and implementation for new storage acquisitions.  + Monitoring for performance of the storage subsystems.  + Capacity planning and storage allocation forecasting.  + SAN connectivity.  + Data security and retention policy KEY CHALLENGES: The external environment, including technology, competition, markets:  + Learning and adapting new storage technology into the International Paper storage environment.  + Working with storage vendors on storage related projects.  + Working with business customers on storage related issues and projects  The internal environment, including interaction with others, (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices:  + Working with internal customers on storage related issues.  + Managing growth in the range of 20% annually.  + Implementing new storage strategies to address the growth and performance of the storage environment.  The work itself, e.g., problems, opportunities, change:  + Managing growth and the demands of the environment.  + Creating a more cost effective storage allocation model. SCOPE: Day to day support and maintenance of corporate storage spread over multiple storage arrays between the Memphis TN. production datacenter, the Loveland OH. disaster recovery datacenter and the Mill production sites worldwide. This encompasses all of the corporate data enabling the enterprise and business specific applications as well as user specific and site data.  Assist both internal and business customers with current and future storage technologies to ensure the prudent and judicious use of corporate resources. Provide storage configuration and planning for the existing SAN environments. And provide on call support for the storage environment that requires support on a 24X7 basis. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE: + This position requires 3 - 5 years of storage management experience working with open systems disk storage (EMC & NetApp) and similar experience with Storage Area Networks (Brocade),EMC?s SRDF and NetApp?s SNAP Mirror technology.  + Experience with NetApp (OnCommand) and EMC Unisphere are also preferred.  + This environment requires 24X7 support that is shared with the other members of this group on a rotation basis. COMMENTS: Experience with Unix, Windows and VMWare operating systems is a plus.  International Paper is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans. Name: IT Security Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionIT Security Analyst  We are looking for an IT Security Analyst with at least 4 years experience to fill a Permanent position immediately. It is a requirement that potential candidates have a strong understanding of a Security Framework such as COBIT, ITIL, COSO, ISO 27002 or others. This person will be tasked to evaluate and audit infrastructure components such as servers, computers anti-virus software, email filters, web content filters, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, patch management and other technologies used to protect business systems and information. Audit systems and activity logs to measure compliance with security policies and procedures. Draft and disseminate policies, procedures, and guidelines to raise awareness of information protection and security best practices. The IT Security Analyst will keep current on the ever changing field of information security and report their findings to management for further review. This person should also be familiar with conducting network and system vulnerability and penetration tests. This position will be responsible for working close with other Administrators (Network, Windows, Unix and PC) to assure the integrity of security configurations, policies and best practices. The ability to travel when required will be expected.  In addition to the above an IT Security Analyst should possess the following skills:  Develop and implement enterprise level security initiatives.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Solid knowledge of Windows and network system vulnerabilities and exploits  Be well versed in firewall, network, proxy and intrusion detection and prevention systems.  Experience in network security (Cisco ASA, IPS, VPN, RSA SecurID, PKI, cryptography), security controls for LAN/WANs, client server, and web-based systems  Plan and implement security measures to protect computer systems, networks and data.  Stay up-to-date on the latest intelligence, including hackers methodologies, in order to anticipate security breaches.  Prevent data loss and service interruptions by researching new technologies that will effectively protect a network.  Assess the effectiveness of Information Security policies and pointing out vulnerabilities or lack of controls to mitigate a given risk.  Work with departments in the company to make recommendations for improvements and craft detailed design documents for them to implement.  Knowledge of communications protocols, network routing, packet, and content filtering  Knowledge on how to penetrate systems, networks, and applications in order to detect their vulnerabilities so that companies can correct flaws and improve their security  Performing risk assessments and testing of data processing systems  Recommending security enhancements and purchases  Training staff on network and information security procedures  Company DescriptionMillennium Search is a premier staffing and employment solutions provider. We specialize in placing qualified candidates in the following fields:  Information Technology  Application Development  Technical Support  Network Administration  Database Administration  Business Analyst  Project Management  Executive Management  Clerical  Accounting  Finance  Human Resource  Marketing  Millennium Search offers augmented staffing services and employment solutions for all companies with a reliable high-quality solution to enhance business development. While hiring smart is a key performance indicator for maintaining a competitive edge in today's business world, we offer a variety of ways to utilize our services which is as follows: Temporary Only Temporary to Permanent Permanent Placement/Direct Hire Our vision is to fulfill the promise with providing completely confidential, reliable, trustworthy expertise and information. Develop visibility to generate new business opportunities for our candidates with our clients, while leveraging existing relationships to expand into global and emerging markets. We are optimistic and encouraged with our vision to be a well rounded staffing and solutions provider, and we look forward to developing strong business relationships with our candidates and clients by remaining loyal and conducting business with a strong ethical emphasis.

Name: Credit Analyst - Mortgage (Onsite in Memphis, TN) - Req
Description: Description  Full time onsite position in the Memphis, TN office. Remote work is not an option Job Summary: Under general supervision, uses specialized knowledge and skills obtained through education and experience to review and analyze applications for residential mortgage loans based on Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac underwriting guidelines. Analyzes information and/or documentation in a loan file to determine that proper underwriting of the credit worthiness of a borrower has been met for secondary market sales and portfolio origination. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Reviews and underwrites conventional loans underwritten for Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, Rural Housing Development (RD), Construction/Rehab, First Time Homebuyer, Affordable Housing, and Portfolio loans.Reviews employment, income, and asset documentation for accuracy and eligibility to both secondary market investor standards or portfolio loan requirements.Evaluates credit history and scores to ensure the borrower's credit meets the investor requirements.Reviews and evaluates information on mortgage loan documents to determine if buyer, property, and loan conditions meet establishment and government standards. Reviews all documents and information for potential fraud or misrepresentation and for regulatory compliance.Works with customer to clear and cure any missing documentation in the loan fileEntry of loan data into loan databasePerforms other duties and responsibilities as assigned.QualificationsKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Knowledge of:Experience in residential lending, reviewing credit documentation and underwriting files to Fannie Mae and other industry guidelinesProficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel, as well as the capability to learn other programs and systemsCompany's working structure, policies, mission, and strategies.Ability to communicate loan quality and audit findings to all departmentsPrinciples of banking and finance operations.Financial markets and products.Skill in:Precision and attention to detailStrong math and analytics sufficient for quantitative and analytical analysis.Identifying relationships, drawing logical conclusions, and interpreting results.Operating standard office equipment and using required software application to produce correspondence, reports, electronic communication, and spreadsheets.Ability to:Organize, manage, and track multiple detailed tasks and assignments with critical deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.Use appropriate interpersonal styles and communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing with all organizational levels.Work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.Project a positive, professional image both internal and with external business contacts.Convey information clearly and effectively through both formal and informal documents.Educational/Previous Experience Recommendations:Bachelor's Degree (B.A.) in a related area. MBA Designations are a plus. ~or~ Any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training approved by Human Resources.Licenses/Certifications:Ability to obtain FINRA Licenses (as required).

Name: Supervisory Management Analyst
Description: Videos Duties Help  Help  Duties  Summary This position is assigned to the Business Management and Administration Section; Family Readiness Division; Commander, Navy Installations Command (CNIC). CNIC is an Echelon II activity directly reporting to the Chief of Naval Operations (CNO).Learn more about this agencyResponsibilities Functions as Supervisory Management Analyst for Family Readiness business operations including programming and financial management, business and strategic planning, procurement, process improvement practices, facility assessment, program modeling and business standards and metrics.  Develops and coordinates standardized Family Readiness business processes used to plan, program, procure, budget and execute program funding to meet desired outcomes and resourced Capability Output Levels.  Provides policy/program expertise and financial management duties including resource planning and requirements development for Family Readiness to ensure a high quality, flexible, support program of human services for active duty military and their families.  Develops, plans and executes the Program Objective Memorandum (POM), budget development and submission, preparation of budget exhibits (PB-50/OP-5), conducts mid-year reviews, allocates and tracks funding plus-ups/reductions.  Prepares information, position papers, briefing statements and verbal reports to present to higher authority including Congress and other agencies. Conducts or researches issues that may require modification to regulations/policy. Assesses the effectiveness of Family Readiness business management and program execution. Recommends the adjustment of resources or changes to procedures and policy to increase efficiency and effectiveness of programs.  Recommends resolution of forecasted or existing funding shortfalls through pursuit of additional funding or redistribution of resources. Performs multi-year, long range fiscal planning, requirements development and analysis for Navy Family Support and Department of Defense (DoD) funds and submits optimum allocation of funds at all Navy field activities.  Coordinates and prioritizes special projects for submission to Program Managers and or higher authority.  Maintains constant awareness of barriers impeding Family Readiness mission accomplishment. Analyzes issues, identifies best course of action, determines potential impact on subordinate organizations and recommends corrective action.  Maintains and overseas current capability based FFSP standards and associated installation performance assessments. Provides oversight to the FFSP Enterprise Modeling System functionality and development.  Oversees development of all Family Readiness contracts including the FFSP Global Staffing Services Contract. Provides oversight of contracts management and performance evaluation.  Recommends and approves performance awards and salary/bonus distribution for subordinates. Participates in interview panels, recommends/approves hiring, promotions and reassignments.  Prepares supporting documentation in the form of spreadsheets, Power Point presentations, databases, word documents for presentations and proposals by higher-level management. Conducts presentations on subject matter related to the work area.  Works with Family Readiness Managers, teams, and program subject matter experts (SMEs) and provides technical direction/guidance to functional program managers within CNIC, including up to eleven Navy Regions world-wide.  Oversees Family Readiness manpower tracking and reporting processes for the enterprise to ensure headquarters and regional Activity Manning Documents and other authoritative manpower databases are kept current for financial accounting and budget execution.  Directs work to be accomplished by staff. Assigns work based on priorities, difficulty and requirements of assignments, and staff capabilities. Conducts annual performance reviews of staff. Participates in section staffing decisions. Ensures staff receives proper training to fulfill requirements of their positions. Addresses potential disciplinary and/or performance issues timely and takes appropriate, corrective action(s) as necessary.  Supports CNIC’s Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) policy; fosters a work environment free of discrimination, harassment, and/or reprisal; ensures all subordinate staff understands and adhere to the policy; and ensures treatment of all staff is fair and equitable.  Directly supervises and provides technical oversight for five full-time subordinates; (4 NF-04/GS-12 and 1 NF-03). Travel RequiredOccasional travel - Up to 15% travel may be required. Supervisory statusYes Promotion Potential05 Job family (Series)0343 Management And Program Analysis Similar jobs  Analysts, Budget Analysts, Business Management Analysts, Management Analysts, Program Budget Analysts Business Management Analysts Requirements Help  Help  Requirements  Conditions of Employment Must successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. Any discrepancies must be resolved as a condition of employment. QualificationsResumes must include information which demonstrates experience and knowledge, skills, and ability (KSAs) as they relate to this position. Applicants are encouraged to be clear and specific when describing their experience level and KSAs.  Knowledge of advanced concepts of program management, requirements determination, policy development, evaluative and analytical processes, and program implementation.  Knowledge and understanding of requirements and operations of the Department of Defense (DoD) and Department of the Navy (DON) programs that support military members and families.  Knowledge of Federal and agency regulations; knowledge of specific organization’s and program mission, as well as knowledge of pertinent laws, regulations and policies related to program/operations.  Knowledge of the Navy operational/organizational structure, chain of command, protocol and funding, agency programs and activities; agency mission, policies, and objectives; management principles and processes; and analytical and evaluative methods as it relates to the Navy wide FFSP.  Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methods for the assessment and improvement of program effectiveness and the improvement of complex management processes and systems, which impact Navy or FFSP program goals and objectives.  Knowledge of general accounting principles in addition to knowledge of Appropriated Fund (APF) and Non-Appropriated Fund (NAF) accounting processes to include account classification codes, financial reporting, payroll, asset and liability management, balance sheets, income and expense statements, and the Planning, Programming, Budget and Execution cycle.  Knowledge of personnel management rules, regulations, policies and procedures governing military personnel, civil service employees, NAF employees and contractors who work within DoD.  Knowledge of DoD and Navy APF and NAF budget and financial management regulations, policies, processes and procedures to prepare long and short-range plans, develop resource guidance for the headquarters, regions and installations and defend POM and budget proposals to higher authorities within Congress, DoD and DON.  Skill in designing and conducting comprehensive studies and preparing solutions related to broad operational and contingency issues.  Skill in analyzing and interpreting a wide variety of issues and formulating policy or procedural solutions.  Knowledge of CNIC’s EEO policy and procedures.  Ability to analyze and prepare clear, concise, and technically sound reports related to work within the Branch.  Ability to develop and effectively deliver presentations and/or training.  Ability to perform the full-range of supervisory duties.  Knowledge of techniques and formats required for effective communication with Political Appointees (PA), Members of Congress, Senior Executive Service (SES), and flag level officials as well as in drafting policies/programs.  Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. EducationA bachelor's degree in business administration/management, or a related field is desirable.

Name: IT - Information Security Risk Analyst II
Description: Summary Responsible for examining and analyzing the information system operations to identify opportunities for risk reduction. Ensure the appropriate level of information security is utilized based on industry standards, best practices, HIPAA, HITECH, and other regulations by developing repeatable processes to identify, evaluate, and measure IT security risk. Evaluate risk and perform due diligence and periodic security reviews on IT vendors. Partner with other stakeholders to develop and maintain disaster recovery procedures and periodically test those procedures for effectiveness. Help develop and maintain security policies. Partner with Audit, Compliance, and Legal to manage security risk and compliance. Assist in the development, maintenance, and presentation of security awareness training and testing. Models appropriate behavior as exemplified in MLH Mission, Vision and Values. Knowledge of best practices, HIPAA, HITECH, and other regulationsAbility to manage projects and implementations with little supervision.Advanced computer, network, and system knowledge and skills with a thorough understanding of security controls.Ability to use basic office productivity tools and manage time.Ability to communicate effectively, present in front of small groups and document processes.Key Job Responsibilities Ensure the appropriate level of information security is utilized based on industry standards, best practices, HIPAA, HITECH, and other regulations by developing repeatable processes to identify, evaluate, and measure IT security risk.Develops and reviews security policies, procedures, and standards.Perform IT security risk assessments of both new and existing in-house and vendor-based systems. Recommend, design, and construct risk/security metrics, policies and standards.Manage the remediation of audit and security review findings and recommendations.Physical Requirements Subject to call back at all times.Required to sit for extended periods.Subject to standard office working conditions with intermittent exposure to noisy computer equipment.Ability to withstand occasionally stressful working conditions due to tight project schedules and hardware or software problems.Ability to understand complex verbal and written communications, and respond verbally or in writing as appropriate. Name: Senior Actuarial Analyst
Description: Work for one of the top actuarial consulting firms in the country!  As a Senior Actuarial Analyst at Willis Towers Watson, you will be making a valuable difference every day to our high-profile client organizations. You will apply your actuarial and project management expertise in the delivery of complex projects for Fortune 1000 and other not-for-profit organizations of similar size. You will help clients achieve their evolving business objectives by aligning their defined benefit, retiree welfare and defined contribution plans accordingly. The Role Our Retirement team combines expertise in retirement and investment consulting to support global organizations worldwide in designing, managing, administering and communicating all types of retirement plans. Whether a client has a defined benefit pension or a defined contribution plan, we work with them to determine the right approach to design, funding, investing, governing and employee engagement that fits their specific goals.  Our Senior Actuarial Analysts have the opportunity to support diverse projects related to mergers and acquisitions, plan design and strategy, asset liability studies, forecasting, early retirement windows, global consulting and other special projects as needed.  As you grow with clients and gain more expertise, you will play an increasingly larger role within your client team. This includes:Beginning to serve as the project manager and main liaison to the consultant which includes:Creating project plansMonitoring progress to deadlines and budgetScheduling and managing weekly/bi-weekly status meeting callsEnsuring appropriate and effective communication among team members and the clientDeliver work in accordance to project deadlinesDeliver on projects to meet or exceed client expectationsIncrease efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processesManage the execution of data collection, analyses and finalization of work product required for core work including:Large defined benefit and retiree medical plan valuationsCompletion of Form 5500s and other Government filingsNon-discrimination testingContribute to special projects such as plan design, asset/liability modelling, retirement plan risk assessment and mitigation, due diligence for mergers and acquisitions, collective bargaining agreements, global consulting, strategic workplace planning, total rewards strategies, and othersComplete work in accordance with ERISA, FASB, GASB, Department of Labor, Pension Protection Act and other Government regulationsSeek and participate in key learning and development opportunities/maintain steady progress through examsReview analytical work and draft documents prepared by more junior analystsContribute to the development of new tools and approachesMentor junior staff as appropriateEmployment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.The Requirements:4 years’ experience conducting core valuation work in a client-service oriented environment with large corporate defined benefit plans; defined contribution plan experience a plusProven experience managing multiple projects within prescribed project guidelinesStrong client relationship, interpersonal and team skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to ask the right questions and seek help where appropriateAbility to respond to all communications effectively and in a timely mannerFlexibility and proven ability to diagnose and resolve issues; strong client service orientationDemonstrated leadership qualitiesAbility to work both independently and on client teams and enjoy a fast-paced environmentSense of accountability; owning one’s work and taking pride in itSelf-starter; interest in continually challenging oneself and willingness to step outside of one’s comfort zoneInterest and ability to think beyond the task at hand and understand how one’s work fits into the broader landscapeStrong analytical and integrative skills including ability to draw conclusions and identify trends from data in a logical, systematic wayExcellent Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Access and ExcelBachelor’s Degree requiredSignificant actuarial exam progress toward ASA and EA credentialsThe Company Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com.Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. Equal Employment Opportunity: Know your rights.Unsolicited Contact: Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Willis Towers Watson are considered property of Willis Towers Watson and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorized Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Willis Towers Watson, any such agency must have an existing formal written agreement signed by an authorized Willis Towers Watson recruiter and an active working relationship with the organization. Resumes must be submitted according to our candidate submission process, which includes being actively engaged on the particular search. Likewise, for our authorized Recruitment Agencies/Search Firms, if the candidate submission process is not followed, no agency fees will be paid by Willis Towers Watson. Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Admin-Clerical – Financial Analyst III
Description: The Gross to Net Analyst role is responsible for the day-to-day ownership of chargeback and membership related activities: chargeback processing, customer maintenance, deduction and dispute resolution, managing wholesaler relationships, and oversight. Within that scope of responsibility the analyst is accountable for proactively identifying and communicating issues, determining impact, and proposing resolutions. This role is critical in initiating process improvement recommendations, providing training, and proactively addressing and resolving inquiries from internal stakeholders and external customers. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills are essential for working with business partners, ensuring process efficiency, and delivering upon operational objectives. The analyst works closely with other GFS G2N colleagues to achieve department metrics and lead strategic projects as needed.  The position requires excellent problem solving skills, management to results, organizational agility, customer service, and the ability to build strong relationships across the end to end process. The position will be based in Memphis.

They manage the analytic data for the business decision processes as well as a statistical and financial foundation for merchandising decisions regarding product placement. Job Responsibilities- Other duties may be assigned: Involved in cross functional teams developing strategic planning and specific corporate initiatives. Must be catalyst for change and drive process improvement. Position viewed as training ground for future leaders. Some of the specific responsibilities of the position are: Develop and validate statistical models for estimating demand forecast and conversion.Provide advanced analytical support for cross-functional teams to coordinate ongoing processes or activities that cross organizational boundariesWork to review, validate and manipulate the large scale data to expand understanding throughout the organization and to support departmental and executive decision makingLead development for special initiatives related to product assortment.Integrate the new data and analytical technologies to improve the current forecast system.Develop the systems and tools to help merchandizing team and monitor their health and build alerts and reportsWork directly with Directors and VPs to design analysis and address specific needs on strategic projects.Skills and Requirements:Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Statistics, or closely related disciplines required.3 years of experience in an analytical role with sufficient experience in developing processes and applications for business.Strong analytical skills to do statistical modeling and quantitative research as well as data mining, machine learning, clustering, etc.Proficient in SAS, R, TensorFlow, Python, PHP in Linux and in Google Cloud environments.Must be a self-starter and motivated to complete projects timely and with accuracy.Proficiency in Excel and excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with colleagues and clients. Name: Applications Development Analyst I - Source Fiber
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. PURPOSE: The Applications Development Analyst I serves as a technical team member to the Deliver & Source Support Team for the Fiber Supply applications and the related hardware. The analyst works with the Global Sourcing organization and specifically the extended IP fiber receiving community to support these unique applications by resolving technical problems, testing, implementing, training and documenting new applications or changes to existing applications; and monitoring data flows and systems availability. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: + Provides technical and functional support for the Scale and Fiber systems. This includes build, updates, patches, reporting, security, hardware changes and recommendations on efficiencies.  + Participates in the overall process improvement of the functional area  + Acts as a contact for the Deliver & Source Support Team; also works with the business, ITSS, PIMS and other IT groups to coordinate the maintenance of information technology required by the business  + Understands the technical requirements of the systems and the nature of any proposed business process changes and will compose technical specifications to ensure continued operation of the systems.  + Ability to learn and understand the business as well as knowing and understanding how to work with ITSS and other IT groups to accomplish goals  + Analyzes changes to corporate hardware and software standards to ensure that the existing applications continue to function as designed, without compromising security or the integrity of the applications.  + Ensures that assignments are delivered on time by participating in project/planning meetings and communicating regularly with the team and appropriate managers  + Communicates regularly with BIM, PIM, internal facilities and vendors for resolution and collaboration.  + Acts as a team member to accomplish specific assignments or tasks. Name: Ancillary Utility Analyst
Description: Job Summary  The Ancillary Utility Analyst reports to the Business Opportunity Director and provides analytical support to Ancillary Utility programs via data trend analyses, evaluation, and customer service. Reviews inquiries, problems, and requests to determine appropriate solutions and/or responses. Creates and analyzes reports on a weekly, monthly and ad hoc basis for utility programs to help produce optimum results.  The successful candidate will embody and work to reinforce MAA's Core Values. Those values include: Appreciating the uniqueness of each individualCommunicating openly and with integrityEmbracing opportunitiesDoing the right thing at the right time for the right reasons Duties and Responsibilities Performs high-level calculations, trend analysis, and quality control on all utility programs.Builds database queries using existing frameworks and adapting as needed; queries databases using Microsoft Excel & Access to investigate root causes of state issues.Conducts ad-hoc reporting in response to specific requests (i.e. sustainability analysis, energy trends, etc.); monitors and reports on utility rates, variances and usage trends as compared to utility budget.Analyzes issues on a daily and weekly basis to gauge their status and determine where corrections are needed; discovers opportunities within the utility programs that may require further evaluation to improve performance.Analyzes data trends and makes recommendations for improved efficiency and cost savings of programs and processes.Analyze specific usage, market data, and applicable laws to make recommendations on which billing method should be used for a given market and/or property.Investigates, analyzes, and solves complex, technical, and contract issues.Supports new and ongoing projects (e.g., bulk cable program) and energy efficiency initiatives.Contacts property management regularly to verify information to ensure its accuracy in reports and to properly support each of the programs and their success.Provides advice to supervisors and managers to resolve utility problems effectively.Interacts with other departments and performs special tasks to ensure utilities are managed efficiently and effectively.Assists with planning and implementing long-term strategic initiatives to ensure integration of current and future technologies.Performs other related duties as assigned to meet the needs of the business. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field requiredOne to two (1-2) years of experience in utilities administration, utility data analysis, business analytics, or closely related experience involving billing procedures and/or account maintenance required Preferred Qualifications Three to five years (3-5) of experience in utilities administration or utility data analysis preferredWorking knowledge of Yardi, Essbase and Hyperion Retrieve preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Knowledge of utility rate structures, billing methods, and usage patternsSkill in data analysis, recognizing conceptual themes while also attending to detailSkill in interpreting data and making recommendationsSkill in applying critical thinking, analysis and problem-solving methodsSkill in verbal and written communication and explaining various data inputs, elements & outcomes to non-technical audiencesSkill in managing projects, organization, prioritization and meeting deadlinesSkill in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access to include: Table structures, Data types, Link tables/ MS Access in a network environment, Forms, Advanced relational query design, and Macros Physical and Environmental Requirements  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.  This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.  This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.  Disclaimer  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.SDL2017

Maintains cancer data management standards as outlined by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer and American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). Models appropriate behavior as exemplified in West Cancer Center, Vision and Values. Education/Experience/LicensureEducation/Formal TrainingWork ExperienceCredential/LicensureREQUIRED: Some college with the inclusion of Human Anatomy and Physiology courses or completion of similar college course hours with an emphasis in science courses that relate to healthcare such as biology, chemistry, physiology, genetics.  Experience with Microsoft Word and Excel  NAPREFERRED: Associates Degree or Bachelor of science degree with emphasis on courses related to healthcare such as biology, chemistry, physiology, and genetics.  Experience in oncology, or in science or healthcare research  NASUBSTITUTIONS ALLOWED: NA  NA  NAKnowledge/Skills/Abilities Ability to understand moderately complex written materials such as patient medical records and technical manuals and to aggregate data reports.Possess education, experience or training to work with oncology data abstraction.Ability to communicate verbally and in written form with Associates, company leaders, physicians and their staff, patients and others.Ability to organize multiple tasks and projects and maintain control of work flow.Ability to work with limited supervision. Key Job Responsibilities Coordinates the retrieval of medical records and other clinical data for patients who meet the criteria for inclusion data submissions or analysisCodes the patient information into the oncology database.Performs follow up on data for assigned patients.Maintains quality and productivity standards set forth for the department.Maintains confidentiality of all patient and department information. Understands, applies, and supports departmental policies, procedures and standards.Demonstrates initiative in identifying opportunities for self-development and enhancement of professional competency.Performs other job functions as needed to fulfill department goals. Physical Requirements The physical activities of this position may include climbing, pushing, standing, hearing, walking, reaching, grasping, kneeling, stooping, and repetitive motion.Must have good balance and coordination.The physical requirements of this position are: light work - exerting up to 25 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently.The Associate is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity, such as preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; or extensive reading.The conditions to which the Associate will be subject in this position: The Associate is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions; job functions are typically performed under conditions such as those found in general office or administrative work.Nearest Major Market: Memphis Job Segment: Clinic, Medical, Oncology, Physiology, Genetics, Healthcare, Science

Name: Supply Planning Analyst
Description: Graphic Packaging International, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Graphic Packaging Holding Company (NYSE: GPK), is committed to providing consumer packaging that makes a world of difference. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are a leading global provider of paper-based packaging solutions for a wide variety of products for food, beverage, foodservice and other consumer products companies. We are one of the largest producers of folding cartons and hold a leading market position in solid bleached sulfate, coated unbleached kraft and coated recycled paperboard. Graphic Packaging's customers include some of the most widely- recognized companies in the world. We achieve our vision by delivering value to our customers, building a high-performance culture for our employees and creating superior returns for our shareholders. We strive to be an environmentally responsible leader in our industry and in the communities where we operate. Graphic Packaging has approximately 17,000 employees working in more than 60 locations in North and South America, Europe and the Pacific Rim. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefit programs that are among the best in the industry to reward the talented people who make our company successful. We invite you to review the following employment opportunity and to learn more about us at www.graphicpkg.com. Purpose: The SBS Business is a 1.5 million annual ton division supporting five major product lines Folding Carton, Cup Stock, Plate Stock, Aseptic and Liner.  The Supply Planning Analyst / Trainer position is expected to be a supply planner super user, trainer, supply planning backfill (as needed) and team support analyst. This role supports primary manufacturing & extruding facilities, remote converting facilities and outsourcing in the SBS business reporting to the Supply Planning Manager.  The position will also be responsible for analytical analysis, trouble shooting, and decision making ensuring proper execution of machine capacity. The position will be responsible for developing processes that continuously improve supply chain operations within and across functional areas, businesses, teams and employee development. In addition, the position will ensure that supply chain initiatives are developed and implemented to meet the strategic objectives of the business and the sector's supply chain function. Key Accountabilities:Acts as super user for all facets of the supply planning department5+ years' experience Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)5+ years' experience planning and scheduling in a production environment utilizing SAP or a comparable ERP systemMust be capable of backfilling for any supply planner on any resource at any facility for both vacation relief and/or unplanned absencesTrain new employees on supply planning functionality or existing employees on new functionalityProven analytical skills including effective use of BW, BEX or equivalent report writer to gather data as neededAbility to create, load, and/or modify existing business reports utilizing report writing softwareMust have firm understanding of material hierarchy and planning data structure within a ERP system2+ years' experience utilizing trim optimization software in production scheduling5+ years' experience working with inside and outside sales team Order management processes (including order entry, allocation checks, and variant configurations)Patient demeanorGood communicator (verbal and written)Responsible for writing system change requests as neededResponsible for testing new system functionalityCapable and responsible for producing division level required reportingMust have ability to travel as neededCapable of backfilling for SBS Supply Planning managers when neededKnowledge and Experience:Bachelor's degree requiredKnowledge of Operating Model functionalityKnowledge of facility/business operationsFamiliar with supply chain conceptsStrong technical and analytical skillsChange Management Leadership skillsCompetencies:Command skillsDrive for ResultsProcess ManagementCustomer FocusAnalytical skillsDealing with AmbiguityNegotiatingOrganizationProblem SolvingPeer RelationshipPriority Setting Graphic Packaging is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All candidates will be evaluated on the basis of their qualifications for the job in question. We do not base our employment decision on an employee's or applicant's race, color, religion, age, gender or sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic identity, genetic information, disability, veteran/military status or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. Name: Supv Management and Program Analyst
Description: Videos Duties Help  Help  Duties  Summary This position is assigned to the Business Management and Administration Section; Family Readiness Division; Commander, Navy Installations Command (CNIC). Fleet and Family Readiness (FFR) is the Navy’s Quality of Life (QOL) program providing essential products and services to promote and improve the retention, capabilities, quality, productivity, reputation and morale of all Navy Personnel and their families.Learn more about this agencyResponsibilities In order to qualify for this position, resumes must provide sufficient experience and/or education, knowledge, skills, and ability to perform the duties of the position. Applicant resumes are the key means for evaluating skills, knowledge, and abilities as they relate to this position therefore, applicants are encouraged to be clear and specific when describing experience.  Serves as senior analyst and program manager for the FFSP Certification Program and performs development, management and implementation of Navy FFSP Certification standards and review processes used by Installations, Regions and Certification Team to evaluate program compliance and quality of service provided in Navy Fleet and Family Service Centers (FFSCs). Ensures Navy FFSP Certification is aligned to Department of Defense (DoD) FR certification requirements, as well as DoD Family Advocacy Program (FAP) compliance reporting processes. Ensures standards used during FFSP Certification accurately reflect family readiness policies, mission and goals of the Department of the Navy (DON) and DoD.  Conducts detailed analysis of complex functions and work processes of programs and makes recommendations for improvement in the effectiveness and efficiency of the FFSP and work operations. Develops new methods, organizational structures, and management processes. Counsels and advises program analysts on methods and procedures, management surveys, management reports, and control techniques.  Establishes procedures for scheduling Certification Visits and for the composition of both off-site and on-site Certification Teams. Provides management and oversight of all FFSP Certification Review processes including Installation Self-Assessment, coordination of findings between off-site and on-site reviewers, communication of certification findings, analysis and determining sufficiency of additional evidence of compliance, conferral of FFSP Certification and Maintenance of Compliance reporting and processes. Manages the FFSP Certification Schedule to ensure requirements are met and lapses in FFSP Certification are minimized. Oversees and directs the DoD Family Readiness Certification and FAP Compliance reporting processes. Ensures Team Members, headquarters, regional and installation managers are trained and aware of Navy FFSP Certification standards and processes. Develops and implements initial and refresher training for Team Reviewers.Provides guidance to Certification Team reviewers and FFSP managers during site visits, both when serving as Certification Team Lead and when an alternate Team Lead is on site. Follows up on findings, recommendations, and deficiencies as identified.  Evaluates the performance of Alternate Team Leads and Team Reviewers, addressing any performance issues identified by Team Reviewer or Installation Staff surveys in a timely manner.  Provides review and analysis and makes recommendations to senior Family Readiness managers when a region or installation submits a request for review of an FFSP Certification finding.  Evaluates the content of new or modified legislation relating to family readiness programs to determine the programmatic impact within the CNIC Area of Responsibility. Makes changes to Certification standards based on policy changes and translates approved legislative changes into CNIC program guidelines and Navy FFSP Certification standards.  Provides annual analysis and program updates to the Certification Advisory Council comprised of Regional Family Readiness Program Directors.  Prepares supporting documentation in the form of spreadsheets, Power Point presentations, databases, word documents for presentations and proposals by higher-level management.  Recommends and approves performance awards and salary/bonus distribution for subordinates. Participates in interview panels, recommends, and approves hiring, promotions and reassignments.  Manages the FFSP Management Assist Team (MAT), ensuring regional or installation requests for Site Augmentation are coordinated and filled in a timely manner and performance of the MAT staff is evaluated by the Regional/Site POC at the conclusion of the assignment. Ensures the currency of MAT staff training for assuming Headquarters, Regional and Installation level assignments with very short advanced notice.  Directs work to be accomplished by staff. Assigns work based on priorities, difficulty and requirements of assignments, and staff capabilities. Conducts annual performance reviews of staff. Participates in section staffing decisions. Ensures staff receives proper training to fulfill requirements of their positions. Addresses potential disciplinary and/or performance issues timely and takes appropriate, corrective action(s) as necessary.  Directly supervises and provides technical oversight for up to two (2) full time subordinates (GS-12E); and up to 20 flex employees. Travel Required50% or less - may be required. Supervisory statusNo Promotion Potential05 Job family (Series)0343 Management And Program Analysis Similar jobs  Analysts, Management Analysts, Program Distribution Managers Management Analysts Managers, Distribution Program Analysts Requirements Help  Help  Requirements  Conditions of Employment Must successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. Any discrepancies must be resolved as a condition of employment. QualificationsResumes must include information which demonstrates experience and knowledge, skills, and ability (KSAs) as they relate to this position. Applicants are encouraged to be clear and specific when describing their experience level and KSAs.  A bachelor's degree in education and/or social science or a related field is preferred.  Knowledge of social/human services delivery systems and concepts, principles and theories relating to one or more of the social or behavioral science fields.  Knowledge of advanced concepts of program management, requirements determination, policy development, evaluative and analytical processes, and program implementation.  Knowledge and understanding of requirements and operations of the DoD and the DON programs that support military members and families.  Knowledge of the Navy operational/organizational structure, chain of command, protocol and funding, agency programs and activities; agency mission, policies, and objectives; management principles and processes; and analytical and evaluative methods as it relates to the Navy wide FFSP.  Knowledge of development, procurement, award, and administration of military support/human services contracts.  Knowledge of the concepts of program management, requirement determination, policy development, evaluative and analytical processes, and programs implementation. Ability to apply these concepts in order to design and conduct a comprehensive, quality assurance program.  Knowledge of family readiness functions, organizations, policies, resources and analytical and evaluative processes.  Knowledge of qualitative and/or quantitative methods for the assessment and improvement of program effectiveness and/or identification of improvement areas.  Knowledge of research methodology, information retrieval and data organization for analysis, decision making, and formulation of recommendations.  Knowledge of techniques and formats required for effective communication with Political Appointees (PA), Members of Congress, Senior Executive Service (SES), and flag level officials as well as in drafting policies/programs.  Knowledge of CNIC‘s EEO policy and procedures.  Skill in developing, organizing, and conducting executive studies through team efforts.  Ability to analyze and prepare clear, concise, and technically sound reports related to work within the Branch.  Ability to develop and effectively deliver presentations and/or training.  Ability to perform the full range of supervisory duties.  Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. EducationIf you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:  Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S.  Department of Education: http://www.ed.gov/admins/finaid/accred/  Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

Provides direction to other functional teams as needed, including those outside of the product line. Responsible for providing input as an effective communicator on resource negotiation, managing workload, and setting schedules as needed.
