Name: IT Security Analyst 5 (JoinOCI-SecGroup)
Description: Executes security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing e-commerce programs.  Researches attempted efforts to compromise security protocols. Maintains security systems for routers and switches. Administers security policies to control access to systems. Maintains the company s firewall. Uses applicable encryption methods. Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information.  Provide leadership and expertise in evaluating and developing complex business problems, frequently operating at the leading edge of technology. Recommends and justifies major changes to existing automated systems. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. Eight or more years of related experience recommended.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law. OCI Security Go-to-Market Engineer* Are you interested in solving complex security problems in a new development organization? Oracle s Cloud Security Organization is working to increase product and platform capabilities that allow us to prevent, detect, and respond to threats to Oracle s Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) environment. The OCI Security Go-To-Market (GTM) team is partnering with our internal security architects, engineers, and developers to comprehensively own all external communications regarding OCI security & compliance.  OCI Security GTM takes a big-picture security view of what we do and what we are planning, covering product, platform, process, and people, covering all types of communication written, verbal, live, canned. We empower other groups to deliver & scale security capability and operations while we focus on telling the current story and future roadmap in an honest and compelling manner.  Understand and represent the Oracle security & compliance capability set against that of our competitors (internal sense of urgency vs. external view  As a Senior Security Engineer in the GTM team, you will need strong technical expertise, clear communication skills, and unending passion for information security. Qualifications: 5 years in information security and risk management solution architecture, engineering, development, and / or program management.  Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Security, etc.  Strong written / verbal communication skills.  Experience with security controls in cloud infrastructure / platform-as-a-service environments, either as a customer or provider  Proven ease at connecting the deep technical topics with the business case and priorities.  Knowledge of available security tools, vendors, and controls  Knowledge of regulatory compliance frameworks, including PCI, FedRAMP, etc.  Good interpersonal skills  Highly self-motivated and directed  Experience building and communicating roadmaps to customers, explaining priority rationale, and funneling feedback to accountable teams / management  Experience building and presenting executive summary content from highly technical capabilities and decisions  Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Job Responsibilities  Work with technical content owners to create accurate and impactful content across OCI security and compliance, including whitepapers, blog posts, customer presentations, capability demos, etc.  Deliver strongly against established objectives, such as increasing customer awareness of security and compliance, expanding mindshare with customers, driving adoption of OCI by using security and compliance as an enabler of sales  Educate Oracle field/sales on security and compliance functionality, controls, roadmaps, etc.  Collaboratively engage with security professionals among our key customers, so that they understand our capabilities and roadmaps, and so that we factor their feedback into our plans.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.-?xml:namespace prefix="o" /-> Please email your resume to cassandra.engle@oracle.com for immediate consideration. *Job:** **Information Technology**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *IT Security Analyst 5 (JoinOCI-SecGroup)**Location:** *WA,Washington-Seattle**Requisition ID:** *180015TW**Other Locations:** *United States, US-WA,Washington-Bellevue*

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Your talents will be used to prepare and consolidate financial statements, analyze and reconcile accounts, analyze cash flow, build budgets and forecasts, prepare audits, and handle internal control maintenance and regulatory reporting. The challenging, fast-paced work environment requires top-notch analytical skills. Along with a strong benefits package, this position is well compensated and offers the possibility to advance. What you get to do every single day - Produce monthly consolidated P L and Balance Sheet flux analysis for management purposes - Provide Balance Sheet account reconciliations - Present analysis on financial results such as trends, performance metrics, benchmarks, etc. - Aid in coordinating quarterly reviews and SOX testing with internal and external auditors - Engage in various department-wide initiatives - Ensure corporate accounting policies, procedures, and controls are followed when working with business partners and be able to provide support on special requests - Coordinate Ad-hoc projects as necessary - Strong interest in continuously improving the automation of the accounting and reporting process - Perform monthly accounting close procedures and deliverables such as journal entries, reconciliations, reports in compliance with GAAP Candidates with this experience should email their resume to Edgin.Levy@roberthalf.com.  Robert Half Finance & Accounting, the world's leader in specialized financial staffing, provides exciting full-time opportunities in the areas of accounting, bookkeeping, finance, audit, taxation and more. But don't take our word for it. Our company has appeared on Fortune? magazine's list of "World's Most Admired Companies" since 1998, and 9 out of 10 of our customers would recommend our service to a colleague. Description: The Gross to Net Analyst role is responsible for the day-to-day ownership of chargeback and membership related activities: chargeback processing, customer maintenance, deduction and dispute resolution, managing wholesaler relationships, and oversight. Within that scope of responsibility the analyst is accountable for proactively identifying and communicating issues, determining impact, and proposing resolutions. This role is critical in initiating process improvement recommendations, providing training, and proactively addressing and resolving inquiries from internal stakeholders and external customers. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills are essential for working with business partners, ensuring process efficiency, and delivering upon operational objectives. The analyst works closely with other GFS G2N colleagues to achieve department metrics and lead strategic projects as needed.  The position requires excellent problem solving skills, management to results, organizational agility, customer service, and the ability to build strong relationships across the end to end process. The position will be based in Memphis.

Name: Senior Lease Administration Analyst
Description: Under limited supervision, upholds the integrity of real estate portfolio data for large, complex portfolio of clients. Inputs, maintains, organizes and reports on information regarding lease dates, dollar values and financial accounting transactions into a lease management software database. Prepares, processes and reconciles AR & AP transactions to ensure accurate and current lease information is maintained. Acts as lead for lease administration team.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Resolves critical issues for clients by researching and gathering information about payment transactions, lease terms and other relevant items. Establishes and maintains working relationship with clients and/or landlords. Acts as a team lead including providing work flow direction to co-workers and providing account supervision. Ensures data integrity and accuracy by performing quality control review of work completed by team members. Prepares lease abstracts and edits them for accuracy. Writes narratives for monthly variance reports, providing analysis and interpretation of lease information to clients. Tracks payables and receivables associated with the leases in portfolio. Processes client rent rolls utilizing the database. Prepares export files and sends to accounting for payables processing. Prepares invoices for subtenants, reconciles subtenant accounts, reviews incoming invoices for errors/accuracy with lease document and ensures correct coding. Reviews profit center reports for accuracy. Prepares and distributes periodic and ad hoc reports in a timely, accurate manner. Designs reports utilizing various report writers, Excel, Word, and/or Access. Reviews standard reports prepared by team members for accuracy. Prepares and distributes critical date reports; maintains tickler system for tracking important dates and tasks. Performs annual operating expense reconciliations, monitors audit windows and audit requirements contained in the lease documents. Creates and maintains client lease files ensuring they contain current, accurate information. Serves as a member of a transition team, if needed, to get a new account set up and operating quickly and efficiently. Cross-checks and reviews work of peers to ensure quality and accuracy of data. May provide and/or assist with budgeting and forecasting activities. May conduct financial analysis/accounting as appropriate, including AR/AP, rent rolls, and budgets in accordance with required accounting principles (GAAP, Tax, Cash, etc.). Performs other duties as assigned.  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES  No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. Coordinates and assigns tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  High school degree or general education degree required plus a minimum of four years related work experience, preferably including property management or accounting. Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university with Accounting, Finance or Real Estate preferred.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None  COMMUNICATION SKILLS  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.  FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE  Requires in-depth knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate complex figures and conduct financial/business analysis including the preparation of reports.  REASONING ABILITY  Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Intermediate knowledge of computer software and hardware (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite Products). Ability to work well under pressure. Advanced organizational skills.  SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY  Decisions made with thorough knowledge of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers, supervisor and clients.  About CBRE (NYSE: CBG): At CBRE, you are empowered to take your career path into your own hands. Enjoy workplace flexibility in a global organization with tremendous scale. Work in an inclusive and collaborative environment with supportive teammates. Come experience the employee advantage at CBRE.  CBRE has a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.  As a Fortune 500 worldwide leader in real estate services, CBRE's more than 70,000 professionals provide exceptional outcomes for clients in 60+ countries. When it comes to real estate, CBRE sees potential everywhere. We turn scale into strength, expense into performance, and property into prosperity. Visit CBRE.com. CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2017 revenues of $14.2 billion and more than 80,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #214 in 2017. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 17 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for six years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE.”  CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. Name: Senior Merchandising Analyst
Description: Position Summary: Senior Merchandising Analysts are internal consultants for the Merchandising department. They manage the analytic data for the business decision processes as well as a statistical and financial foundation for merchandising decisions regarding product placement. Job Responsibilities- Other duties may be assigned: Involved in cross functional teams developing strategic planning and specific corporate initiatives. Must be catalyst for change and drive process improvement. Position viewed as training ground for future leaders. Some of the specific responsibilities of the position are: Develop and validate statistical models for estimating demand forecast and conversion.Provide advanced analytical support for cross-functional teams to coordinate ongoing processes or activities that cross organizational boundariesWork to review, validate and manipulate the large scale data to expand understanding throughout the organization and to support departmental and executive decision makingLead development for special initiatives related to product assortment.Integrate the new data and analytical technologies to improve the current forecast system.Develop the systems and tools to help merchandizing team and monitor their health and build alerts and reportsWork directly with Directors and VPs to design analysis and address specific needs on strategic projects.Skills and Requirements:Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Statistics, or closely related disciplines required.3 years of experience in an analytical role with sufficient experience in developing processes and applications for business.Strong analytical skills to do statistical modeling and quantitative research as well as data mining, machine learning, clustering, etc.Proficient in SAS, R, TensorFlow, Python, PHP in Linux and in Google Cloud environments.Must be a self-starter and motivated to complete projects timely and with accuracy.Proficiency in Excel and excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with colleagues and clients. Incumbents in this position are expected to possess the ability to think creatively and work effectively with teams of professionals engaged in tackling real-world business problems of retailing.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $70,000.00 to $95,000.00 /year  Experience: retail: 1 year (Preferred)

Name: Applications Development Analyst I - Source Fiber
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. PURPOSE: The Applications Development Analyst I serves as a technical team member to the Deliver & Source Support Team for the Fiber Supply applications and the related hardware. The analyst works with the Global Sourcing organization and specifically the extended IP fiber receiving community to support these unique applications by resolving technical problems, testing, implementing, training and documenting new applications or changes to existing applications; and monitoring data flows and systems availability. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: + Provides technical and functional support for the Scale and Fiber systems. This includes build, updates, patches, reporting, security, hardware changes and recommendations on efficiencies.  + Participates in the overall process improvement of the functional area  + Acts as a contact for the Deliver & Source Support Team; also works with the business, ITSS, PIMS and other IT groups to coordinate the maintenance of information technology required by the business  + Understands the technical requirements of the systems and the nature of any proposed business process changes and will compose technical specifications to ensure continued operation of the systems.  + Ability to learn and understand the business as well as knowing and understanding how to work with ITSS and other IT groups to accomplish goals  + Analyzes changes to corporate hardware and software standards to ensure that the existing applications continue to function as designed, without compromising security or the integrity of the applications.  + Ensures that assignments are delivered on time by participating in project/planning meetings and communicating regularly with the team and appropriate managers  + Communicates regularly with BIM, PIM, internal facilities and vendors for resolution and collaboration.  + Acts as a team member to accomplish specific assignments or tasks. KEY CHALLENGES: + Building a working relationship with the business, security, audit and the COE in order understand their requirements and IT needs  + Working with the ITSS organization to analyze hardware and software changes as required by the business or corporate standards  + Establishing peer relationships with other business IT groups to support the business  + Extended support hours  + Managing multiple projects at the same time SCOPE: Work in a team environment to support and enhance Global Sourcing?s Fiber Supply unique applications, in the areas of scale systems and fiber procurement. Position will be responsible for leading support related projects through development life cycle. This position will interact directly with the Global Sourcing business, PIMS, COE, and ITSS personnel to ensure applications are maintained at a high level of availability to the end users and external customers. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor?s degree in Information Systems, related technical field, or equivalent experience required.  Minimum 5 years of IT experience with a minimum of 3 years application support experience required. Technical Skills/Knowledge Required: + PC hardware configuration/function  + Windows O/S expertise (7, 10)  + Advanced troubleshooting  + Technical Writing  + SQL/ORACLE DB structure, configuration, and scripting Technical Skills/Knowledge Preferred: + Truck scaling / receiving system experience  + Understanding of Scaling Platforms and Federal Weights and Measures  + TCP/IP network infrastructure knowledge  + Crystal Reporting  + Windows Group Policies CORE COMPETENCIES: + Customer Focus  + Action Oriented  + Problem Solving  + Learning on the Fly  + Organizing and Planning  + Functional and Technical Skills  + Peer Relationships  + Business Acumen  + Political Savvy  + Creativity  + Integrity & Trust  + Dealing with Ambiguity  International Paper is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans. Name: POS Implementation Consultant
Description: Intermediate implementation professional who analyzes customer needs, configures the solution, and installs it at the customer site.  Ensure the solution meets specifications and functions per customer specific operational work flow for multiple concepts, users, and service models. Resolve any gaps in functionality. Train the staff on the use of the new solution, and take the site live on the system after everything has been configured and everyone is trained. Ensure a smooth transition to the new system. Answer operational and application questions and consult the customer in a manner to transfer ownership of the system to the customer. After "go-live", provide technical support to the customer.  2-5 years of overall experience in relevant roles. Ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients. Ability to travel as needed. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.*POS Implementation Consultant*TRAVEL: Up to 100%* This role requires 5-7 years of overall experience in an applicable role as an IT or POS Deployment Engineer or as an experienced user of the Simphony POS product or similar products. Candidates must have the ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients. This position requires up to *90% TRAVEL; this is a true Road Warrior role*. The ability to travel as needed which can include weekends and holidays is a must. Candidates can be based anywhere in the Continental US close to a large, metropolitan airport. Training in the POS products will be provided at our Columbia, Maryland location in conjunction with shadowing on current installs.  Preference is given to individuals which have the below skills and knowledge: 2 years or more experience working in the Hospitality Industry (Hotels and Restaurants)*Experience as user of POS systems such as but not limited to (Simphony 2.0, Simphony 1.0, MICROS 3700/8700/9700/e7)*Technical experience as it relates to installing Hardware and troubleshooting that HardwareKnowledge of Cloud based software systemsKnowledge of 3rd party interfaces*Job:** **Consulting**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *POS Implementation Consultant**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001EL7*

Name: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description: Job DescriptionView’s mission is to create delightful human environments.  In the great tradition of challenging the way we think about everyday essentials, the team at View has reinvented something that hasn't changed for centuries – the simple window – and in doing so, is transforming the largest industry in the world: real estate.  We manufacture View Dynamic Glass, a new generation of smart windows that let in natural light and views, and enhance mental and physical wellbeing by significantly reducing headaches, eyestrain and drowsiness. In addition, View’s windows reduce glare and heat, improving the energy efficiency of buildings by 20 percent. View’s windows are digital, cloud connected, and can be controlled from anywhere, including your phone. We are also leveraging advances in AI to develop smart building and IoT applications that make buildings healthier, smarter and more productive than anyone ever imagined.  View is already installed in over 35 million square feet and is growing rapidly. If you dream of changing the world to make it a better place – join us. POSITION SUMMARY View’s IT team is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer. In this position, you will be responsible for the strategy, implementation and ongoing execution of View’s Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence plans and platforms at our Manufacturing Facility in Olive Branch, MS. You will be collaborating with multiple stakeholders from our Corporate and Manufacturing facilities as well as our suppliers and other IT functions in View Manufacturing. You will be reporting to the Manager of Enterprise Data and you will be based out of our Olive Branch, MS facility. ESSENTIAL POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES · Manage BI and reporting product suite delivering web-based reporting, dashboards, and ad hoc query capability.  · Design and build reporting and analysis tools that help streamline the business and make reporting, analyzing, planning, and forecasting more efficient.  · ETL/data integration design, development, and support.  · Assist in data conversions, imports, and exports of data within and between internal and external software systems.  · Document new and existing data models, solutions, and implementations.  · Explore data and discover patterns, meaningful relationships, anomalies, and trends.  · Troubleshoot reported ETL, reconciliation, or reporting inconsistencies, track, monitor and analyze performance and production issues, and implement improvements.  · Work closely with customers and analysts to create reports, keep customers informed about business intelligence tool problems and resolutions. DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE o Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or related field or equivalent experience.At least 6+ years of continuous experience with Microsoft technologies with very strong skills in T-SQL.Experience with tools like the Microsoft BI stack (SSIS, SSRS, PowerBI), Business Objects, and Tableau.5+ years of hands-on experience supporting or working with Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing environments. o Preferred Qualifications: Preferred familiarity with application technologies including C#, .NET Framework, Entity Framework.Working knowledge of Cloud Computing platforms (AWS, Azure).SQL Server related certifications are a plus.Experience working in a manufacturing environment is preferred. Company DescriptionWe manufacture View Dynamic Glass, a new generation of smart windows that let in natural light and views, and enhance mental and physical wellbeing by significantly reducing headaches, eyestrain and drowsiness. In addition, View’s windows reduce glare and heat, improving the energy efficiency of buildings by 20 percent. View’s windows are digital, cloud connected, and can be controlled from anywhere, including your phone. We are also leveraging advances in AI to develop smart building and IoT applications that make buildings healthier, smarter and more productive than anyone ever imagined.

Name: Technical Analyst 3-Support
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) proven professional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle) Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.**Job:** **Support**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Technical Analyst 3-Support**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001COA**Other Locations:** *US-FL,Florida-Orlando, US-CO,Colorado-Colorado Springs*

Name: PMS Implementation Consultant
Description: Entry-level implementation professional who analyzes customer needs , configures the solution, and installs it at the customer site.  Ensure the solution meets specifications and functions per customer specific operational work flow for multiple concepts, users, and service models. Resolve any gaps in functionality. Train the staff on the use of the new solution, and take the site live on the system after everything has been configured and everyone is trained. Ensure a smooth transition to the new system. Answer operational and application questions and consult the customer in a manner to transfer ownership of the system to the customer. After "go-live", provide technical support to the customer.  0 to 2 years of experience relevant to the role. Ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients. Ability to travel as needed. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.* Property Management System (PMS)Interface Implementation Consultants analyze customer needs, configure thesolution, and work closely with 3rdparty vendors and the site todeliver a successful product. Our Implementation Consultants also provideclient training on the PMS Interface.  Implementation Consultants ensure that our PMS solutions meet all of thespecifications and functions that are unique to each of our hospitalityclients. Implementation Consultants resolve any gaps in productfunctionality and train our clients how to use the new product. They arealso responsible for taking the client live on the system after everythinghas been configured and everyone is trained. Implementation Consultants areaccountable for ensuring a smooth transition and positive user experience. They are available to answer operational and application questions duringthe implementation process and after "go-live". They aresubject matter experts in the PMS products. Our ImplementationConsultants are full time, Oracle employees and enjoy our best in classbenefits and growth opportunities.  _JobRequirements_  Candidates must have the ability to communicateeffectively and build rapport with team members and clients. This position requiresa high amount of travel. Candidates can be based anywhere in theContinental US. Training in the Opera Products will be provided at ourColumbia, Maryland location.  Preferenceis given to individuals which have the below skills and knowledge 2 years or more experience working in the Hospitality Industry (Hotels and Restaurants)Experience as user of POS Systems helpfulExperience as user of Opera Property management such as but not limited to (PMS, S&C, OXI, IFC, OVOS)Technical experience as it relates to installing Hardware and troubleshooting that HardwareKnowledge of Cloud based software systemsKnowledge of XML language is a plusKnowledge of IT networking and security protocols is a plus*Job:** **Consulting**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *PMS Implementation Consultant**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001F8P*

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Application  The application opened in a new tab.  By using this feature you agree to our Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy.  Details Posted: November 20, 2018 Location: Memphis,  Show Map Salary: Open  CBRE is seeking a senior financial analyst to be a part of the premier capital markets investment sales team based in the Suburban Philadelphia Office specializing in retail shopping centers. This position will play an integral role in assignments ranging from one-off asset sales to the sale of large portfolios with responsibilities that go beyond the financial aspects of the deal involving all phases of the sales process.  The chosen candidate will have a strong foundational knowledge of financial/valuation concepts, demonstrate a passion for real estate, work well in a dynamic team environment and demonstrate a strong work ethic. Responsibilities:Underwrite assets for sale using Argus Enterprise and Excel.Analyze, review, and interpret real estate source documents, including operating statements, rent rolls, leases, and other due diligence material.Research market conditions in support of financial underwriting assumptions.Compile and present the results of analyses and effectively address questions.Identify critical property level financial issues and make recommendations.Developing disposition strategies in conjunction with team members and clients.Communicate directly with capital markets professionals, asset managers, leasing brokers, property managers and clients.Research and comprehend rent and sales comparables as part of the valuation processQualifications:Bachelor's degree with high academic achievement in Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, or Economics preferred.Strong understanding of financial concepts (i.e, Discounted Cash Flow, IRR, NPV, etc.)Ability to review, analyze and interpret source documents, including leases, operating statements, budgets, etc.Intermediate-level Excel skills and a BA II Plus calculator preferred.Must demonstrate an aptitude for building and understanding financial models.Experience in the valuation of income-producing properties is a plus, but not mandatory.Intellectual curiosity with a demonstrated enthusiasm for the commercial real estate industry.Excellent quantitative and analytical skills in combination with outstanding communication skills (both oral and written).Self-starter with sharp focus on details with an awareness of the bigger picture.Ability to manage time effectively and work under the pressure of multiple deadlines.A sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results in a challenging, fast-paced, environment.Ability to work effectively within a team and with all levels of personnel.Professional demeanor and positive attitude. Internal Number: ********  Create a Job Alert for Similar Jobs  About CBRE  With broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world. CBRE Group, Inc. is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2017 revenues of $14.2 billion and more than 80,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #214 in 2017. It also has been voted the industry's top brand by the Lipsey Company for 17 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune's Most Admired Companies in the real estate sector for six years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol CBRE. CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. Name: Intelligence Analyst (35F)
Description: ARMY or RESERVE CAREEROverview The intelligence analyst is primarily responsible for the analysis, processing and distribution of strategic and tactical intelligence. They are integral to providing Army personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas. Job DutiesPrepare all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssess the significance and reliability of incoming information with current intelligenceEstablish and maintain systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesRequirements Those who want to serve must first take the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery, a series of tests that helps you better understand your strengths and identify which Army jobs are best for you. Training Job training for an intelligence analyst requires 10 weeks of Basic Combat Training and 16 weeks of Advanced Individual Training with on-the-job instruction. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and in the field.  Some of the skills youll learn are: Critical thinkingPreparing maps, charts and intelligence reportsMilitary symbologyUsing computer systems Helpful Skills Interest in reading maps and chartsGathering information and studying its meaningAbility to think, speak and write clearlyRequired ASVAB Score(s)Skilled Technical (ST): 101Learn more about the ASVAB and see what jobs you could qualify for.Compensation Total compensation includes housing, medical, food, special pay, and vacation time. Learn more about total compensation. Earn Cash For In Demand Jobs You could earn up to $40,000 in cash bonuses just for enlisting under certain Military Occupational Specialties. Visit Jobs in Demand to see if this job qualifies for an enlistment bonus. Education Benefits In the Army, qualified students can earn full-tuition, merit-based scholarships, allowances for books and fees, plus an annual stipend for living expenses. Learn more about education benefits. Future Civilian Careers The skills you learn will help prepare you for a career in research, business planning and even government agencies such as the Central Intelligence Agency. PARTNERSHIP FOR YOUTH SUCCESS (PaYS) Program Those interested in this job may be eligible for civilian employment, after the Army, by enrolling in the Army PaYS program. The PaYS program is a recruitment option that guarantees a job interview with military friendly employers that are looking for experienced and trained Veterans to join their organization. Find out more about the Army PaYS Program at http://www.armypays.com. Name: IT Supply Chain Systems Lead Analyst
Description: Location: Memphis, TN  Location: Austin, TX Job DescriptionABOUT USSmith & Nephew is a diversified advanced medical technology business that supportshealthcare professionals in more than 100 countries to improve the quality of life for their patients.We do this by taking apioneering approach to the design of ouradvanced medical products and services, by securing wider access to our diverse technologies for more customers globally, and by enabling better outcomes for patients and healthcare systems.We have leadership positions in Orthopaedic Reconstruction, Advanced Wound Management, Sports Medicine and Trauma:Orthopedics Reconstruction - joint replacement systems for knees, hips and shouldersAdvanced Wound Management - wound care treatment and prevention products used to treat hard-to-heal woundsSports Medicine - minimally invasive surgery of the jointTrauma & Extremities - products that help repair broken bonesWe have over 15,000 employees around the world.Annual sales in 2016 were more than $4.6 billion.We are a constituent of the UK's FTSE100and our shares aretraded on the London Stock Exchange and throughAmerican Depository Receipts on the New York Stock Exchange (LSE: SN, NYSE: SNN).SUMMARY The IT Supply Chain Systems Lead Analyst is responsible for activities associated with the daily operation and continued development of Smith & Nephew's Supply Chain systems including relevant SAP modules, the Logility Advanced Planning system solution, and other associated supporting systems and functions. This role is also responsible for collaborating with the outsourced application managed services for relevant Supply Chain systems  The IT Supply Chain Systems Lead Analyst acts as the primary link between the business requirements and the underlying capability of the systems, ensuring that the solutions that are delivered are robust, efficient and deliver the maximum possible value to the business. This will include conducting the analysis of existing business processes, the identification and evaluation of possible business and technical solutions in response to both business issues and improvement opportunities, the design of future processes, the recommendation of options that best fit the business need with-in the strategic roadmap.  The ideal candidate will have significant experience with ERP systems (SAP) and advanced supply chain planning concepts with focus on Demand and Supply Planning as well as existing knowledge of the Logility software. users.Deliver effective and robust support solutions that meet the business requirements/objectives via the outsourced Application Managed Support Service providers.Ensure that SLAs are achieved.Provide day to day support and ongoing operation of the relevant SAP modules across multiple sites, via a formal support model.Focus on continuous improvement and refinement of support service processes.Design of future support service processes and recommendation of options that best fit the business needsParticipate in the delivery of enhancements via the work management process.Deliver effective and robust SAP solutions that meet the business requirements / objectives via SAP configuration and / or the generation of functional specifications for ABAP Name: MRO Purchasing/DC Analyst
Description: We begin with dreams. Dreams drive our motivation. Dreams are our future. The world's dreams, people's dreams, our dreams. Our passion creates ideas that make dreams come alive. Technology and products that were only dreams become reality.  All for dreams. Dreams challenge and the Nidec-Group will continue to meet the challenge. For the world's and people's tomorrows; the world's first, the world's best technologies and products; we will continue our part in creating a better society. Job SummaryBasic Duties and Responsibilities:  The Purchasing Analyst will have the responsibility for assuring the availability of all materials, supplies, and services required to support Production, Distribution, and Administrative operations for the Southaven Customer Service Center. This involves setting and managing reorder points and initiating purchasing of all MRO items and services. This position administers M&R tickets and manages and analyzes mobile equipment fleet operating expense. This position also serves as expeditor for direct items required for Mod Center Production. In addition, this position is also responsible monitoring, analyzing, and reporting facility cost versus budget to the management team.  This position requires the ability to perform these responsibilities in a safe, accurate and timely manner in accordance with Safety policy & procedures, Quality and the principles of 3Q6S, and time standards. Regular attendance is required for this position.  Position reports to the Facility Industrial Engineer, and performs as part of the Southaven Customer Service Center team to drive continuous improvement using metrics to achieve logistics excellence in service, quality and cost. ESSENTIAL Duties and Responsibilities:Execute purchases for all facility expenses including materials, supplies and services.Establish and manage ROP’s for all facility expense items, materials and supplies.Monitor scheduled maintenance requirements and initiate service appointments as required.Manage maintenance work order system to initiate unplanned service requirements and track M&R cost.Investigate and assist AP in resolution of vendor invoice issues – price, quantity, receipts, freight, taxes, etc.Optimize vendor performance through effective follow-up, acknowledgement receipt, and order expeditingObtain best possible pricing through effective supplier sourcing and negotiationPrepare management reports and metrics for various stakeholders.Assist Director of Operations with annual budgeting and monitoring actual vs. budget performance.Perform a variety of miscellaneous business operations analysis and reporting as neededOther duties as required by the Facility Management Team.Adhere to and enforce safe work practices and all safety policies and rulesHave a thorough understanding of the site’s production and distribution processes and systems to be able to support as needed.Job Description SKILLS:Computer literacy to include Warehouse Management Systems and MS Office (Word, Excel, Internet Explorer)Previous experience with WMS in Microsoft Dynamics and ORACLE environments a plus.Ability to follow and adhere to policies and procedure including Federal State and local laws (Ethics, Sarbanes-Oxley, General Accounting, etc.)Communication skills-ability to communicate with all levels within the organization to include customers, corporate office contacts, employees and managers.Strong organizational skillsAnalytical and planning skillsAbility to develop working relationships as a team player; and able to work independently.High level of integrity.High degree of accuracy; extreme attention to detail, strong problem solver, able to create solutions to challenges in an expedient manner.Regular attendance is an essential part of the job.Must have the ability to adjust work schedule for Inventory needs (physical inventory, inventory prep, etc.) PHYSICAL DEMANDS:  Position requires sitting, walking, stooping, bending, talking in person and by phone or video; the stamina to work the shift as scheduled and on a regular basis, ability to work in a non-climate controlled facility with exposure to heat and/or cold in accordance with weather conditions, lifting large, small or awkwardly shaped items on a regular or repeated basis as needed; extensive use of computer equipment. The physical demands described here and above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the position. Reasonable accommodations may be made in accordance with the ADA, as may be requested.  WORK ENVIRONMENT:  The work environment characteristics described here and above are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the position at a successful level. Additional Job Details EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: Associate’s degree or equivalent experience (accounting or business) or in lieu of degree, 3 (three) years of purchasing, materials management and/ or cost analysis.5 (five) years over-all experience in production and distribution logistics.Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at Nidec Nidec is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, genetic information, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. Pre-approval from the Nidec Talent Acquisition team is required before any external candidate can be submitted and such candidate must be submitted to the Nidec Talent Acquisition team.

No City Memphis State TN Description General Description:  As a member of the Rapid Development Team, this senior level technical analyst/consultant will focus on commercial banking web and mobile products and solutions. The team will be made up of technology developers, designers, documentation specialists, product  developers and others, all working together to complete subsets of development all turned to production on a regular quarterly schedule. Performs  additional duties as assigned.  This position may be located in Raleigh, NC, Nashville, TN, Charlotte, NC or Memphis, TN. Name: Senior WCS Business Systems Analyst
Description: We're looking for an innovative thinker who will leverage their industry experience to bring new capabilities to the distribution center to optimize and improve the automation of the movement of product.  This role will be a proactive contributor in supporting distribution center production from a technology perspective, focusing on maximizing equipment reliability and operational performance for systems such as conveyors, conveyor controls, sortation systems, scanners, cameras, print and apply systems, ASRS, and material handling robots. This role will participate as a functional member of the DC leadership team. Understand, maintain and troubleshoot material handling control systems, including PLC/PC controllers, industrial networks and electrical distribution systems.Act as a first level escalation support for the maintenance teams to locally or remotely troubleshoot and repair all hardware or controls software systems within the Distribution Center.Facilitate failure analysis and incident review processes and implement process improvements or retraining to avoid future incidents.Use diagnostic software to monitor performance of systems; collect and analyze data to identify trends and recommend improvements.Apply subject matter expertise in material handling and electronic systems to maximize system utilization.Fortna, and HighJump platform experience preferredRequirementsBachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field preferredPLC/PC program knowledge and troubleshooting experienceIndustrial electrical hands-on experience and troubleshooting, including 480V 3-phase, 110 VAC, and 24 VDC systemsControl Systems interfaces and program knowledgeAdvanced troubleshooting skills with PCs, servers and industrial controls networkingAbility to communicate clearly and effectively, relating technical issues to business leadershipConceptualize, design, engineer, and execute industry leading projects from start to finish.Partners with maintenance staff to collaborate on repairs, system flow, design, and upgradesDevelop complete and concise system Description of Operation (DOO), test plans and user guides.Interface with industry leading customers.Define and purchase electrical devices including sensors, VFDs, and PLC components.Design and engineer VFD and PLC control panels using CADIntegrate cutting edge bar code reading technology to track and sort containers.Successfully implement material handling systems by developing and implementing detailed commissioning plans.Attend all project related turnover meetings, functional design reviews and team meetings.Fully understands scope, budgets, and schedules for the project.Reviews initial project schedule and identify gaps or changes needed.Maintains and tracks issues list, reporting to Supervisor / Manager as required.Performs PLC Code reviews.Completes all in-house testing and emulation.Provides site/field reports daily, including progress, issues, and next steps, as requested. Name: Treasury Management Consultant
Description: Requisition Number 18-1320 Post Date 7/20/2018 Title Treasury Management Consultant Part Time? No City Memphis State TN Description Duties and Responsibilities  Reporting to the Rapid Development Team Leader, this position is responsible for assisting with the development of the set of products, services and process improvements managed by the Rapid Development Team. The project priorities are recommended by team members  and approved by the steering committee.  The Product Developer assists the Product Managers in becoming the subject matter expert for a set of innovative Treasury Management products and processes with concentration in redesigning products and service to take advantage of digital technology, experience  and design. The Product Developer creates prototypes and writes business requirements based on the objectives for new products services, user interfaces and improved processes. This position also explains or presents these requirements to other team members  and stakeholders to attain their buy-in for the development. These other team members may include representatives from technology, risk management, operations, compliance, marketing, sales, and customer service.  This position must be able to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating daily in close proximity to other team members and can adjust development and design priorities as the progress dictates. The team will be made up of technology developers, designers,  documentation specialists and others, all working together to complete subsets of development all turned to production on a regular quarterly schedule.  Will prepare project justification documents to communicate the reasons the bank should fund the resources required to embark on the recommended projects. This includes an understanding of the industry and its competitors as well as the financial analysis used  to outline the potential returns.  The Product Developer perform user testing and work with other team members to test the outcome of their work. That is, verify that the programming work done by technology operates as specified in the design document, or that work done by marketing delivers  the message we are trying to convey.  Certain projects do not have an assigned Project Manager, so this position will serve in that capacity in support of the assigned Product Manager. This means ensuring that all the proper stakeholders are included in pertinent meetings and updating the team  on the outcome of meetings and managing scope changes to projects.  This position may be called upon to assist with training the sales and services team in the features and functions of the product and ensures that product changes are communicated through the Business Service Center, Marketing and appropriate sales teams.  The Product Developer will work on multiple products and likely several projects simultaneously. At any time they might be assigned to work with a different Project or Product Manager depending on the need to complete a project at that time. Perform additional  duties as assigned. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: CBRE is seeking a senior financial analyst to be a part of the premier capital markets investment sales team based in the Suburban Philadelphia Office specializing in retail shopping centers. This position will play an integral role in assignments ranging from one-off asset sales to the sale of large portfolios with responsibilities that go beyond the financial aspects of the deal involving all phases of the sales process. The chosen candidate will have a strong foundational knowledge of financial/valuation concepts, demonstrate a passion for real estate, work well in a dynamic team environment and demonstrate a strong work ethic. Responsibilities: Underwrite assets for sale using Argus Enterprise and Excel. Analyze, review, and interpret real estate source documents, including operating statements, rent rolls, leases, and other due diligence material. Research market conditions in support of financial underwriting assumptions. Compile and present the results of analyses and effectively address questions. Identify critical property level financial issues and make recommendations. Developing disposition strategies in conjunction with team members and clients. Communicate directly with capital markets professionals, asset managers, leasing brokers, property managers and clients. Research and comprehend rent and sales comparables as part of the valuation process Qualifications:Bachelor's degree with high academic achievement in Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, or Economics preferred.Strong understanding of financial concepts (i.e, Discounted Cash Flow, IRR, NPV, etc.)Ability to review, analyze and interpret source documents, including leases, operating statements, budgets, etc.Intermediate-level Excel skills and a BA II Plus calculator preferred.Must demonstrate an aptitude for building and understanding financial models.Experience in the valuation of income-producing properties is a plus, but not mandatory.Intellectual curiosity with a demonstrated enthusiasm for the commercial real estate industry.Excellent quantitative and analytical skills in combination with outstanding communication skills (both oral and written).Self-starter with sharp focus on details with an awareness of the bigger picture.Ability to manage time effectively and work under the pressure of multiple deadlines.A sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results in a challenging, fast-paced, environment.Ability to work effectively within a team and with all levels of personnel.Professional demeanor and positive attitude. Internal Number: 18032102 Create a Job Alert for Similar JobsAbout CBREWith broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world.  CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2017 revenues of $14.2 billion and more than 80,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included in the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #214 in 2017. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 17 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” in the real estate sector for six years in a row. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE.”  CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. Name: Senior Actuarial Analyst
Description: Work for one of the top actuarial consulting firms in the country!  As a Senior Actuarial Analyst at Willis Towers Watson, you will be making a valuable difference every day to our high-profile client organizations. You will apply your actuarial and project management expertise in the delivery of complex projects for Fortune 1000 and other not-for-profit organizations of similar size. You will help clients achieve their evolving business objectives by aligning their defined benefit, retiree welfare and defined contribution plans accordingly. The Role Our Retirement team combines expertise in retirement and investment consulting to support global organizations worldwide in designing, managing, administering and communicating all types of retirement plans. Whether a client has a defined benefit pension or a defined contribution plan, we work with them to determine the right approach to design, funding, investing, governing and employee engagement that fits their specific goals.  Our Senior Actuarial Analysts have the opportunity to support diverse projects related to mergers and acquisitions, plan design and strategy, asset liability studies, forecasting, early retirement windows, global consulting and other special projects as needed.  As you grow with clients and gain more expertise, you will play an increasingly larger role within your client team. This includes:Beginning to serve as the project manager and main liaison to the consultant which includes:Creating project plansMonitoring progress to deadlines and budgetScheduling and managing weekly/bi-weekly status meeting callsEnsuring appropriate and effective communication among team members and the clientDeliver work in accordance to project deadlinesDeliver on projects to meet or exceed client expectationsIncrease efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processesManage the execution of data collection, analyses and finalization of work product required for core work including:Large defined benefit and retiree medical plan valuationsCompletion of Form 5500s and other Government filingsNon-discrimination testingContribute to special projects such as plan design, asset/liability modelling, retirement plan risk assessment and mitigation, due diligence for mergers and acquisitions, collective bargaining agreements, global consulting, strategic workplace planning, total rewards strategies, and othersComplete work in accordance with ERISA, FASB, GASB, Department of Labor, Pension Protection Act and other Government regulationsSeek and participate in key learning and development opportunities/maintain steady progress through examsReview analytical work and draft documents prepared by more junior analystsContribute to the development of new tools and approachesMentor junior staff as appropriateEmployment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity.The Requirements:4 years’ experience conducting core valuation work in a client-service oriented environment with large corporate defined benefit plans; Name: Systems Analyst II-DCO-Windows Enterprise Support
Description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? It is time to embrace your Infinite Possibilities. This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it. PURPOSE: This position is for a Systems Analyst II on the Windows Enterprise Support team. This role will be responsible for the consultation, installation, maintenance, uptime, availability and operational health on the Windows Server platforms. This includes engineering new solutions, as well as maintaining the existing install base and consulting with business partners to provide solutions to their computing needs. Primary duties include troubleshooting and resolving issues with Microsoft Windows servers located in the company’s primary data center as well as throughout 600+ field locations in North America.  Our Windows Servers are 90 percent virtualized on VMWare ESXi hypervisor clusters which must also be installed, maintained and monitored for operational health.  Applications support teams are the primary customers for this position. This role will work with internal teams and vendors to develop and implement solutions on the Windows platforms.  Key performance indicators for this position include server availability, server hardware/operating system health, customer satisfaction ratings and server to admin ratios.  Due to the 24/7 support requirements of the position, the individual must be available for on-call duty after hours, on weekends, and on holidays. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:Administration of up to 1700+ Windows and VMWare servers in the Southwind Data Center Second and third level troubleshooting for all Intel/AMD based servers – last line of support for the Windows and VMware server platforms (Cisco UCS and HPE ProLiant hardware platforms)Second level troubleshooting for Active DirectoryImplementation and support for Microsoft DHCP in North American locationsAll aspects of support for the Citrix platform including engineering new technologiesAutomation and scripting to streamline support of the server platformsMaintaining revision levels for all hardware/software, virus definitionsProviding innovative solutions to challenging technical issuesManaging the overall Windows and VMWare server availability to meet customer SLA’sMust coordinate projects and support work with team members located in other countries and other time zonesServe as product owners for select tool sets on the platform with responsibilities including evaluating technologies directly with vendors, choosing solutions, engineering the rollouts and maintaining all ongoing supportPerform change management for the Windows and VMWare server platformsProvide technical expertise Act as a subject matter expert to other team members and other support teams and vendorsConsult on complex projectsEngineer new solutions involving servers and storage on Windows platformsAdvanced VMWare Knowledge - Provide Technical guidance on VMWare Platform ArchitectureProvide consultation to customers requesting information about application and/or data hostingTrain other support teams on their particular applications, specialized configurations on the platform as well as standard software to maintain the environmentProvide feedback relating to operational issuesEnsure that improvements in and/or changes to operations are implemented and monitored to increase efficiencyProvide documentation on advanced technical issuesKeep abreast of technological advances within the industryPowerShell scripting for task automationKnowledgeable on SAN and Network within Southwind Data CenterMaintain strong customer relationships and meet service level expectations for supported services: Meet or exceed SLO/SLA expectationsIdentify, test and implement changes to customer specific software and configurations to support overall application availabilityDesign, implement and monitor changes to operations and processesCommunicate with customers in the event of a server outage or other catastrophic eventKEY CHALLENGES:The internal environment, including interaction with others (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices: This position will meet challenges with an ever-changing workload. There are always acquisitions, divestitures, and other large-scale projects that involve this team. This work is very dynamic, fast paced and very demanding at times. Multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment is a requirement of this role.This individual should be comfortable with change. Due to acquisitions and other projects, individuals may be required to take on the engineering, support and maintenance of new equipment and new technologies with little or no training and without disruption to the business. Acquisitions introduce opportunities to learn and grow in new areas.This position will work closely with hardware and software vendors and other internal teams in order to implement solutions, and maintain best practices.The external environment, including technology, competition, markets: This position will meet challenges due to the ever-changing nature of the technology. New hardware, operating systems and supporting software must be maintained at all times. Constant hardware and software upgrade projects are a challenge.This position is always challenged to work in the most efficient manner. The team must always be the lowest cost provider when compared to other sources. This position may meet challenges due to the remote nature of the work and the fast pace.The work itself, e.g., problems, opportunities, change: Deliver technology to our customers fast enough to capitalize on any perceived competitive advantageMaintain a focus on technologies that are consistent with IP’s long-term strategies Develop and use consistent processes and standards related to technology implementation, deployment, operation, and supportSCOPE: This position will have the potential to positively affect the business by providing quick, reliable technology solutions and service offerings relating to the Windows server platform. This position is part of a team that is responsible for up to 1700+ data center servers. Hardware and Operating system support and solutions are the core offerings of the team. To those ends, the team is end to end responsible for server availability, server monitoring, vulnerability management as well as solutions engineering and ongoing support. In addition, the team is responsible end to end for the support of the Citrix, Cisco UCS, and VMware ESXi environments.  The candidate should be able to work with minimum supervision. He/she will interact directly with vendors, internal support teams, application developers/owners, and end users for the purpose of supporting the Windows server environment.  Most assignments are broad, usually requiring originality and ingenuity. The person must possess the ability to run and manage projects on his or her own. Typically, this person will have 8-10 years minimum of professional technical experience in the areas specified.  Teamwork is critical to this team’s success. Individuals placed into this team should be highly motivated, energetic, and results oriented. High expectations are the norm.  This person may be responsible for training and mentoring junior level team members. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:The suitable candidate for this role should possess: Expert knowledge with Microsoft Windows Server platforms Expert knowledge and support experience with VMware (certification preferred)Expert knowledge of server hardware (Compute, Memory, Storage, etc.)Expert knowledge of common enterprise services such as AD, WINS, DNS, and DHCPExperience with Cisco UCS computing preferredIn depth knowledge of various types of enterprise storage devicesPowerShell ScriptingWindows MCSE or MCITP strongly preferredEnterprise server administration experience requiredCitrix support knowledge is strongly preferred (certification preferred)Network experience for troubleshooting purposesExcellent people and communication skills, dealing with all levels of management and personnelStrength in the following competencies: Action Oriented, Dealing with Ambiguity, Customer Focus, Directing Others, Drive for Results, Timely Decision Making and Decision Quality, Functional / Technical Skills, Composure, Learning on the Fly, Listening, Project Management, Perseverance, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Patience, Time management, Written and Oral CommunicationsBachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Business Management, or related field preferredMinimum of 10+ years’ overall IT experience in progressively challenging rolesCOMMENTS: This position requires a senior level individual with at least 7 years of technical knowledge in Windows Server operating systems, Active Directory, and VMware products.  International Paper is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Veterans.  Memphis TN 38197

Name: PeopleSoft HCM Functional Analyst-SME (Navy)
Description: Working at Macro Solutions, a leading provider of IT and management consulting services, is an opportunity to collaborate with great people who have a passion for the services they provide to our clients. We are currently looking for an experienced PeopleSoft HCMFunctional Analyst/Subject Matter Expert-Navy (SME)to join one of our long term Federal (DoD) projects in Millington, TN. An active secret (DoD) security clearance is required. Macro Solutions offers flexible FTE, W2 Hourly and Corp to Corp terms.The PeopleSoft HCMFunctional Analyst/Subject Matter Expert (SME) analyzes business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business information processing requirements for the Navy’s Human Resources system.Key Responsibilities:Coordinate with customer, business and technology teams to ascertain system requirements, such as program functions, output requirements, input data acquisition, and system techniques and controls.Serve as Senior SME for the analysis, evaluation, modification, configuration, testing and implementation of enterprise wide applications specific to PeopleSoft HR v9.1/9.2.Responsible for decomposing high level functional requirements and writing system and technical requirements for development and testing.Interface with and provide oversight to test team(s) to clarify requirements and validate that they are designing and testing to the customer's requirements.Prepare application system specifications.Plan, implement and coordinate system upgrades, enhancements or maintenanceEducation + Experience:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent US Navy Functional Experience3-6 years of business management experience to include requirements elicitation, development and testingDocument requirements management experience4+ years of strong PeopleSoft HCM experienceUS Naval Reserve field experience and knowledge of reserve management database systems.Knowledge of US Naval reserve administrative and HR Policies.Knowledge of US Navy retirements and separations including the DD214s.Possess experience in documenting functional, business intelligence analytics, and reporting requirements.Secret clearance; Interim Secret minimumMacro Solutions is a woman-owned IT and management consulting firm that helps government organizations select, implement, integrate and maintain critical business solutions. A relationship company at our core, we pride ourselves on building high-touch, high-trust environments for our clients and partners, at every level of our business. Assessed at CMMI Maturity Level 3 for both Development and Services and ISO 9001:2015 certification, Macro delivers honest, powerful results from the inside, outward.Deeply invested in advancing long lasting employee relationships, our distinctive Consultant Care program ensures that our employees are always a priority at every level of the organization and has been integral to our 94% employee retention rate.Along with a supportive environment and culture that thrives on dreaming big, getting things done and having fun together, Macro Solutions offers employees a full suite of competitive benefits, including health, dental, 401(k), and paid time off. If you would like to learn more about Macro Solutions, are interested in joining our team, or would like to learn more about our Consultant Care program visit our website.Macro Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
